review_body: .C'est en substance ce que déclara Tony Banks (clavier de GENESIS) peu de temps après la sortie du vrai 2ème (ou faux 3ème) album de "son" groupe. Le mot échec pour décrire l'accueil de "From Genesis To Revelation" ne convient même pas puisque la petite histoire dit que cet opus fut classé, à sa sortie, dans la catégorie "musique religieuse" (sic).Parlons plutôt de passage inaperçu. "Trespass", malgré un bon accueil du monde journalistique britannique, recevra presque le même accueil que son prédecesseur de la part du grand public. Anthony Phillips jette l'éponge, le batteur aussi, bref, il est grand temps de remettre le groupe sur les rails.Un certain Phil Collins est recruté pour les sessions d'enregistrement et soudain, la magie s'opère.Le groupe gagne en fantaisie et en légèreté, les textes de Gabriel semblent se marier avec la musique ("Harrold The Barrel".) et la guitare de Steve Hackett fait des merveilles ("Fountain Of Salmacis").Phil préfigure même son futur rôle de chanteur dans "For Absent Friends" ! L'achimie semble trouvée enfin mais l'album ne se vend pas.Ou beaucoup trop peu. La surprise viendra d'Italie où "Nursery Cryme" (jeu de mot avec "Nursery RHYME", nom d'une comptine britannique)se classera à la surprise de tous, 2ème des charts ! Cet album marque le début de l'âge d'or d'un (voire DU) pilier du Rock Progressif.Même si l'ensemble a terriblement vieilli, ses mélodies surannées demeurent intemporelles par leur qualité intrinsèque. Si vous devez commencer avec GENESIS, ne commencez pas par celui-là mais dés que vous serez accro, ne passez surtout pas à côté.
translated_review: It is in essence what Tony Banks said (Genesis Keyboard) shortly after the exit of the true 2nd (or false 3rd) album of "his" group. The word failure to describe the reception of "from Genesis to Revelation" does not even suit since the little story says that this opus was classified, at its exit, in the category "Religious Music" (sic). . "Trespas", despite a good reception of the British journalistic world, will almost receive the same welcome as its predecessor on the part of the general public. Anthony Phillips throws the sponge, the drummer too, in short, it is high time to put the group back on the rails.A Some Phil Collins is recruited for the recording sessions and suddenly, magic takes place. The group wins in Fantasy and lightness, Gabriel's texts seem to marry music ("Harrold The Barrel".) And Steve Hackett's guitar does wonders ("Fountain of Salmacis"). Phil Even his future role as a singer in " For Absent Friends "! The Achimie seems finally found but the album does not sell. We too little. The surprise will come from Italy where "Nursery Cryme" (word set with "Nursery Rhyme", name of a British nursery rhyme) will rank to the surprise of all, 2nd of the charts! This album marks the beginning of the golden age of a (or even) pillar of the progressive rock.Meme if the set has terribly aged, its over-year melodies remain timeless by their intrinsic quality. If you have to start with Genesis, do not start with that one but as soon as you are addicted, do not go next.

product_title: Standing in Another Man's Grave (A Rebus Novel)
review_body: *WARNING - CONTAINS SPOILERS*  It has been a long time since I read a crime novel. As well as having a background in criminology, I found myself jaded by the likes of CSI and then just outright put off the genre by Patricia Cornwell.  However, when my wife said that this was the best Rebus book that she'd read to date (and she's read all of them), I thought I'd give it ago.  In terms of plot, a number of women have gone missing from the A9 over the years and John Rebus (now retired from the Police Service, but trying to find a way back in) is a civilian in The Cold Case Unit where he is handed a possible link to all of them, including an active case of a Missing Person who disappeared only a few weeks prior.  Bad things: - the first 80 pages centre solely on Rebus. He interacts with other characters, but you get not real sense of their persona or off-page events. It is a very narrow focus, and I wanted to know more of what was going with some of the other players.  - Rebus is a quasi-machiavellian character. He cuts corners to get the job done, including fraternising with criminals and lying to his colleagues. He's not a villain per se. but he right on border. Now this is not a bad thing, and some of his more sociopathic scenes (ie; when he answers Clarke's phone and then NEVER gives her the message) are quite good. My problem is this: his colleagues know that he is a lying, manipulative, generally speaking a dinosaur of a Police Officer. and not only do they still let him in (when they don't have to), but they also go along with him, knowingly allowing themselves to be played. I know a few serving officers, and there is no way they would stand for that behaviour, especially from a civilian.  - The ending. There is no two ways about this - it is awful. I don't what happened. Maybe the author was running over his word count, or the publishers edited it into the disappointing mess it became. But Iwas so very disappointed, and for two reasons.  1 - The villain is identified, and for a hundred or so pages is defiant and denies the case built against him - and that was very good. And then, over two or three pages, he dissolves into a quivering mess who confesses everything. because a spotty teenager physically threatens him. This is an individual who has murdered 5 people and gone to great lengths to conceal their bodies and clean up after himself - and generally speaking is as hard as nails - and when a boy intimidates him, he folds? Nope, I'm not buying it.  2 - We never understand the driving forces behind the criminal mind. We are never offered even a shred of a reason behind the psychopathic nature, or why he left the calling card he did. Instead, Rebus just says: \"I don't think he even knows himself\" I found this incredibly frustrating, and then they crowbarred the book title into the closing lines and the whole sorry mess jarred.  Now, with all of the above in mind, there are many redeeming features of this book.  - There is some great use of conflict. From the start, we are presented with Missing Persons, Rebus' desire to get back into the Police Service, his dislike of authority, the politics of career officers, the shadow of The Complaints dept. Lots of conflict, lots of little quests going on - really good stuff that when woven together give rise to a believable world.  - There are some great twists and plot developments. My favourite was the the Missing Person who was not a Missing Person. although I was disappointed in such an obvious reason given for her running away.  - the display of Rebus being an outmoded dinosaur was great. I loved the analogy to him being vinyl in a digital age (he cannot get a handle on smartphones or twitter). but yet, like vinyl, remains popular and even contemplates a comeback.  - Some people have criticised the overuse of the A9. Personally, I think this is unfair, and I enjoyed the sense of this concrete river feeding the most rural parts of a wild country, and the descriptions of the cars alternately as workhorses and warhorses presented a good counterpoint to the rural life that they visited.  So, in the end, 3/5. Not the worst book ever written, but I felt it could have been so much more. I guess the acid test is this: Will I read more of Rankin's work? Yes, I probably will. but I'm going to give him a break for a few months.

review_headline: Fantastisch eingespielt, Titelauswahl nicht ganz optimal...
review_body: Schlichtweg fantastisch, was der (inzwischen etwas füllige und kahle) Brite da 1993 in Modena ablieferte: Gabriel selbst war in bester Musizierlaune und durchwegs gut bei Stimme, dazu spielte eine an sich recht kleine Band (allen voran der superbe Drummer Manu Katché, der Bass-Zampano Tony Levin und Gabriel-Stammgitarrist David Rhodes) unglaublich kompakt und ohne nennenswerte Ausfälle vor allem Songs aus der Phase 86-92: Und da ist auch schon mein Hauptkritikpunkt: Man hätte sich auch den einen oder anderen älteren Titel gewünscht (von Gabriels ersten drei Alben), dafür vielleicht auf bestenfalls mediokre Titel wie \"Steam\" vom 92er- Album \"Us\" gerne verzichtet: \"Here Comes The Flood\" und \"Games Without Frontiers\" gehen z.B. ganz besonders ab. Trotzdem: Nummern wie \"Secret World\", \"Digging In The Dirt\" oder \"Don't Give Up\" klingen auch weit über ein Jahrzehnt später noch fantastisch. Gut, daß das konserviert worden ist - mir ist übrigens wurscht, ob da ein wenig nachgebessert wurde oder nicht. Man merkt nichts davon, und nur Puristen oder Leute, die wirklich dort waren, dürften sich daran stoßen.
translated_review: Simply fantastic, what the (meanwhile a bit filling and bald) Brit out there in 1993 in Modena delivered: Gabriel himself was in the best musician mood and consistently good in voice, to play a rather small band in itself (especially the superb drummer Manu Katché, the bass -Zampano Tony Levin and Gabriel-Stammgitarist David Rhodes) incredibly compact and without significant failures, especially songs from the Phase 86-92: And there is my main criterion point: You would have liked the one or the other senior title (from Gabriel's first Three albums), maybe on the best case of Mediokre titles like \ "Steam \" from the 92 album \ "US \" likes: \ "Here Comes the Flood \" and \ "Games Without Frontiers \" go out, for example. Nevertheless, numbers like \ "Secret World \", \ "Digging in the Dirt \" or \ "Do not Give Up \" sound fantastic even more than a decade later. Good that this has been preserved - by the way, it's wealth of whether a little has been improved or not. You do not notice anything about it, and only purists or people who were really there should encounter themselves.

product_title: Proof of Heaven: A Neurosurgeon's Journey into the Afterlife
review_body: Bewegend und interessant. Eine ausgewogene Mischung aus wissenschaftlichen (medizinischen) Erklärungen und persönlicher Geschichte. Für Skeptiker von einem ehemaligen Skeptiker. Für alle, die (noch) nicht überzeugt sind, aber offen für gute Argumente, und prinzipiell interessiert an dem Thema.
translated_review: Moving and interesting.A balanced mix of scientific (medical) explanations and personal history.For skeptics from a former skeptic.For those who (yet) are not convinced, but open to good arguments, and in principle interested in the topic.

review_headline: A Single Fault Doesn't Crack The Whole Thing!
review_body: First up, this is a classic (fantastic) album.  A sort of original world music record, mesmeric, haunting, enchantingly sinister using rhythms and vocal styles outside of the usual rock norm.  Well that's what really matters but some other comments:  1 It arrived in timely fashion, appropriately packaged, but  2 I had to return it because track 6 \"Jump Sturdy\" was faulty.  3 I'm still giving five stars because it was replaced promptly (of course at no cost).  There was a slight delay, but that was due to the icey, snowy weather and the coldest winter in almost fourteen years (well, acutally alot more).    4 The lyric page is quite readable, though the sleeve notes are microscopic.  But of course the cd package is about an eighth of the size of the original long player version (long players remember those?)  5 At about £5.50 this was a great bargain.  Every home should have one.  Krishing.

product_title: The Variational Principles of Mechanics (Dover Books on Physics)
review_headline: The best book for get a thorough grasp for mechanics
review_body: Just as the title, the book is very informative in all aspects. First, the author shown his far-reaching understanding between principles and their correlation to each others. More, the geometrical treatment for those principles on pure mathematical view is explained and described in very clear and beautiful manner. Last, the story behind those great achievement are represented and is quite helpful to learn the concepts and its reason with historical logic.  p.s I known the author from his outstanding work in approximation solution of eigenvalue problem in Finite element analysis.

product_title: The Wheels On The Bus: Favourite Nursery Rhymes (BBC Audio Children's)
review_body: I bought this CD for my grandaughter, she's started singing rhymes so I thought it would be a good idea for the car or just indoors, she didn't recognise any of the songs much, the one's she did know where sung so slowly she got bored and walked off. So. from an 18month old's point of view, I'd say this was not worth the money, we've not played it since.  Try something more modern that they know, and sung in a more upbeat fashion.

product_title: Legal Architecture: Justice, Due Process and the Place of Law
review_body: SOME TRENCHANT COMMENTARY ON THE ARCHITECTURE OF JUSTICE  An appreciation by Phillip Taylor MBE and Elizabeth Taylor of Richmond Green Chambers  Does the architecture of a court building necessarily affect the outcome of the trials that take place within its walls? You might say it shouldn't. But Linda Mulcahy, Professor of Law at the London School of Economics, argues convincingly that it might' and presents a body of overwhelming evidence that it does!  Mulcahy asserts that the legitimacy of the trial derives from the setting in which its rituals take place ' in other words: prescribed procedures'codes of conduct'the law itself'and the resulting documentation. 'Public buildings,' she states, 'can both inspire and degrade those within them; they can calm or oppress.'  We are tempted to digress here by saying that this utterance should be carved into the stonework on the front of the RIBA's London HQ in Portland Place ' just to remind those guys to have a care in designing public edifices such as court buildings, in which decisions are made that affect the lives of others, often for generations. Ms Mulcahy also quotes the American Chief Justice Hennessey, who, in 1984, pointed out that 'our courthouses'are not merely buildings, rooms and furniture, but are rather monuments that evoke several centuries of human effort and progress'.  Describing her book quite modestly as a monograph, Mulcahy reveals her extensive and detailed knowledge of this surprisingly vast subject in closely argued yet graceful prose. We've used the word 'surprisingly' because, as is pointed out, there is rather a dearth of comment, or research or informed observation on this subject' so far.  Published by the Routledge Law, this important book indeed deserves urgent and critical attention. If barristers and commentators like us find themselves dismayed by the often forbidding exteriors of so many courts, as well as by the almost complete lack of basic amenities for those who use them ' we can only imagine how much and how ordinary people ' including innocent witnesses ' are thoroughly -- and unnecessarily -- cowed and intimidated.  Legal dinosaurs (and there are plenty still about) who think that courts should strike terror into the souls of all who venture therein will not like this book. Most practitioners, though, will heartily welcome this clear-eyed examination by an incisive mind, of the very real issues of 'legal geography' raised in this very readable work ' especially in the light of new technologies which now assist the processes justice.  To facilitate further research and inquiry, the book lists sources, cases and legislation' plus, there's an amazing sixteen page bibliography, and useful index at the back to dispel the myth that they are just 'mere buildings'!hem  we can only imagine how much and how ordinary people  including innocent witnesses  are thoroughly -- and unnecessarily -- cowed and intimidated.    Legal dinosaurs (and there are plenty still about) who think that courts should strike terror into the souls of all who venture therein will not like this book. Most practitioners, though, will heartily welcome this clear-eyed examination by an incisive mind, of the very real issues of legal geography raised in this very readable work  especially in the light of new technologies which now assist the processes justice.    To facilitate further research and inquiry, the book lists sources, cases and legislation plus, theres an amazing sixteen page bibliography, and useful index at the back to dispel the myth that they are just mere buildings!
translated_review: SOME TRENCHANT COMMENTARY ON THE ARCHITECTURE OF JUSTICE  An appreciation by Phillip Taylor MBE and Elizabeth Taylor of Richmond Green Chambers  Does the architecture of a court building necessarily affect the outcome of the trials that take place within its walls? You might say it shouldn't. But Linda Mulcahy, Professor of Law at the London School of Economics, argues convincingly that it might' and presents a body of overwhelming evidence that it does!  Mulcahy asserts that the legitimacy of the trial derives from the setting in which its rituals take place ' in other words: prescribed procedures'codes of conduct'the law itself'and the resulting documentation. 'Public buildings,' she states, 'can both inspire and degrade those within them; they can calm or oppress.'  We are tempted to digress here by saying that this utterance should be carved into the stonework on the front of the RIBA's London HQ in Portland Place ' just to remind those guys to have a care in designing public edifices such as court buildings, in which decisions are made that affect the lives of others, often for generations. Ms Mulcahy also quotes the American Chief Justice Hennessey, who, in 1984, pointed out that 'our courthouses'are not merely buildings, rooms and furniture, but are rather monuments that evoke several centuries of human effort and progress'.  Describing her book quite modestly as a monograph, Mulcahy reveals her extensive and detailed knowledge of this surprisingly vast subject in closely argued yet graceful prose. We've used the word 'surprisingly' because, as is pointed out, there is rather a dearth of comment, or research or informed observation on this subject' so far.  Published by the Routledge Law, this important book indeed deserves urgent and critical attention. If barristers and commentators like us find themselves dismayed by the often forbidding exteriors of so many courts, as well as by the almost complete lack of basic amenities for those who use them ' we can only imagine how much and how ordinary people ' including innocent witnesses ' are thoroughly -- and unnecessarily -- cowed and intimidated.  Legal dinosaurs (and there are plenty still about) who think that courts should strike terror into the souls of all who venture therein will not like this book. Most practitioners, though, will heartily welcome this clear-eyed examination by an incisive mind, of the very real issues of 'legal geography' raised in this very readable work ' especially in the light of new technologies which now assist the processes justice.  To facilitate further research and inquiry, the book lists sources, cases and legislation' plus, there's an amazing sixteen page bibliography, and useful index at the back to dispel the myth that they are just 'mere buildings'!hem  we can only imagine how much and how ordinary people  including innocent witnesses  are thoroughly -- and unnecessarily -- cowed and intimidated.    Legal dinosaurs (and there are plenty still about) who think that courts should strike terror into the souls of all who venture therein will not like this book. Most practitioners, though, will heartily welcome this clear-eyed examination by an incisive mind, of the very real issues of legal geography raised in this very readable work  especially in the light of new technologies which now assist the processes justice.    To facilitate further research and inquiry, the book lists sources, cases and legislation plus, theres an amazing sixteen page bibliography, and useful index at the back to dispel the myth that they are just mere buildings!

review_body: Achtung : bis auf wenige eingestreute Jazzparts handelt es sich hier um eine Komposition aus der klassischen Musik. Coleman ließ das Ớrchester in hohen, schwebenden Tonlagen spielen und flog damit tatsächlich bis in den Himmel von Amerika, wo ein euphorisches Gefühl der Freiheit und ein kritischer Blick aus der Distanz auf das Land unter ihm aufeinander treffen. Bei allen musiktheoretischen und interpretatorischen Implikationen lässt diese faszinierende Musik auch den oberflächlichen Hörer durch den schieren Wohlklang dieser Aufnahme nicht ungerührt.

review_headline: Die erste DVD, die den 6. Stern verdient !!
review_body: Endlich, das Warten hat ein Ende. Was am 9. Dezember in den DVD-Player wandert, dürfte wohl zum genialsten gehören, was je von einem Laser abgetastet wurde. Hier noch zu erwähnen, wie wichtig Pink Floyd in der Geschichte der Musik sind, kann man sich wohl sparen. In jeder Beziehung handelt es sich um DIE Band der Superlative. Einzigartige Live-Shows, die ersten echten Surround-Mixes (und das vor 70000 und mehr Zuschauern) und den wahrscheinlich brilliantesten Sound, den man je bei einem Konzert erlebt hat. Und exakt dieser Sound wird nun endlich auch im heimischen Kino Wirklichkeit. Ich kann jedem Musik- und Klangverrückten empfehlen, die Nachbarn vorzuwarnen, alle Regler nach rechts zu drehen und sich einer 2 1/2-stündigen Klang und Licht-Orgie hinzugeben, wie man sie vielleicht nie wieder zu sehen bekommt. Kleiner Tipp: Wer leider nie das Glück hatte, die Herren Gilmour, Mason, Wright und natürlich auch Waters live zu erleben, dem kann ich nur raten, den Veranstaltungskalender immer wieder nach THE AUSTRALIAN PINK FLOYD SHOW zu durchforsten. Die Jungs geniessen inzwischen Support von allerhöchster Stelle und zwar von Dave Gilmour persönlich. Shine on .

Unique live shows, the first genuine surround mixes (and that before 70000 and more viewers) and the most of the most brilliant sound you ever experienced at a concert. And exactly this sound will finally become a reality in the domestic cinema. I can recommend any music and soundprinted to wait the neighbors to turn all the controllers to the right and add themselves to a 2 1/2-hour sound and light orgy, as you may never get to see again. Small tip: If you have never been lucky enough to experience the gentlemen Gilmour, Mason, Wright, and of course Waters Live, I can only advise you to scare the event calendar again and again to The Australian Pink Floyd Show. The guys are now enjoying support from the highest place by Dave Gilmour personally. Shine on.

review_body: Natürlich kann man manche Filme einfach nicht mögen, aus welchen Gründen auch immer - das heißt aber noch lange nicht, dass es sich um einen schlechten Film handelt .    Fight Club ist ein absolutes MUSS für alle, die sich ernsthaft für Film interessieren. Mein Kriterium für einen guten Film: Auch (oder grade) bei wiederholtem Gucken muss er noch Neues, Überraschendes bieten. Und das ist hier der Fall. Dann fällt einem z.B. irgendwann auf, dass Fincher uns auf äußerst raffinierte Weise schon vor dem \"Kennenlernen\" von Jack und Tyler im Flugzeug mit ihm bekannt macht, fast ohne das man es bemerkt. Oder die ständig wiederkehrenden religiösen Anspielungen und deutlichen Zitate aus dem Zen-Busddhismus usw. usw.    Sicher ist das ein \"Männerfilm\" (sagt zumindest meine Frau). Aber wenn man sich von den Gewaltszenen sofort abwendet und sie nur oberflächlich betrachtet, nimmt man sich die Chance, zu erkennen, um was es in diesem Film eigentlich gehen könnte. Und das rauszubekommen ist mindestens so spannend wie Jacks langsames \"Erwachen\".    Viel Spaß beim (nochmaligen) Sehen!
translated_review: Of course, some films can not like, for whatever reason, but that does not mean that it is a bad movie. Fight Club is an absolute must for those who are seriously interested in film. My criterion for a good movie: Also (or grade) at repeated look, he still has to offer new, surprising. And that's the case here. Then a e.g. at some point, that Fincher uses us on a very sophisticated way before the \ "to get to know \" by Jack and Tyler in the plane with him, almost without that you notice it. Or the constantly recurring religious allusions and significant quotes from Zen-BusDhism, etc. etc. Surely that is a "male film" (at least says my wife). But if you turn away from the violent scenes and only superficially considered, you take the chance to see what it could go in this movie. And that is at least as exciting as Jack's slow \ "awakening \". Have fun (otherwise) see!

review_body: Einer der schlechtesten Filme, die ich je gesehen habe, oder eben nicht, denn trotz mehrmaligem Ansetzen, konnte ich ihn nie fertig ansehen, er war einfach zu sinnlos. Nicht einmal die Spezialeffekte waren stark genug, um mich wenigstens für ein paar Minuten zu fesseln. Die ganze Euphorie ist mir total unverständlich.
translated_review: One of the worst films I've ever seen, or not, because despite repeating several times, I could never finish him, he was just too meaningless.Not even the special effects were strong enough to captivate me at least for a few minutes.The whole euphoria is totally incomprehensible to me.

review_body: . im positiven Sinn.    Bewertet wird hier nicht der Artikel, sondern der Film.    Wer sich auf diesen besonderen Film einlässt, erlebt Bilder, die er bis dahin so noch nicht gesehen hat.     Ich muss sagen, absolut überrascht gewesen zu sein, als ich aus dem Kino trat.  Sehr unkonventionelle und mutige Machart, die einen durch seine teilweise übertrieben klar dargestellten Szenerien fast denken lässt, man schaue ein Musikvideo, indem alles möglichst aufwendig in 3 Minuten komprimiert werden muss, bevor man wieder durchatmen kann und die durchweg atemberaubenden Bildkompositionen bestaunen darf.    Es ist oft der Eindruck entstanden, dass es dem Film nicht so sehr um die Story geht, die den Zuschauer zu einem bestimmten Ende führt, sondern eben mehr um den Moment - was ich persönlich sehr genossen habe.    Die DVD wird definitiv ein Pflichtkauf sein, denn auch dadurch möchte ich ein Appell an alle Filmemacher senden, öfter mal mutig zu sein, so wie bei Hanna.    Tipp: Man sollte sich durch den Trailer nicht davon abbringen lassen, ihn sich anzusehen ;)

I have to say, being absolutely surprised when I stepped out of the cinema. Very unconventional and courageous style that can be almost thinking of a scenery that is clearly clearly illustrated by its partially exaggerated scenes, look a music video by compressing everything as expensive as possible in 3 minutes before being allowed to breathe again and the consistently stunning image compositions can be admired. It is often the impression that the movie does not go so much about the story, which leads the viewer to a certain end, but more about the moment - what I really enjoyed. The DVD will definitely be a compulsory purchase, because even this I would like to send an appeal to all filmmakers, more often to be brave, as with Hanna. review_body:
Unglaublich facettenreich, so beschreibt man am besten das neue Album von Christina Aguilera - \"Stripped\", denn genauso hört es sich an!
Vermutlich ist für jeden Geschmack etwas dabei von kraftvoll gesungenen Songs wie \"Fighter\" oder, das allseits bekannte, \"Dirrty\" bis hin zu Baladen wie \"The Voice within\", wo sie wirklich zeigt wie unglaublich ihre Stimme ist!
Man sollte generell nicht erwarten, das Album sei im Stil von Dirrty gehalten - Nein! Im Gegenteil. Sie Experimentiert auf diesem Meisterstück gekonnt mit verschiedensten Stilen!
Insgesamt also ein wirklich hochkarätiges Album! Man hört bei jedem Lied, dass Christina nun voll und ganz bei der Sache ist wenn sie singt, denn endlich kann sie die Musik machen, die sie immer schon machen wollte! Noch im Booklet der CD lässt sich nachlesen, wie froh sie ist, dass sie nicht mehr als niedliche Pop-prinzessin vermarktet wird und somit kommen wir erst jetzt in den Genuss ihrer WAHREN FÄHIGKEITEN! WIRKLICH SUPER!
translated_review:
Incredibly multi-rich, so best one describes the new album of Christina Aguilera - \ "Stripped \", because it sounds like it!
Probably for every taste something of powerfully sung songs like \ "Fighter \" or,The well-known, \ "Dirrty \" to Baladen like \ "The Voice Within", where she really shows how incredibly her voice is!
You should not expect generally, the album was held in the style of Dirrty -No!On the contrary.She experiments on this masterpiece skillfully with a variety of styles! Overall, a really high-caliber album!One hears every song that Christina is now full and completely in the matter when she sings, because finally she can make the music she always wanted to do!Still in the booklet of the CD can be read, as glad she is that she is no longer marketed as a cute pop princess and so we will only enjoy your true skills!REALLY GREAT!

review_body: Après avoir fait beaucoup parlé de lui avec son premier album, 2pac enchaîne avec « Strictly 4 my niggaz », qui est une bombe hardcore contenant des hits en puissance. Pour les bombes hardcore j'adore « Holler If ya hear me », LE SURPUISANT TRIO WESTCOAST \"LAST WORDZ\" AVEC ICE CUBE ET ICE T, et \"Souljah's revenche\". Pour les hits, 2 titres sortent du lots : le beau « Keep ya head up » et « I get around ».
translated_review: After having spoken a lot of him with his first album, 2pac chained with "Strictly 4 My Niggaz", which is a hardcore bomb containing high hits.For hardcore bombs I love "Holler If Ya Hear Me", the longwind Trio Westcoast \ "Last Wordz \" with Ice Cube and Ice T, and \ "Souljah's Revenge \".For hits, 2 titles come out of the lots: the beautiful "Keep Ya Head Up" and "I Get Around".

product_title: LEGO The Lord of the Rings 9476: The Orc Forge
review_body: This is a decent rendering of something that comprised a relatively small scene in the film, the forge at Isengard used to build the Uruk-Hai Army by Saruman. The detail in this product is excellent, as with all LoTR sets, with the \"White Hand\" emblazoned on the Uruk armour, and great touches such as the hair and facial features on the minifigures.  It was a relatively straightforward build which shouldn't challenge many, but at no point particularly impressed me with the ingenuity of the design.  It really is pretty much as you'd see on the box illustration, with none of the engineering elements that make Lego an enduring success.  The only part that you could say even approaches this trademark \"Lego-ness\" is the small aperture which you can push the Uruks through to simulate them being \"birthed\" as in the memorable scene from the film.  This is represented here by a simple hole in the base to push a minifigure through, and you have to remove bricks at the front to make this happen; there's no clever hinged \"door\" or automated mechanism. The inclusion of the light brick which illuminates the forge, whilst interesting, feels apologetic and gimmicky in the absence of any real appeal for what is basically a wheel with a big slope and a bucket at the bottom.  One of my pet hates is the inclusion of separate, smaller parts which are easily lost by children, and have no custom storage space within the set itself.  In this case, part of the set seems to be a rather pointless additional \"pit\", and there is also an anvil and extra armour for the Uruks themselves which, while nice to have, are easily mislaid when they have nowhere to be stored.  Also included are small studs which are supposed to represent the metals used to fashion the armour.  Again, a nice touch, but very easily lost, and could be just as simply represented by a child's imagination.  This also brings me onto another part of the set which is disappointing - the lackof inclusion of the Saruman figure, which I would speculate is purely because of the prospect of the upcoming \"Wizard Battle\" set to be released in mid-2013.  There were no such qualms including identical Aragorn figures both in the Weathertop AND Helm's Deep sets, so I am not entirely sure why this figure should be omitted here.  Finally, what was again disappointing was the fact that a small required piece of the final build was missing.  I contacted Lego and they were their usual friendly and efficient selves in arranging for it to be sent. In fairness it was not a critical part of the build (part of one of the spokes of the wheel), but all the same I feel I should include this.  All in all, this is a curiosity.  Not complete or fun enough to stand alone as a must-have product, not clever or interesting enough to appeal to a collector, nor really essential enough to the story to be really at home in the overall series of Lego LoTR sets.  It's mildly diverting, but really too expensive for what it is.  For a little more money, the Weathertop set is a much more rewarding buy - the Orc Forge should be considered for completists only.

product_title: Teva Riva Leather eVent 8827 Herren Trekking- & Wanderschuhe
review_headline: Onkel, was hast Du für schwere Füße?
review_body: Die Qualität der Verarbeitung und der Materialen ist schon klasse. Der Schuh wirkt etwas wie eine Sonderanfertigung eines orthopädischen Schuhmachers am Fuß. Ich habe einen schlanken Fuß. Birkenstock-schmal. Eher Lowa und Timberland statt Meindl. Obwohl der Schuh im Stand am Fuß gut sitzt, schwimme ich beim Gehen im Schuh. Da die schwere Sole im Fußballenbereich beim Gehen nicht einknickt, schlappt meine Ferse bei jedem Schritt etwas nach oben. Daher habe ich den Schuh zurück geschickt.
translated_review: The quality of the processing and the materials is already great.The shoe looks something like a custom order of an orthopedic shoemaker at the foot.I have a slender foot.Birkenstock narrow.Rather Lowa and Timberland instead of Meindl.Although the shoe sits well in the stand on the foot, I swim while walking in the shoe.Since the heavy brine in the football area does not kink while walking, my heel slips slightly at each step.Therefore, I sent the shoe back.

review_headline: Son of a Serial Killer (Murder in the Genes Trilogy Book 1) (English Edition)
review_body: \"Actions are sometimes performed in a masterly and most cunning way, while the direction of the actions is deranged and dependent on various morbid impressions - it's like a dream\" This is a quote from Fyodor Dostoyevsky's famous novel, Crime and Punishment, but it may as well be describing Ben Green, the troubled young protagonist of the novel \"Son of a Serial Killer\" by Jams N. Roses.  This novel is truly frightening, but not because of the string of murders that are being left unsolved. It is frightening and terrifying because of what is happening to Ben and what most of us are probably afraid of even if we don't readily admit it. Ben is losing his mind and his sanity, and he knows it. He's fighting back, trying to get back to his former self, normal, nice, and balanced, but that goal gets further and further out of reach as the story progresses. Just the thought of watching myself lose my mind and not being able to do anything about it sent chills down my spine.  Ben's thinking patterns are placed at the center of this thriller, and it is Ben who largely drives the plot. Ớne of the most powerful recurring images in this book is a mirror in which Ben sees not only his old familiar self but his new self, the personality full of malice and evil, that is gradually taking over his life. \"What am I doing with my life\" and \"What was I born to be\" are some of the questions that Ben asks of the reflection in the mirror. And it takes him a long time to find the right answers. The ending of the book is tragic by conventional standards, but I have to quote Dostoyevsky again who said, \"the greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness,\" and in that sense, Ben's story ends happily.  But it's not just Ben's character that is interesting and multidimensional. So are the secondary characters. Detective Summers is fighting her own demons as she is trying to solve the case of The Phantom killer: not only does she have a personal connection to the case, but she also has trouble managing her stress level and resorts to self-destructive measures but effective to keep herself balanced, ironic and counterintuitive as it seems. The benefits of counterintuitive thinking is another strong theme in this novel. There's a long-time girlfriend who turns out to be less loyal and less caring than a woman who was supposed to be just a one-night stand. There's Ben's complicated relationship with his parents, both of whom seem to love him and want the best for him, but that also turns out to be not the way he perceived most of his life.  The novel starts out with a quote about genetic disorders that are already present in a human being before birth, and it comes full-circle to that same point at the end when controversial questions are raised about life and death. Is it right to end a life if this life is bound to create more death once it is fully developed? Can our minds, medicated, self-medicated, or otherwise, be more powerful than the genetics we have inherited?  This novel is deeper and richer than one might think just by reading the sample on amazon. Some reviewers have commented that they were turned off by the graphic descriptions in the first few pages, but they should have kept reading. I believe that the intent of those first few pages is to alert the readers to the idea that this novel will not shy away from deepest and darkest corners of the human soul and the human existence. But despite a lot of the darkness, Ben's story has a lot of hope to it, no matter how counterintuitive it may seem. But counterintuitive is one of the themes here, isn't it? Definitely recommended.n to the case, but she also has trouble managing her stress level and resorts to self-destructive measures but effective to keep herself balanced, ironic and counterintuitive as it seems. The benefits of counterintuitive thinking is another strong theme in this novel. There's a long-time girlfriend who turns out to be less loyal and less caring than a woman who was supposed to be just a one-night stand. There's Ben's complicated relationship with his parents, both of whom seem to love him and want the best for him, but that also turns out to be not the way he perceived most of his life.  The novel starts out with a quote about genetic disorders that are already present in a human being before birth, and it comes full-circle to that same point at the end when controversial questions are raised about life and death. Is it right to end a life if this life is bound to create more death once it is fully developed? Can our minds, medicated, self-medicated, or otherwise, be more powerful than the genetics we have inherited?  This novel is deeper and richer than one might think just by reading the sample on amazon. Some reviewers have commented that they were turned off by the graphic descriptions in the first few pages, but they should have kept reading. I believe that the intent of those first few pages is to alert the readers to the idea that this novel will not shy away from deepest and darkest corners of the human soul and the human existence. But despite a lot of the darkness, Ben's story has a lot of hope to it, no matter how counterintuitive it may seem. But counterintuitive is one of the themes here, isn't it? Definitely recommended.
translated_review: \"Actions are sometimes performed in a masterly and most cunning way, while the direction of the actions is deranged and dependent on various morbid impressions - it's like a dream\" This is a quote from Fyodor Dostoyevsky's famous novel, Crime and Punishment, but it may as well be describing Ben Green, the troubled young protagonist of the novel \"Son of a Serial Killer\" by Jams N. Roses.  This novel is truly frightening, but not because of the string of murders that are being left unsolved. It is frightening and terrifying because of what is happening to Ben and what most of us are probably afraid of even if we don't readily admit it. Ben is losing his mind and his sanity, and he knows it. He's fighting back, trying to get back to his former self, normal, nice, and balanced, but that goal gets further and further out of reach as the story progresses. Just the thought of watching myself lose my mind and not being able to do anything about it sent chills down my spine.  Ben's thinking patterns are placed at the center of this thriller, and it is Ben who largely drives the plot. Ớne of the most powerful recurring images in this book is a mirror in which Ben sees not only his old familiar self but his new self, the personality full of malice and evil, that is gradually taking over his life. \"What am I doing with my life\" and \"What was I born to be\" are some of the questions that Ben asks of the reflection in the mirror. And it takes him a long time to find the right answers. The ending of the book is tragic by conventional standards, but I have to quote Dostoyevsky again who said, \"the greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness,\" and in that sense, Ben's story ends happily.  But it's not just Ben's character that is interesting and multidimensional. So are the secondary characters. Detective Summers is fighting her own demons as she is trying to solve the case of The Phantom killer: not only does she have a personal connection to the case, but she also has trouble managing her stress level and resorts to self-destructive measures but effective to keep herself balanced, ironic and counterintuitive as it seems. The benefits of counterintuitive thinking is another strong theme in this novel. There's a long-time girlfriend who turns out to be less loyal and less caring than a woman who was supposed to be just a one-night stand. There's Ben's complicated relationship with his parents, both of whom seem to love him and want the best for him, but that also turns out to be not the way he perceived most of his life.  The novel starts out with a quote about genetic disorders that are already present in a human being before birth, and it comes full-circle to that same point at the end when controversial questions are raised about life and death. Is it right to end a life if this life is bound to create more death once it is fully developed? Can our minds, medicated, self-medicated, or otherwise, be more powerful than the genetics we have inherited?  This novel is deeper and richer than one might think just by reading the sample on amazon. Some reviewers have commented that they were turned off by the graphic descriptions in the first few pages, but they should have kept reading. I believe that the intent of those first few pages is to alert the readers to the idea that this novel will not shy away from deepest and darkest corners of the human soul and the human existence. But despite a lot of the darkness, Ben's story has a lot of hope to it, no matter how counterintuitive it may seem. But counterintuitive is one of the themes here, isn't it? Definitely recommended.n to the case, but she also has trouble managing her stress level and resorts to self-destructive measures but effective to keep herself balanced, ironic and counterintuitive as it seems. The benefits of counterintuitive thinking is another strong theme in this novel. There's a long-time girlfriend who turns out to be less loyal and less caring than a woman who was supposed to be just a one-night stand. There's Ben's complicated relationship with his parents, both of whom seem to love him and want the best for him, but that also turns out to be not the way he perceived most of his life.  The novel starts out with a quote about genetic disorders that are already present in a human being before birth, and it comes full-circle to that same point at the end when controversial questions are raised about life and death. Is it right to end a life if this life is bound to create more death once it is fully developed? Can our minds, medicated, self-medicated, or otherwise, be more powerful than the genetics we have inherited?  This novel is deeper and richer than one might think just by reading the sample on amazon. Some reviewers have commented that they were turned off by the graphic descriptions in the first few pages, but they should have kept reading. I believe that the intent of those first few pages is to alert the readers to the idea thatthis novel will not shy away from deepest and darkest corners of the human soul and the human existence. But despite a lot of the darkness, Ben's story has a lot of hope to it, no matter how counterintuitive it may seem. But counterintuitive is one of the themes here, isn't it? Definitely recommended.

review_body: Just endured 1hr 44mins of the otherwise imperious George Clooney at his worst.  A poorly directed, poorly produced movie that is chronically incongruous, rife with useless non sequiturs and almost script-free in rural Italy.  Clooney's moody character is inadequately represented in an ordinarily voluble Italian setting, rendered almost mute by Anton Corbijn. Keep your money and save your time.

review_headline: Dieses Album hat mich voll erwischt!
review_body: Dieses Alubum hat mich voll erwischt. Die Musik hat mich in Ihren Bann gezogen und ich gebe sie NIEEEEEE wieder her! Das ist das beste Album der Jungs aus den letzten 8 Jahren! Sie haben zu Ihrer alten Musik zurück gefunden! War am 23.11. in Berlin zum Konzert und dank dieser Cd konnte ich binnen 4 Tagen alles mitsingen! Jeder Song ist was besonderes und in super Qualität umgestzt. Gute Texte, geiler Sound und starker Beat! Jetzt warte ich auf die DVD die auf der \"This is us\" Tour mitgeschnitten wurde! Kann es kaum erwarten!
translated_review: This Alubum fully caught me.The music pulled me in her spell and I give her nevereeeeee again!This is the best album of guys from the last 8 years!You have found back to your old music!Was on 23.11.In Berlin to the concert and thanks to this CD I was able to sing along within 4 days!Every song is something special and in great quality.Good texts, horny sound and strong beat!Now I'm waiting for the DVD which was cut on the \ "this is us \" tour!Can not Hardly Wait!

product_title: The Tree of life (Palme d'or - Cannes 2011)
review_body: C'est le meilleur film que j'ai pu voir de toute ma vie, qui en est déjà à plus de sa moitié. J'ai vu ce film au cinéma et je m'étais jurée de l'acheter dès sa sortie. Ce que j'ai fait.  Si on ne se pose pas de question sur le sens de la vie, ou si on est hermétique à toute idée d'un Dieu créateur, évidemment on peut trouver ce film soporifique.  Il ne faut pas s'attendre à voir des scènes d'action. Tout est en émotion pure. Jamais un film ne m'a autant bouleversée. Simplement magnifique !
translated_review: It was the best movie I could see in all my life, which is already more than its half.I saw this movie in the cinema and I had swore to buy it as soon as it exit.What I have done.If we do not arise on the meaning of life, or if we are hermetic to any idea of a creative god, obviously we can find this soporific film.Do not expect action scenes.Everything is in pure emotion.Never has a movie upset me so much.Simply magnificent !

review_body: Well, it is not Shakespeare so don't expect Oscar nominations. H & G grow up, get weapons, kill witches. Lots of gory mayhem ensues, as you should expect. Jeremy Renner portrays witch hunting as a profession. Gemma Arterton is convincing, looking like an everyday person rather than someone who always has perfect hair and make-up even after a fight scene. Witches are wonderfully hideous, and come to a bad end. Where you expecting anything else? Grab a beer and a bag of crisps, and enjoy.  It sold well at the box office so there is a sequel planned. Perhaps the script will be improved to satisfy the weaker aspect of this movie.  There is occasional use of the word \"s\" and one \"f*ing\", but if your kids are smart enough to not swear in polite company it is appropriate in scenes where \"oh bother\" doesn't fit.

review_headline: Genial, jedoch teilweise unverstanden und kaputt interpretiert
review_body: Der Film \"300\" ist die Verfilmung eines Frank Miller Comics. \"300\" ist KEINE historische 1:1-Abhandlung auf dem neuesten Stand der Geschichtsforschung. Viele Rezensoren scheinen diesen Sachverhalt mit maximaler Hartnäckigkeit zu ignorieren. Infolgedessen wird \"300\" kaputt interpretiert. Der Film sei angeblich historisch fehlerhaft, rassistisch, faschistisch, behindertenfeindlich, antiiranisch und so weiter. Wer von euch findet weitere Schlagworte? ;-)   Hallo? Ist oder war da jemand im \"falschen Film\"? Leute, nochmal, das ist eine COMIC-VERFILMUNG, die zudem noch sehr gut gelungen ist. Die Autoren sind weder das amerikanische Verteidigungsministerium, noch irgendwelche Extremisten. Wer \"Sin City\" gelesen oder gesehen hat, der weiß, dass Frank Miller für seine heroischen Gewaltexzesse bekannt ist. Wer Filme bevorzugt, wo der inhaltliche Schwerpunkt auf Nächstenliebe und Völkerverständigung liegt, der hätte wohl besser auf den Besuch von \"300\" verzichten sollen.   \"300\" basiert in freier Interpretation auf den Erzählungen des Griechen Herodot von der Schlacht bei den Thermopylen im Jahre 480 vor Christus. Hier verteidigte eine zahlenmäßig weit unterlegene, griechische Streitmacht unter König Leonidas I. (etwa 4.200 Mann, darunter etwa 300 Spartiaten) den Thermopylenpass in Böotien gegen eine Übermacht von 50.000 Persern unter Xerxes I. Obwohl die Perser nach aktueller Geschichtsschreiung mit einer zehnfachen Übermacht antraten, konnte der Pass mehrere Tage gehalten werden, bevor die Griechen schließlich umzingelt und vernichtet wurden.   So ist der Heldenmut von König Leonidas und seinen Soldaten in die Geschichte eingegangen, wobei der Sinn dieser letztendlich verlorenen Schlacht historisch in Frage gestellt wird. Mit den siegreichen Kämpfen bei Salamis und Plataiai (am Ende von \"300\" zu sehen) konnten die Griechen ihre Unabhängigkeit gegen das mächtige Perserreich jedoch schließlich erfolgreich verteidigen. Soviel zum geschichtlichen Hintergrund.Dennoch ist \"300\" kein Geschichtsfilm. Frank Millers übertrieben muskulöse Helden verteidigen Recht und Freiheit mit brutalen Gewaltexzessen. Sein düsterer Schwarzweiß-Zeichenstil und sein Sinn für ungewöhnliche Perspektiven wird auch in der Verfilmung von \"300\" erfolgreich umgesetzt. Selten zuvor wurden historische Nahkampfszenen so hautnah, detailliert und entsprechend blutig dargestellt. Über den Sinn dieser Details mag man streiten, in \"300\" wird der Überlebenskampf zum filmerischen Kunstwerk stilisiert. Aber nicht jeder Zuschauer wird diese Art von \"Kunstwerk\" mit seiner \"Ästhetik der Gewalt\" mögen.   \"300\" versteht sich nicht als geschichtliches Werk. Vielmehr wurde hier der historische Sachverhalt missbraucht, um eine stark vereinfachte Momentaufnahme des menschlichen Überlebenskampfes in all seinen Fazetten zu zeigen. Dieser Film will nicht aufklären oder gar komplexe Sachverhalte darstellen oder vermitteln, sondern allein durch seine düsteren, übersättigten Bilder und der dazu passenden Musik auf den Zuschauer WIRKEN. Wer hier analysiert und interpretiert, der hat den Film nicht verstanden. Das Werk und seine Machart sind das Kunstwerk, die Handlung ist beliebig austauschbar.   Der Iran hat sich übrigens als rechtlicher Nachfolger des persischen Reiches bei den Vereinten Nationen mit der Begründung über den Film beklagt, es handle sich um einen Propagandafilm.   Meine Meinung: Ich vergebe 5 Sterne, weil die filmerische Umsetzung des Kunsterwerkes \"300\" aus meiner Sicht gelungen ist und einen Meilenstein in einem neuen Genre darstellt. \"300\" ist jedoch kein Film, wie jeder andere. Wer Gewaltszenen verabscheut oder Inhalte von Filmen gerne analysiert, der möge auf diesen Film besser verzichten.
translated_review: The movie \ "300 \" is the filming of a Frank Miller Comics. \ "300 \" is not a historic 1: 1 essay on the latest state of history research. Many recensors seem to ignore this facts with maximum stubbornness. As a result, \ "300 \" is interpreted. The film is supposed to be historically flawed, racist, fascist, handicapped mindlich, antiran and so on. Who of you finds more keywords? ;-)   Hello? Is there anyone in the \ "false movie \"? People, again, that's a comic film adaptation, which is still very well suited. The authors are neither the Ministry of Defense, nor any extremists. Who has read or seen \ "Sin City \", who knows that Frank Miller is known for his heroic wealth excesses. Anyone who preferences films, where the content focus is on charity and international understanding, which should probably have been better to give up the visit of \ "300 \". \ "300 \" is based in free interpretation on the narratives of the Greek Herodot from the Battle of the Thermopylene in 480 BC. Here, a numerically defended, Greek dispute under King Leonidas I (about 4,200 husband, including about 300 sparties) defended the Thermopylene Pass in Böotia against a superiority of 50,000 Persians under Xerxes I. Although the Persians approached a tenfold overhead of current historic. Could the pass be kept for several days before the Greeks were finally surrounded and destroyed. Thus, the heroism of King Leonidas and his soldiers entered the story, the meaning of this ultimately lost battle is historically called into question. With the victorious fighting at Salamis and Plataiai (at the end of \ "300" to see), the Greeks could finally successfully defend their independence against the mighty Persian realm. So much for the historical background. No history film is not \ "300 \". Frank Millers exaggerated muscular heroes defend law and freedom with brutal western excesses. His gloomy black-and-white fashion style and his sense of unusual perspectives is also successfully implemented in the filming of \ "300 \". Rarely beforehand, historical melee scenes were shown in detail, detailed and correspondingly portrayed. About the meaning of these details you may argue, in \ "300 \" the survival fight is stylized to the filmy artwork. But not every viewer will like this kind of "artwork \" with his "aesthetics of violence \". \ "300" does not seist as a historical work. Rather, the historical facts were abused here to show a greatly simplified snapshot of the human survival vapor in all its camps. This film does not want to enlighten or even present complex facts or convey, but alone through its gloomy, supersaturated pictures and the matching music look at the viewer. Anyone who analyzes and interprets here, who did not understand the film. The work and its style are the artwork, the plot is arbitrarily interchangeable. Incidentally, Iran has complained as a legal successor to the Persian Empire in the United Nations with the justification on the film, it is a propaganda film. My opinion: I forgive 5 stars because the filmmaking of the artwork \ "300" has succeeded in my view and represents a milestone in a new genre. "300" is not a movie, like any other. Anyone who hilfs violent scenes or gladly analyzes content of films that may waive this movie better.

review_body:
Il me semble quasi impossible de qualifier ce film! C'est un pur instant de bonheur d'où l'on ressort magnifié, émerveillé, ému jusqu'aux tréfonds de son âme! Je l'ai vu au cinéma à sa sortie, j'ai ensuite acheté la vidéo VHs, puis enfin le DVD.pourquoi? Tout simplement pourqu'à chaque moments de ma vie où je me sens le vague à l'âme je puisse replonger dans l'univers déroutant de FORREST GUMP. Du rire mêlé au larmes, de l'humour subtil et toujours juste, des clins d'oeil permanents à l'Histoire américaine des années 60 à la fin du siècle, un Tom Hanks plus que convaincant, des seconds rôles admirables, une musique qui se confond avec un scénario très novateur, bref tout y est!
Si vous n'avez pas ce film dans votre vidéothèque, c'est que vous avez été cryogenéisé ces 10 dernières années! N.B: pour moi, ce film, \"Le Fabuleux Destin d'Amélie Poulain\", et \"La Vie est Belle \"sont les 3 films-bonheur de notre dernière décennie!
translated_review:
It seems almost impossible to qualify this movie!It is a pure moment of happiness from which one emerges magnified, amazed, moved to the depths of his soul!I saw it at the cinema when I left, I then bought the VHS video, then finally the DVD.Why?Simply like every moment of my life where I feel the wave to the soul I can plunge into the confusing universe of Forrest Gump.From laughter mixed with tears, subtle humor and always just, permanent wings to the American history of the 1960s at the end of the century, a Tom Hanks more than convincing, second admirable roles, a music thatmerges with a very innovative scenario, in short everything is there!
If you do not have this movie in your video library, it is that you have been cryogenized over the last 10 years!N.B: For me, this film, \ "the fabulous destiny of Amélie Poulain \", and \ "life is beautiful \" are the 3 films-happiness of our last decade!

review_body: this book is a must for any cat person, it really gives one an insight as to how cats think. The various authors must be really au fait with cat behavior. I have used several quotes recently ,my favourites being \"nudge, nudge\" whilst watching a cat remove something from the table and \"I could pee on that\" when that speculative look comes over a feline visage. All in all this is a great fun read.

product_title: The Music of Star Wars : 30th Anniversary (Coffret 8 CD)
review_body: Coffret qui regroupe les musiques de la saga original (épisode 4 5 6)et une petite sélection des épisodes 1 2 3. L'opus contient de très belles photos des films. Pour fans de la saga ou pour amateur de musique épique, John Williams grand artiste de musique classique, nous fait voyager dans une galaxie lointaine, très lointaine. avec des titres aussi émouvant que palpitant, surtout en variant les rythmes et la puissance des éléments.     Conseiller pour tous être de la galaxie.
translated_review: Box that includes the musics of the original saga (episode 4 5 6) and a small selection of episodes 1 2 3. The opus contains very beautiful pictures of the movies.For fans of the saga or for amateur of epic music, John Williams great classical music artist, makes us travel in a distant galaxy, very distant.With as moving titles that thrilling, especially by varying the rhythms and power of the elements.Advisor for all being from the galaxy.

review_body: Comment croire à l'histoire de Persée en découvrant l'ex avatar en jupette courte et cheveux de GI, c'est nul, mal construit, des personnages improbables, les effets spéciaux ne compensent pas la bétise de l'histoire ! franchement la version de 1980 est un chef d'oeuvre à côté. comment peut-on prendre de telles libertés avec la mythologie ! NUL NUL que dire d'autre.
translated_review: How to believe in the history of Perseus, discovering the former short skirt and gi hair, it's nil, poorly constructed, unlikely characters, special effects do not compensate for the stupidity of history!Frankly the 1980 version is a masterpiece next door.How can we take such freedoms with mythology!No one not to say else.

review_body: I bought this album after watching them on the Live coverage of Glastonbury on BBC4. I was hooked. I haven't stopped playing the album since. I like all the tracks even if some of the negative reviews say they all have a similar structure. I prefer an album where all the songs have a common thread. If I wanted different song styles I'd buy tracks from different artists! Yes the songs do have a rhythm that I find infectious and I think the music reflects that the members of Mumford and Sons all seem to be having a great time playing their music. I was impressed with the number of instruments each of them plays on each song. I would thoroughly recommend seeing them live or at least a video of them live. I would be very happy to purchase a broadcast quality video of their Glastonbury set. Hook the TV up to my amps and speakers and really liven up the neighbourhood. I, possibly risking the wrath of some diehard fans, would put them up there with the Pogues.   Simon in Celtic Cornwall.

product_title: Watching the English: The Hidden Rules of English Behaviour
review_headline: Good fun, and bags of truth in it
review_body: This is a great book to dip into. Personally, i loved the bit about the English on public transport, as it was so true. I like my privacy on tubes, I hate foreigners who talk loudly, or people talking on mobiles, and I definitely give them some stern looks. And there's nothing worse than having to make conversation with somebody you see every day. i will feel obliged to talk to them every day, and never be able to read my book again, without feeling highly rude. Oh my, the etiquette is so exhausting.

Oh my, the etiquette is so exhausting.

review_body: Die spannende Lada-Fahrt von Maik Klingenberg und Tschick quer durch Deutschland ist einfach toll geschrieben - bzw. gesprochen. Ich habe dieses Buch als Hörbuch gekauft und bin absolut begeistert vom Sprecher Hanno Koffler. Ich bin überzeugt, dass ich die Handlung durch ihn noch interessanter fand. Er hat die wörtliche Rede einfach toll gesprochen, z. B. den russischen Akzent von Tschick oder das wütende Geschrei von Maiks Vater. Auch der tolle Schreibstil im typischen Jugendjargon - die Geschichte wird vom 14jährigen Maik erzählt - gewinnt durch den Sprecher noch an Farbe. Fazit: Die Figur Maik und der Sprecher Hanno Koffler harmonieren sehr gut.     Die Geschichte ist eine tolle Mischung aus Komik und Ernsthaftigkeit, wobei die witzigen Episoden überwiegen. Obwohl die Jungs viel Spaß haben, kommen auch ihre Probleme zum Vorschein: Maiks Elternhaus, seine unerfüllte Liebe zur Klassenkameradin, sein Ansehen in der Klasse etc. vieles davon typische Gedanken und Empfindungen in dem Alter. Für mich hat das Buch ein gelungenes \"Happy End\", welches sich auf Maiks Gefühlsleben bezieht und nicht auf tatsächliche Erfolge.
translated_review: The exciting Lada ride of Maik Klingenberg and Tschick across Germany is just written - or spoken. I bought this book as a audiobook and am absolutely thrilled by spokesman Hanno Koffler. I am convinced that I found the plot by him even more interesting. He just spoke the literal speech, z. B. the Russian accent of Tschick or the angry shouts of Maik's father. Also the great writing style in the typical youth jargon - the story is told by the 14-year-old Maik - wins color even by the speaker. Conclusion: The figure Maik and the speaker Hanno Koffler harmonize very well. The story is a great mix of comedy and seriousness, with the funny episodes outweighing. Although the boys have fun, their problems also appear: Maik's parents' home, his unfulfilled love for classmate, his reputation in class etc. Much of them typical thoughts and sensations in age. For me, the book has a successful "Happy End \", which relates to Maik's emotional life and not on actual achievements.

review_body:
Das vierte Album von Led Zeppelin hat vielleicht den höchsten Wiedererkennungswert all ihrer Alben.
Es beinhaltet einige der größten Klassiker der Band und des Rock allgemein, was ihm eine Bedeutung verleiht, die scheinbar so mancher Rezensent vor mir vernachlässigte.
Einzelwertungen können helfen, das Album angemessener zu verstehen und zu bewerten. Ich beschränke mich hierbei auf die ersten vier Songs, welche den Charakter des Albums meiner Meinug nach am besten wiederspiegeln. 1. Black Dog Ein einzigartiger Song, schräg und ausdrucksstark. Der hier vorgetragene Gesang, welcher sich aus dem Off heraus erhebt und dem sich periodisch wiederholenden Riff vorangeht, gehört zu Plant's bemerkenswertesten Leistungen. Ebenfalls bemerkenswert ist der irgendwann im Song auftretende Tonartswechsel. Note 1 2. Rock'N'Roll Typische Rock'N'Roll- Melodie, wie der Name schon sagt. In Erinnerung bleibt hier vor Allem Bonham's Drumming, insbesondere seine Breaks und das Intro. Note 2 3. The Battle Of Evermore Dies ist vielleicht der mystischste, sphärischste und abgehobenste Song der Band. Fernöstliches Zupfspiel, poetische Lyrics und ein wahnsinniger, beinahe transzendental und berauschend wirkender schriller Gesang verleihen diesem unzugänglichen Meisterwerk seinen in der Rockmusik einzigartigen Charakter. Note 1 4. Stairway To Heaven Der neben \"Whole Lotta Love\" berühmteste Song der Band gehört zurecht zu den bedeutendsten und am höchsten bewerteten Songs der Geschichte der populären Musik.
Viele sagen, er sei abgedroschen.
Doch mindert die Tatsache, dass man einen Song schon oft gehört hat, dessen kompositorische Qualität ? Ich denke, dass dem nicht so ist.
Sicherlich stellt \"Stairway To Heaven\" alle anderen Songs dieser Band in seinen langen Schatten.
Das Gitarren-Thema, der Gesang, das spät einsetzende Schlagzeug, das durch Mark und Bein gehende Solo - sie alle machen dieses Lied zum vielleicht größten Song aller Zeiten. Note 1 Auf den Hörer warten noch vier weitere Songs, von denen besonders die beiden letzten als großartig zu bezeichnen sind. D Fazit: Neben \"II\" das bedeutendste Led-Zeppelin-Album und einer der Meilensteine des Rock.
translated_review:
The fourth album of LED Zeppelin may have the highest recognition value of all its albums.
It contains some of the biggest classics of the band and the skirt in general, which gives him a meaning, which seems to neglect so many recently before me.
Individuals can help to understand and evaluate the album more appropriate. I limit myself to the first four songs, which best reflect the character of the album of my Minduug. 1. Black Dog a unique song, oblique and expressive. The vocals presented here, which rises out of the OFF and precedes the periodically repeating reef, belongs to plans most remarkable achievements. Also remarkable is the clay change occurring at some point in the song. Note 1 2. Rock'n'Roll typical Rock'n'Roll melody, as the name implies. In memory, Bonham's drumming, especially his breaks and the intro. Note 2 3. The Battle of Evermore This is perhaps the most mystical, most spherical and virgin song's song. Far Eastern tonpring, poetic lyrics and a mad, almost transcendental and intoxicating shrill vocals give this inaccessible masterpiece to its character unique in rock music. Note 1 4. Stairway to Heaven The beside \ "Whole Lotta Love \" most famous song of the band is right with the most important and highest rated songs of the history of popular music.
Many say he was crowded.
But does the fact that you have heard a song often, whose compositional quality? I think that's not the case.
Surely \ "Stairway to Heaven \" provides all other songs of this band in his long shadows.
The guitar theme, the singing, the late driving drums that go through Mark and Leg Solo - they all make this Song for perhaps biggest song ever. Note 1 On the listener, four more songs are still waiting, of which the last two are designed to be great. D Conclusion: In addition to \ "II \" the most important LED Zeppelin album and one of the milestones of the skirt.

review_body: I Love the bond movies. This was not a Bond movie. The writers, the director and the editors should be ashamed of themselves for very basic old school disappointing plot creation  moments. The girl agent needs to shoot the villain, Bond is in the way, she shoots Bond he falls out of the way now she has a clear shot but doesn't even attempt to fire just stares at him. The rest of the film goes on to do the same ridiculous thing. Bond is not the clever hero he should be in fact he comes over as a bit bland. No storey. No gadgets. No empathy . No reality. No feel good factor. No fear. No tension. Waste of my time and money.

The writers, the director and the editors should be ashamed of themselves for very basic old school disappointing plot creation  moments. The girl agent needs to shoot the villain, Bond is in the way, she shoots Bond he falls out of the way now she has a clear shot but doesn't even attempt to fire just stares at him. The rest of the film goes on to do the same ridiculous thing. Bond is not the clever hero he should be in fact he comes over as a bit bland. No storey. No gadgets. No empathy . No reality. No feel good factor. No fear. No tension. Waste of my time and money.

product_title: How I Met Your Mother - Saison 7
review_headline: très bonne série...à condition de le voir en VO
review_body: Je rejoins ceux qui pensent que les mauvais commentaires sont liés à la VF : pour l'avoir vu par accident à la télé : c'est pas seulement nul, c'est insupportable ! dialogues nuls (ce n'est pas réellement la traduction de l'anglais), voix nulles mal joués (très très mal joués), à un point vraiment désagréable ! j'ai halluciné ! et il me semble qu'ils ont rajouté des rires ? je n'ai pas persisté tellement l'effet produit est \"aaahahhh au secours\"!  en anglais, c'est très bien, beaucoup plus subtil que Friends (que j'adore aussi, mais dans un autre registre). Friends, lui, était regardable en français, bien qu'un peu moins bien.  Ici, tout est dans les dialogues et le jeu des acteurs, et non dans l'histoire, donc, à ceux qui n'ont pas aimé : regardez la VO ! Et A ceux qui ne connaissent pas : ne regardez jamais, jamais, jamais la VF.  Pour le reste, le public visé n'est pas le même que friends, plus âgé peut-etre, et le style ne plait pas toujours à tout le monde, mais, en dehors même du jeu des acteurs, j'apprécie particulièrement la mise en scène, et même les scènes chantées/dansées (dont habituellement j'ai horreur.) tout est fait avec soin et c'est vraiment appréciable.  Enfin, attention : ne regardez pas les commentaires en bonus du premier DVD avant d'avoir vu toute la saison, car le spoil est important (j'ai fait cette erreur.)
translated_review: I join those who think that bad comments are related to VF: to have seen by accident on TV: it's not just nil, it's unbearable! Dial Dialogs (this is not really the translation of English), null badly played (very very badly played), at a point really unpleasant! I hallucinated! And it seems to me that they have added laughter? I did not persisted so much the product effect is \ "Aaahahhh to rescue \"! In English, it's very good, much more subtle than friends (I love too, but in another registry). Friends, he was looking at French, although a little less good. Here, everything is in the dialogues and play of actors, and not in history, so, to those who have not liked: Look at the VO! And to those who do not know: Never look, never, never, the VF. For the rest, the target audience is not the same as Friends, older perhaps, and the style does not always please everyone, but, outside the play of the actors, I particularly appreciate the bet On the scene, and even the scenes sung / danced (which usually I hate.) Everything is done with care and it is really appreciable. Finally, attention: do not look at the first DVD bonus comments before seeing all the season because the spoil is important (I made this mistake.)

review_body: Erstes Star Trek Kinoabenteuer von 1978. Dunkle Atmosphäre. Ein muss für jeden Trekkie. Allerdings auch für Fans eine verworrene Geschichte. Handlung: Ein riesiges, unbekantes Objekt bewegt sich auf die Erde zu. Der erfahrenste Admiral der Sternenflotte, James T. Kirk, wird kurzerhand zum Captain zurückgestuft und übernimmt an Stelle von Captain Willard Decker die komplett umgerüstete U.S.S. Enterprise. Kirk und die gesammte Crew der Enterprise machen sich auf den Weg zu dem unbekannten Objekt und erfahren eine unglaubliche Geschichte: Die NASA startete im 20. Jahrhundert eine Raumsonde namens Voyager 6. Diese verschwand in einem schwarzen Loch und kam bei einem Planeten, der nur von Maschinen bewohnt war, wieder heraus. Diese erkannten die Sonde als eine der ihren an und nahmen ihre Aufgabe, neues Wissen zu suchen, so ernst, dass sie extra für sie ein riesiges Raumschiff entwarfen. Dieses Raumschiff trat eine Reise durch die ganze Galaxie an. Auf der Suche nach Informationen und ihren Schöpfern, da diese über das Logische hinaus denken können. Jetzt ist es bei der Erde angelangt und will sie zerstören. Denn Voyager 6 glaubt nicht, dass die Menschen sie geschaffen haben, da dort keiner auf den über 300 Jahre alten NASA Code antwortet. Kirk kann die Sonde davon überzeugen, dass die Menschen sie gebaut haben. Um aber über die Logik hinaus denken zu können, muss Voyager 6 sich mit einem Menschen vereinen.
translated_review: First star Trek cinema adventure from 1978. dark atmosphere. A must for every trekkie. However, for fans a confused story. Action: A huge, unknown object moves to the earth. The most experienced admiral of the StarFleet, James T. Kirk, is returned to the Captain and takes over the completely surrounded U.S.S. in place of Captain Willard Decker. Enterprise. Kirk and the Crew of Enterprise are on the way to the unknown property and experience an incredible story: NASA started in the 20th century a room probe called Voyager 6. This disappeared in a black hole and came with a planet, which only came from a planet Machines inhabited was back. These recognized the probe as one of theirs and took their job to seek new knowledge, so seriously that they were specially designed for them a huge spaceship. This spaceship arrived through the whole galaxy. In search of information and your creators, as they can think beyond the logical. Now it has reached Earth and wants to destroy it. Because Voyager 6 does not believe that people have created them, there no one responds to the over 300-year NASA Code. Kirk can convince the probe that people have built them. But in order to be able to think beyond the logic, Voyager 6 must combine with a person.

review_headline: Nicht der Komponist...aber schon ein Teil der Seele von Jethro Tull
review_body: "Away with Words" zu hören tut einfach gut, nicht nur für JT-Fans. Martin Barre versteht es durch seine, über Jahrzehnte den Sound von Jethro Tull geprägte, einmalige Gitarrenvirtuosität die Seele der Songs einzufangen und neu wieder zugeben. Sicher hat es der Gitarrist auch im reifen Alter einfacher als der Sänger. Vielleicht darf man die Hoffnung nicht aufgeben, dass beide, Ian Anderson und Martin Barre doch noch einmal zusammen finden.
translated_review: "Away with words" to hear just do well, not just for JT fans.Martin Barre understands it through his, for decades the sound of Jethro Tull embossed unique guitar virtuosity to capture the soul of the songs and again admit.Surely it has the guitarist even easier in the ripe age than the singer.Maybe one should not give up the hope that both, Ian Anderson and Martin Barre find again together.

review_headline: I would highly recommend this book
review_body: Everyone needs to jump on this series. Unlike every other dystopian fiction around, this one looks at the end of the world in a new light. It is very original and unique. You quickly learn about life in the silo with the downfall of the first character introduced. From there the running of the silo and the power struggle within becomes clear.  Ideas are a disease. Diseases must be stopped. The silo is designed that you maintain the job you have been assigned and complete a healthy normal life. A person within the silo should never think of the outside. If someone thinks and questions about the outside, they are sent to the cleaning.  This book was impossible to put down and I quickly jumped onto the next book in the series. The whole world of the silos is fascinating. I could really imagine the silos and how life would be inside. I would highly recommend this book!
translated_review: Everyone needs to jump on this series. Unlike every other dystopian fiction around, this one looks at the end of the world in a new light. It is very original and unique. You quickly learn about life in the silo with the downfall of the first character introduced. From there the running of the silo and the power struggle within becomes clear.  Ideas are a disease. Diseases must be stopped. The silo is designed that you maintain the job you have been assigned and complete a healthy normal life. A person within the silo should never think of the outside. If someone thinks and questions about the outside, they are sent to the cleaning.  This book was impossible to put down and I quickly jumped onto the next book in the series. The whole world of the silos is fascinating. I could really imagine the silos and how life would be inside. I would highly recommend this book!

review_body: Auch ich bin ein Fan der älteren Scheiben bis und mit \"Six Degrees of inner turbulence\". Und danach? Das unsägliche Train of Thought war da nur der Anfang. Dieses Machwerk schien wie eine vertonte Midlife-Crisis: Gewisse Männer kaufen sich im mittleren Alter eine Harley - und Dream Theater werden plötzlich unglaublich harte Metaller. richtig lächerlich. Irgendwie war es weg, das gewisse etwas. Dream Theater tönten zwar immer noch wie Dream Theater, mal härter und Metallica-esquer, später mal weicher und kommerzieller, mal nach Muse oder Radiohead. aber wie gesagt, immer noch wie Dream Theater. Aber ohne - ja ohne was eigentlich? Darüber lässt sich nur spekulieren. Zu benennen ist es kaum. Vielleicht. ohne Seele, ohne das geistreiche Aufblitzen ihrer früheren Kompositionen, oberflächlich? Uninspiriert, das trifft es wohl am ehesten. Das neuste Album macht da leider keine Ausnahme. Teilweise schon erschreckend, wie lieblos Jordan Rudess hie und da im Hintergrund seine Arpeggios runterleiert, ganz nach dem Motto \"hier braucht's noch was, mach mal\". Das ganze ist einfach nicht stimmig. Und was mir bei diesem Album aufgefallen ist: Die Musik und die Arrangements sind zum Teil geradezu bieder, als ob die Herren nun doch älter und satter geworden sind. Das tönt einfach irgendwie unmotiviert, spielt wohl aber auch nicht mehr so ne Rolle, weil's ja von den Fans sowieso abgefeiert wird. Fast schon wie im Zirkus. oder bei einem Jerry-Bruckheimer Film: Da dominiert die Form meistens auch über den Inhalt. Fazit: Und wieder nix.
translated_review: Also, I'm a fan of older slices to and with \ "Six degrees of Inner Turbulence \". And then? The unspeakable train of thought was just the beginning. This Machwerk seemed like a set of Midlife Crisis: Certain men buy themselves in the middle age A Harley - and Dream Theater suddenly becomes incredibly hard metal. Really ridiculous. Somehow it was gone, that certain something. Dream Theater still sounded like Dream Theater, sometimes Harder and Metallica-Esquer, later softer and commercial, sometimes to Muse or Radiohead. But as I said, still like Dream Theater. But without - yes without what actually? It can only be speculated about it. It is hard to name. Maybe. Without a soul, without the vascular flashing of your previous compositions, superficial? Uninspired, it probably meets it mostly. The latest album unfortunately makes no exception. Partly already terrifying, how loveless Jordan Rudess Hie and there in the background his Arpeggios downer, according to the motto \ "Here it still needs something, make \". The whole thing is just not consistent. And what I noticed about this album: the music and the arrangements are partly bidden as if the gentlemen has become older and sadden. That sounds just motivated, but probably does not play so much role, because it is celebrated by the fans anyway. Almost as in the circus. Or at a Jerry Bruckheimer movie: The shape usually dominates the content. Conclusion: And nothing again.
