review_body: L'histoire : Pas de mari, pas d'enfants : toute la vie de Kate Armstrong (Zeta-Jones) tourne autour de ce restaurant branché de Manhattan dont elle dirige les cuisines d'une main de fer.   Mais notre héroïne voit sa vie bien réglée lui échapper lorsque sa saeur meurt prématurément,lui laissant la garde d'une fillette de neuf ans, Zoe (Abigail Braislin).   Pour ne rien arranger, Kate doit faire cuisine commune avec un nouveau sous-chef cuisinier,Nick (Aaron Eckhart). Exubérant, charmeur, ce dernier est son exact contraire, et pourtant, entre les deux, la mayonnaise va finir par prendre.    Mon avis / Film sympathique à regarder à  entre 2 tartes et une crême fouettée.   Katherine Zeta-Jones et Aaron Eckhart nous rebasculent tous 2 dans le monde de \"ratatouille\" mais là avec des cailles au safran . . Pas le même menu, mais il faut avouer que la bande musicale est fort agréable, et les fouets dansent au rythme des chansons de Paolo Comté. Le second de cuisine est un amateur d'opéra et ceci nous berce dans le monde de la traviata avec ravissement. .   Moralité moment léger sans prétention, et c'est bien agréable aussi parfois.
translated_review: The story: no husband, no children: all the life of Kate Armstrong (Zeta-Jones) revolves around this trendy restaurant in Manhattan whose kitchens of an iron hand. But our heroine sees his well-set life escape when his Saeur dies prematurely, leaving him custody of a nine-year-old girl, Zoe (Abigail Braislin). To do not arrange, Kate must make common cooking with a new cook, Nick (Aaron Eckhart). Exuberant, charmer, the latter is his exact opposite, and yet, between the two, the mayonnaise will end up taking. My friendly opinion / film to look at between 2 pies and a whipped cream. Katherine Zeta-Jones and Aaron Eckhart all rebound us in the world of \ "ratatouille \" but there with saffron quail. . Not the same menu, but we must admit that the musical band is very nice, and the whips dance at the rhythm of the songs of Paolo County. The second kitchen is an opera lover and this rocks us in the world of Traviata with rapture. . Moral light moment without pretension, and it's nice also sometimes.

review_body: Avec le recul, Homework retse un album très efficace, inventif, bourré de trouvailles, motivé par un but ludique extrême, ne cherchant à aucun moment à impressionner et doté d'un réelle finesse, loin de la bouillasse pour discothèques et adolescents attardés que le duo français nous a pondu lors de leur deuxième opus Discovery. Le seul bémol c'est que Homework n'a pour moi rien de révolutionnaire: les recettes que les daft appliquent sont celles déja inventées par des groupes précurseurs en la matière tous nés avant eux: Orbital, les Chemical Brothers, Underworld, Prodigy. Le duo s'est simplement contenté d'adapter ce son venu d'outre-manche (comme toujours.) à la sauce française en y ajoutant fort heureusement une touche personnelle bienvenue. D'ailleurs, est-il nécéssaire de préciser que sans les Chemical Brothers, les Daft Punk n'auraient surement pas vu le jour puisque c'est grâce à eux qu'ils ont fait leur premier remix (de \"life is sweet\") et ainsi ont pu se faire connaitre des studios.
translated_review: With the hind, Homework Rets a very efficient, inventive album, stuffed with finds by an extreme playful goal, not seeking any time to impress and endowed a finesse, far from the brush for discotheques and teenagers linger than the French duo has ponduced us during their second opus discovery. The only downside is that homework has nothing revolutionary: the recipes that DAFT applies are those already invented by precursor groups in the area all born before them: Orbital, Chemical Brothers, Underworld, Prodigy. The duo simply contented to adapt this sound from us to handle (as always.) To the French sauce by adding a welcome personal touch very fortunately. Moreover, is it necessary to specify that without the Chemical Brothers, the Daft Punk would probably not have emerged since it is thanks to them that they made their first remix (of \ "Life is Sweet \ "And so were studios.

review_body: I do enjoy her writing and enjoyed this as much as The Secret History. The author creates an intriguing premise and I particularly enjoyed the first half of the book. Some of the passages describing what is happening in young Theo's head were particularly emotive. She does bleak very well.  I can't quite give this 5 stars because, as some other have said, it could have done with some editing. I also felt that some of the things the lead characters got away with a little implausible.  But overall, another quality read courtesy of Donna Tartt

review_body: Einfach toll !  Das Buch liest sich super schnell, wie andere Bücher dieser Reihe auch. review_headline: Disappointing compared with book and history
review_body: Once again Hollywood distorts a book and history in the quest for commercial success. What a shame, they could have preserved the credibility of the content of the book. But no, the complexity of the 100 years war - adequately reflected in the book - is distorted into a simpleton's propaganda version. Jurassic Park showed how to successfully adapt a Michael Crichton book to the big screen - and make millions and millions.  They should have followed the same track.

But no, the complexity of the 100 years war - adequately reflected in the book - is distorted into a simpleton's propaganda version. Jurassic Park showed how to successfully adapt a Michael Crichton book to the big screen - and make millions and millions.  They should have followed the same track.

review_body: Les frères Hawkins reviennent en force après des années d'absence. Ca valait le coup d'attendre ! Leur 3e album est excellent et rythmé de bout en bout, avec des riffs endiablés et des solos piqués, plein de feeling ! On reconnaît, à travers tous les titres de l'album, l'inspiration ACDC pour les riffs et Fredy Mercury pour le chant. Si vous aussi vous êtes fan, intéressez-vous à Hot Leg, le groupe de Justin Hawkins le temps de la séparation des Darkness, très sympa !
translated_review: The Hawkins brothers come back in force after years of absence.It was worth the blow to wait!Their 3rd album is excellent and rhythmous end-to-end, with elderly riffs and stitched solos, full of feeling!We recognize, through all the titles of the album, the ACDC inspiration for the Riffs and Fredy Mercury for singing.If you too are a fan, interest yourself at Hot Leg, the group of Justin Hawkins the time of separation of Darkness, very friendly!

review_headline: Un classique que plus personne n'oserait filmer...
review_body: Qui oserait filmer une charge pareille contre les siens aujourd'hui? Fellini nous donne avec Amarcord le premier volet d'un dyptique qu'il finira avec Roma: une vue acerbe mais pleine de tendresse de cette Italie fasciste, qu'on realise tiers-mondisée et surrannée. les longues descriptions des cours, des blagues de potaches des écoliers donnent une vision d'un pays en perdition. Et pourtant chaque personnage est attachant chacun est habité d'une générosité qui n'est plus de ce monde.  on retrouve les personnages classiques de Fellini, les dépravés, les profiteurs, les obsédés, les excentriques mais aussi les femmes au grand coeur, les fascistes ridicules, bref, le peuple. Nous, en fait.
translated_review: Who would dare filming such a load against his people today?Fellini gives us with Alarcord the first part of a dyptic he will end with Roma: an acerte view but full of tenderness of this fascist Italy, which one realizes Third Mondier and Surrannée.The long descriptions of the courses, girls' potaches jokes give a vision of a country in perdition.And yet each character is endearing everyone is inhabited by a generosity that is no longer from this world.We find the classic characters of Fellini, the depraved, the profiteers, the obsesses, the eccentrics but also the women with great heart, the ridiculous fascists, in short, the people.We actually.

review_body: En 2009, Neil Blomkamp surprenait et marquait intelligemment les esprits avec l'excellent \"District 9\", fable de SF réaliste qui dénoncait les effets de l'apartheid en Afrique du Sud, son pays d'origine.  4 ans après, par ce deuxième long-métrage, il récidive et enfonce encore davantage le clou dans un tout où chaque plan produit un effet minutieusement étudié.  \"Elysium\" est ainsi un blockbuster intelligent, à la photographie travaillée, aux effets spéciaux réalistes et au scénario qui dénonce dans une fiction les disparités économiques et géo-politiques de notre temps. Car il s'agit avant tout de SF politique aux résonnances cruellement contemporaines.  Ainsi, en 2154, Los Angeles ressemble avant tout à un gigantesque bidonville d'Amérique Latine -la langue dominante y est d'ailleurs l'espagnol - où règnent massivement pauvreté, désespoir, maladies, insécurité et désagrégation sociale. Tandis que dans l'espace, la station orbitale \"Elysium\" réservée aux classes les plus favorisées, rappelle étrangement le luxe et l'opulence de Beverly Hills. Sans oublier cette politique de rejet vers la terre surpeuplée et polluée des clandestins qui tentent d'y émigrer et qui évoque indubitablement cette frontière entre Mexique et USA devenue impénétrable aujourd'hui.  En anti-héros devenu malgré lui dernier recours de l'humanité contre l'injustice, Matt Damon explose de talent à nouveau, sans oublier un casting remarquablement choisi qui fait de ce film une vraie réussite (Jodie Foster, Sharlto Copley, Alice Braga, Diego Luna, William Fincher.)  Quant l'intelligence se combine à la SF émergent des pépites comme \"Elysium\". C'est vraiment la bonne surprise cinéma de l'été 2013, et une nouvelle référence de marque en matière de SF apocalyptique, après l'excellent \"Oblivion\" sorti il y a quelques mois.  PS : Je n'hésiterai pas à assortir ce commentaire de remarques d'ordre technique (son et image) lorsque je serai en possession du blu-ray dans quelques mois.emarques d'ordre technique (son et image) lorsque je serai en possession du blu-ray dans quelques mois.
translated_review: In 2009, Neil Blomkamp was surprised and marked intelligently the spirits with the excellent \ "District 9 \", Fable of SF realistic who denounced the effects of apartheid in South Africa, his country of origin. 4 years later, by this second feature film, it recurrences and further pushes the nail in a whole where each plan produces a carefully studied effect. \ "Elysium \" is thus an intelligent blockbuster, to the photograph worked, with realistic special effects and the scenario that denounces in a fiction the economic and geo-political disparities of our time. Because it is above all sf politics to cruelly contemporary resonance. Thus, in 2154, Los Angeles looks above all to a gigantic bidonville of Latin America - the dominant language is also the Spaniard - where massively reign, despair, diseases, insecurity and social disaggregation. While in space, the orbital \ "elysium \" station reserved for the most favored classes, strangely reminds the luxury and opulence of Beverly Hills. Not to mention this policy of rejection to overcrowded and polluted earth of clandestines that are trying to emigrate and undoubtedly evokes this frontier between Mexico and USA become impenetrable today. In anti-hero becadted in spite of him last resort from humanity against injustice, Matt Damon explodes with talent again, not to mention a remarkably chosen cast that makes this film a real success (Jodie Foster, Sharlto Copley, Alice Braga, Diego Luna, William Fincher.) As for intelligence combines the SF emerge from nuggets like \ "elysium \". It's really the good surprise cinema of the summer 2013, and a new brand reference in the Apocalyptic SF, after the excellent \ "Oblivion \" released a few months ago. PS: I will not hesitate to match this comment of technical remarks (sound and image) when I have possession of the Blu-ray in a few months. Blu-ray in a few months.

review_body: In Mrs. Croft's statement "we women don't want to be in calm waters all our lives" Jane Austen and her heroine, Anne Elliott, move beyond the domestic, from the bracing sea air of Lyme, to glimpses into the  seafaring adventures of the Navy brethren.  This to me is the predominate  appeal of Persuasion - Anne, in her approaching maturity, is reunited with  her former suitor in what we may expect is a deeper, more heartfelt love,  having endured separation for so many years and she has the prospect of  joining him at sea.  My heart leaps to see her escaping domesticity and the  dull social duties as exemplified by Sir Walter and her sister Elizabeth.   Of course, Austen's use of language is perfect.  My favourite Austen novel.   The film adaptation with Amanda Root and Ciaran Hinds exquisitely captures  the mood and characters of this book.
translated_review: In Mrs. Croft's statement "we women don't want to be in calm waters all our lives" Jane Austen and her heroine, Anne Elliott, move beyond the domestic, from the bracing sea air of Lyme, to glimpses into the  seafaring adventures of the Navy brethren.  This to me is the predominate  appeal of Persuasion - Anne, in her approaching maturity, is reunited with  her former suitor in what we may expect is a deeper, more heartfelt love,  having endured separation for so many years and she has the prospect of  joining him at sea.  My heart leaps to see her escaping domesticity and the  dull social duties as exemplified by Sir Walter and her sister Elizabeth.   Of course, Austen's use of language is perfect.  My favourite Austen novel.   The film adaptation with Amanda Root and Ciaran Hinds exquisitely captures  the mood and characters of this book.

review_body: Ce livre est un gros pavé, plein de critiques (très personnelles), de parfums. Malheureusement, je trouve que les auteurs n'arrivent pas à dépasser le 100% subjectif et se donnent rarement la peine de détailler leur avis dès qu'ils sont mauvais (et c'est également assez souvent le cas même si l'avis est bon!).  Globalement, on peut trouver des critiques de parfums bien mieux construites et détaillées sur le net. En livre, le \"Guide du Parfum\" de Rebe Veuillet-Gallot ([[ASIN:2258064198 Le Guide du parfum]]) est nettement plus intéressant, même s'il commence à dater (début 2005).
translated_review: This book is a big pavement, full of criticism (very personal), perfumes.Unfortunately, I find that the authors can not exceed the 100% subjective and rarely bother to detail their opinion as soon as they are bad (and it is also quite often the case even if the opinion is good!).Overall, we can find briefs of perfumes much better built and detailed on the net.In book, the \ "Guide to the perfume \" of rebee guess-gallot ([Asin: 2258064198 The perfume guide]]) is much more interesting, even if it starts to date (early 2005).

product_title: Rich Dad Poor Dad: What the Rich Teach Their Kids About Money-That the Poor and the Middle Class Do Not!
review_headline: Good Key Concepts -- Writing Style Difficult to Wade Through
review_body: The author gives an example of a conversation he had with a stellar writer where he states that he is a "best selling author" and not a "best writing author".  This is definitely the case. The core  concepts are very sound.  He doesn't fall into the trap of selling his  approach which is excellent -- but encourages the fundamentals which I  like. Overall, I found this audio book very interesting, but I was bogged  down by the ramblings that didn't always support the point.  I felt that I  was listening to someone do a talk from an outline versus a well thought  out and structured discussion. (Kinda like this evaluation.) The  fundamentals are sound.  Let your assets take care of your needs.  All  things are not assets.  Read the book to get the whole scoop, but those  were the key learnings for me.
translated_review: The author gives an example of a conversation he had with a stellar writer where he states that he is a "best selling author" and not a "best writing author".  This is definitely the case. The core  concepts are very sound.  He doesn't fall into the trap of selling his  approach which is excellent -- but encourages the fundamentals which I  like. Overall, I found this audio book very interesting, but I was bogged  down by the ramblings that didn't always support the point.  I felt that I  was listening to someone do a talk from an outline versus a well thought  out and structured discussion. (Kinda like this evaluation.) The  fundamentals are sound.  Let your assets take care of your needs.  All  things are not assets.  Read the book to get the whole scoop, but those  were the key learnings for me.

review_body: I love this series. Jan just keeps on getting into more situations! Trust issues. haven't we all been there? I love the theme of this book, all about the choices we make. product_title: WeeRide Classic Safe Front Mounted Children's Bike Seat, Ages 1-4
review_body: I received this item at 9am monday morning after ordering it at 2pm on Sunday - super speedy delivery. Plus good price! The seat was very easy to attach to the bike too. I had tested seats that fit to the back of the bike and did not feel confident riding with my 14 month old as felt I would drop him. This is not a worry with the wee ride as the weight is in front of you giving you control at all times. I love it my son loves it so worth every penny ( as a bit more expensive that the other back seats)not a bad word to say about the product! I also found out why the stand at the front is a great feature when my son fell asleep and just rested his head. I can reach the handle bars with no problem and even though you have to ride slightly bow legged its really not a negative.  Can't say how pleased I am with this seat- lots of happy riding ahead!

review_body: malheureusement je me suis laissé berner par les commentaires trop élogieux sur ce film. Sous produit \"d'indépendance day\" croisé avec \"la chute du faucon noir\" . du coup \"independance day\" peut passer pour un chef d'oeuvre qu'il n'est vraiment pas. Ce film est surtout un film de guerre ou çà flingue à tour de bras entre 2 scènes (patriotisme et fleur bleue) a l'américaine. le scénario est prévisible et invraisemblable: des extra-terrestres viendrais nous piquer notre flotte (H2O) en détruisant le genre humain. En tous cas n'importe quel  terrien moyen sait qu'il y a de l'eau dans l'espace ( comètes / mars / galaxies ect.) çà doit etre notre eau polluée qui les interressent.le pire c'est les acteurs et leurs dialogues indigents dignes des mauvaises série américaines. çà se prends trop au serieux . reste les effets spéciaux et les scènes de guerres qui sont plutot bien faits; en plus les aliens tirent comme des bleus.dailleurs çà fait très jeu vidéo par moments. finalement ce film peut faire rire  après une soirée bien arrosée.

From the blow \ "Independence Day \" can pass for a masterpiece that it is really not. This film is above all a warfare or çà gun in arms between 2 scenes (patriotism and blue flower) has the American. The scenario is predictable and implausible: extra-terrestrials will be stinging our fleet (H2O) by destroying the human race. In any case, any mean earth knows that there is water in space (comets / mars / galaxies ect.) It must be our polluted water that interests them. The worst is the actors and Their indigent dialogues worthy of the bad American series. It's too serious. remains the special effects and scenes of wars that are rather well done; In addition the aliens pull like blues.anders it is very video game at times. Finally this movie can make you laugh after a well watered evening.

review_body: The Social Network, directed by David Fincher, is a film about the founding of the social network site, Facebook. Mark Zuckerburg, played by Jesse Eisenberg, is a computer programming undergraduate genius studying at Harvard. One night, after a few beers, he decides to go back to his dorm and blog his frustration about women. During this he decides to set up a website to compare women, meant originally only for his campus, the word soon spreads and after a few alterations, investments and friendships being pushed to their limits the social network known as Facebook was born, but at what price? I found this film interesting, to find out where Facebook came from and the ideas, decisions and sacrifices that were made in order to launch this huge social website. Jesse plays Mark Zuckerburg, the founder of the social network who is an extremely intelligent and business minded person but lacking in social skills, often pushing people away as he presses the fact of his genius status. I was also impressed by the supporting actor Andrew Garfeild who plays Facebook's co founder and Mark's best friend Eduardo Saveirn. This is an actor I have seen very little of before this film and loved how he played Eduardo, I think he is a very capable actor and I look forward to seen him in the future. The only thing that held me back from seeing this film when it first came out was the fact Justin Timberlake was in it. Upon watching it I have to say he did a pretty good job playing Sean Parker, the founder of Napster. So overall I thought this film was definitely worth seeing if you are curious as to how Facebook was founded. It wasn't a terribly exciting film but was very interesting and managed to capture me and keep my attention right to the very end, impressive. I would recommend this film to anyone who uses Facebook, and let's face it most of us do. It will give you an insight into what our main character had to go through in order to make the most successful social website of all time and how Mark became the youngest billionaire in history. Written by Oliver Willis (WatchReadReview)f all time and how Mark became the youngest billionaire in history.   Written by Oliver Willis (WatchReadReview)

Wenn man dann die Cd voller Vorfreude, dank des ersten Albums "Parachutes", in den Cd-Player legt bekommt man eigenwürdige Musik dargeboten. Doch diese eigenwürdige Musik ist einerseits entspannend, beruhigend und gut um einfach abzuschalten, andererseits kann man sich mit ihr beschäftigen, man kann die Texte interpretieren, dann erfährt man, welche Tiefgründigkeit hinter den Texten steckt, oder die Musik auf sich wirken lassen.man bekommt Gänsehaut wenn man Stücke wie "The Scientist", oder "Green eyes" hört. review_headline: Bolder than Cross; prog-dance in the making.
review_body: Imagine if the Bee Gees decided to make a prog-rock album, or that Jeff Wayne's War Of The Worlds was conducted in a disco. That's how Justice have played out on their follow up to one of the greatest dance albums of the last 10 years, Cross. They've dropped the samples and have made an electro-instrumental album with tinges of progressive rock.  A wonder to behold, Audio Video Disco contains nods to some of the greatest rock of the 70's, but keeps the great elements of experimental dance from the 00's. Highlights include Canon - a club-stomper built for Daft Punk, and Helix - a nod to the last album but with bigger and bolder synths.  It's not Cross, but it doesn't need to be. It's a bold, guitar-laden album built on rock instead of exterimental-dance. Rejoice.

That's how Justice have played out on their follow up to one of the greatest dance albums of the last 10 years, Cross. A wonder to behold, Audio Video Disco contains nods to some of the greatest rock of the 70's, but keeps the great elements of experimental dance from the 00's. Highlights include Canon - a club-stomper built for Daft Punk, and Helix - a nod to the last album but with bigger and bolder synths.  It's not Cross, but it doesn't need to be. It's a bold, guitar-laden album built on rock instead of exterimental-dance. Rejoice.

review_headline: Jeu stratégique à seul ou à plusieurs
review_body: Merci d'indiquer si ce commentaire vous a aidé dans votre choix. Tout d'abord ce jeu est la version électronique du jeu de plateau Carcassonne, qui a eu plusieurs distinctions. Ce jeu est stratégique, et bien que les règle soient simples, il faut plusieurs parties pour commencer à se débrouiller faces aux habitués.  La version mobile / tablette reprend bien les règles du jeu, et permet de jouer aux extensions. Attention les extensions achetées nécessitent Internet pour pouvoir y jouer. Donc attention si vous partez à l'étranger ou dans une zone non couverte.  Ce jeu se joue seul face à un ou plusieurs adversaires gérés par le téphones, ou bien à plusieurs autour du même appareil.
translated_review: Please indicate if this comment has helped you in your choice.First of all this game is the electronic version of the Carcassonne plateau game, which had several distinctions.This game is strategic, and although the rule is simple, it takes several parts to begin to fend for regulars.The mobile / tablet version resumes the rules of the game, and allows to play extensions.CAUTION The extensions purchased require the internet to play it.So careful if you go abroad or in a non-covered area.This game is played alone in front of one or more opponents managed by the tips, or many around the same device.

review_headline: Das wichtigste Buch zum Thema Bedarfsanalyse
review_body: Vor und nach Neil Rackham's Buch gab es niemand, der sich so tief mit dem Thema befasst hat. Das ist zwar traurig, aber sein Buch ist immerhin ausgesprochen lesenswert. Seine SPIN-Selling Methode der Bedarfsanalyse ist leicht verständlich, wenngleich es nicht so leicht ist, sein eigenes Verhalten entsprechend zu verändern. Schön ist auch, Sie müssen nicht glauben, dass diese Methode funktioniert. Es ist wissenschaftlich bewiesen. Mehr und besser zu fragen bedeutet, mehr über den Kunden zu wissen und diesen besser zu verstehen. Dann werden Sie auch mehr verkaufen, mit weniger Einwänden und mehr Erfolg. Gehen Sie es an. Viel Spass beim Lesen.
translated_review: Before and after Neil Rackham's book there was no one who dealt so deep with the topic.That's sad, but his book is at least very worth reading.Its spin-selling method of demand analysis is easily understandable, although it is not so easy to change its own behavior accordingly.It's nice too, you do not have to believe that this method works.It is scientifically proven.More and better to ask questions to know more about the customer and better understand it.Then you will also sell more, with less objections and more success.Go it on.Have fun while reading.

product_title: Withings Pulse - Suivi d'activité + Analyse du sommeil + Fréquence cardiaque, Noir
review_body: Attention chez withings le service après vente est inexistant. J'ai contacté le service après vente de withings, leur ai laissé deux mails restés sans réponse, tout ce que j'ai reçu c'est un mail automatique me disant que ma demande avait bien été prise en compte. C'est vraiment honteux pour un produit de cette valeur. C'est une boite française innovante mais qui se moque complètement de ses clients. Vraiment déçu.
translated_review: Attention at Withings the after sales service is non-existent.I contacted the after-sales service of Withings, left them two emails remained unanswered, all that I received is an automatic email telling me that my request had been taken into account.It's really shameful for a product of this value.It is an innovative French box that is completely mocking its customers.Really disappointed.

review_body: Jack Ryan. Der Name verspricht Action und Spannung nach Altmeister Tom Clancy. Doch dieser Film leiht sich leider nur den Namen des bekannten Protagonisten. Denn nach einem komplexen Politthriller sieht "Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit" leider nicht aus. Die Personen bleiben blass, die Story altbekannt und größtenteils völliger murks. Schade eigentlich, denn Schauspieler und Filmteam machen eigentlich einen guten Job. Die Action-Sequenzen sind gut, die Szenen passig inzeniert. Das alles hilft aber einfach nicht über die Story hinweg.  Fazit: Lieber mal wieder "Jagt auf roter Oktober" anschmeißen und richtiges Clancy Feeling spüren. ;)

review_body: Für mich hat der hochgelobte Film nur vier (oder vielleicht gar nur 3 1/2) Sterne verdient. Zunächst passt an dem Film natürlich vieles. Der Grundplot ist harmlos (aber das darf er in solchen Filmen), aber amüsant. Die Atmosphäre ist luftig leicht, es gibt viele sehr witzig Einzelszenen und -dialoge, handwerklich passt alles, schauspielerisch ist alles bis in die Nebenrollen hinein ausgeglichen. So gesehen eine romantische und intelligente Komödie auf hohem Niveau und mit originellen Ideen.    Es gibt allerdings zwei Einschränkungen: Erstens verliert der Film im zweiten Teil deutlich an Fahrt. Die erste Hälfte spielt in wenigen Tagen an einer Location (einem Sommerhaus am Strand bzw. einem Krankenhaus und einem Supermarkt nearby). Das ist konzentriert und so ist auch die Story und Stimmung: Konzentriert, knackig, unterhaltsam. Dann aber entstehen in der Geschichte Pausen von ein paar Tagen bis zu 6 Monaten und das überträgt sich dann auf die gesamte Stimmung und Wirkung: Es wirkt irgendwie zerfahren, ohne rechten Anschluss, nicht so überzeugend.    Zweitens bin ich entgegen der Mehrheit der Meinung, dass Nicholson in dieser Rolle nicht überzeugt. Zum einen ist er viel zu uncharmant (sorry, aber den Fiesling an sich kriegt er einfach nicht weg), zum anderen merkt man wieder mal deutlich, dass er kein Ensemble-Spieler ist, was aber in einer Liebeskomödie, in der man ja etwas 'zwischen' den Darstellern spüren soll, immens wichtig ist. Man achte mal auf seine Augen und Gesichtszüge in romantischen Momenten. Er reagiert überhaupt nicht auf sein Gegenüber, sondern spielt solo sein Ding. Das zwar auf hohem Nievau, aber eben solo. Diane Keaton spielt ihn hier locker an die Wand und hätte einen besseren Partner verdient gehabt.
translated_review: For me, the highly praised film has earned only four (or maybe only 3 1/2) stars. At first, of course, much fits the film. The basic plot is harmless (but he may in such films), but amusing. The atmosphere is airy easily, there are many very funny individual scenes and dialogues, craftsmanship fits everything, acting everything is balanced into the secondary rollers. So seen a romantic and intelligent comedy at a high level and with original ideas. However, there are two restrictions: First, the film loses significantly in the second part. The first half plays in a location in a few days (a summer house on the beach or a hospital and a supermarket nearby). This is concentrated and so is the story and mood: concentrated, crisp, entertaining. But then in the history breaks from a few days of up to 6 months and that then transfers to the entire mood and effect: it somehow seems crushing, without right connection, not so convincing. Second, contrary to the majority, I believe that Nicholson is not convinced in this role. On the one hand, he is far too unchordly (sorry, but the nasty, he just does not get away), and on the other hand, you realize again that he is not an ensemble player, but in a love comedy, in which you do something ' between 'the performers should feel immensely important. You pay attention to his eyes and facial features in romantic moments. He does not respond to his counterpart at all, but plays solo his thing. That although on a high Nievau, but just solo. Diane Keaton simply plays him here to the wall and had earned a better partner.

review_headline: Fine for kids but NOT to be missed by adults!!
review_body: If you thought that cartoons were just something to entertain children with,then watch this and change your outlook forever. This is a beautifully drawn animation.You'll find that after a few minutes you'll forget that it's a cartoon. The story successfully keeps the viewer's interest throughout. The plot has an interestingly, topical, environmental edge to it. I found myself haunted by it for days after I'd finished watching it.

review_headline: Mystisch und magisch? Nein. Ớberflächlich und verwirrend? JA!
review_body: Buchgestaltung'  Einfach bezaubernd! Das Cover, die Innenaufmachung'der Titel: Alles daran schreit supertolles Buch! Leider war dem nicht so'  Meinung'  VERWIRRT.  Das bin ich. Immer noch. Die meiste Zeit während des Lesens und auch danach habe ich mich einfach nur gefragt: um was genau ging es in dem Buch? Was hatte die Geschichte für einen Sinn? Was ist da gleich noch mal passiert? Ich weiß es ehrlich gesagt nicht. Das liegt nicht daran, das die Sprache des Buches schwer oder unverständlich war, es lag einfach an der konfusen und sinnlosen Handlung.  Alles beginnt recht viel versprechend mit einem Prolog und ein paar aufregenden ersten Kapiteln. Das Erste, was mich aber sofort gestört hat war der Schreibstil:Erzählperspektive, Gegenwartsform. Öhm'ich weiß nicht. Ich bin damit nicht wirklich klar gekommen. Kombiniert mit den seltsam formulierten Sätzen, bei denen der Satzbauch manchmal echt komisch war und den kurzen Beschreibungen hatte ich ständig das Gefühl, als würde in jedem Satz etwas fehlen, als wären diese abgehackt. Es kann natürlich auch nur mein persönliches Empfinden sein, aber das ganze Buch über hat dieser Schreibstil mir die Geschichte über vermiest ' nicht das diese das nicht auch alleine geschafft hätte.  Der Plot war'ja, was denn eigentlich? Ich finde dafür nicht die richtigen Worte. Es gibt oftmals Füller Kapitel in Büchern, zu lang gezogene Nebenhandlungen, aber so was ist mir noch nie untergekommen. Das ganze Buch schien eine einzige langamtige Herauszögerung des Finales zu sein. Ich fand die Kapitel weder unterhaltsam, noch spannend, noch'na ja, eigentlich konnte ich dem ganzen nichts positives abgewinnen. Das einzige, was mir gefallen hat, waren kurze Zwischenkapitel in denen einem der Zirkus beschrieben wurde. Diese Kapitel waren so aufgemacht, als würde man den Zirkus gerade selber betreten und man würde gesagt bekommen, was man sieht. Das war wirklich toll gemacht! Aber von den über 400 Seiten waren das vielleicht 20 wenns hoch kommt'.  Alles dreht sich um den ach so mystischen Zirkus, über den man aber eigentlich so gar nichts erfährt. Das Duell, was einem im Klappentext versprochen wird findet auch nicht wirklich statt. Auf gerade mal 5 (?) Seiten plätschert der Höhepunkt melodramatisch daher, ohne mich zu berühren oder zu faszinieren.  Die Charaktere waren wie seelenlose Geister, die einfach nur vor sich her gelebt haben. Da gab es kein Gefühl, keine tiefere Verbindung, keine Chance Sympathien aufzubauen und das obwohl Erin Morgenstern den beiden ganz tolle Geschichten gegeben hat, deren Potenzial und Konflikte einfach nicht genutzt wurde. Marco als der Waisenjunge, der sich behaupten muss oder Ceclia, die unter der Fuchtel ihres Vaters steht, der sie sogar misshandelt'es war so, als ob de beiden das alles egal ist. Ach, ich wurde ja nur gefoltert, um Magie zu lernen. No Problemo. Keine Eltern, kein Geld? Mh, was sollts, warum drüber nachdenken, wenn ich doch im magischen, mystischen Night Circus arbeiten darf! Juhu! Das, was mich aber so richtig, richtig gestört hat, was, das beide die Anweisungen ihrer 'Magiemeister' folgen, um irgendwann mal DAS DUELL auszutragen, aber keine einzige Sekunde lang in 20 Jahren fragen die beiden sich mal warum. Hallo? Wo bleibt da denn bitte die Logik?  Oder hab ich da was verschlafen? Gut möglich, denn Das Buch war absolut nicht mein Fall! review_body: I hadn't seen this film since it came out in 1967 so had only bits of memories of it. Often when you revisit things in the past they are not at all as you remember them but this enjoyable film is a delight. Although Finney is a little wooden in places Hepburn turns in a great performance and the tale of their relationship through the years is played out in a very interesing 'flashback' style.Nicely shot and very funny too.

review_body: Es gibt sehr wenige Filme, die ich nicht bis zum Schluß angeschaut habe, und „Lost in Translation\" ist einer davon, und das will was heißen, denn ich breche die Vorstellung wirklich nur dann ab, wenn es nicht mehr auszuhalten ist. Zum Inhalt: Der Hauptfigur ist ein Schauspieler, der sich in Tokio langweilt, und den Zuschauer auch. Er lernt eine junge Frau kennen und führt mit ihr langweilige Konversation. Sie singen in einer Karaoke-Bar, und es geht weiter mit langweiliger Konversation, und es hört und hört nicht auf. Unerträglich.

He learns a young woman and leads with her boring conversation. They sing in a karaoke bar, and it continues with boring conversation, and it continuesListen and does not stop. unbearable.

review_body: Like many people, I had seen TV and film adaptartions of this fantastic story without reading the actual book. I was inspired to read it after seeing a TV show on the BBC where they were trying to find the nation's favourite book. Famous people gave a short piece to camera about why their particular book should be chosen. Alan Titchmarch gave such an enthusiastic review of Rebecca, that I was compelled to go to the library the following day to borrow a copy.  Rebecca is my favourite book, written by the wonderful Daphne Du Maurier. In fact I think the success of the book was a problem for Du Maurier, as it completely eclipsed her subsequent works, and all the public ever wanted to ask her about was Rebecca.  The story is set in Cornwall, which is a place that Du Maurier lived herself and had a great passion for, as reflected in her writing. The main character in the story is a young, rather unassuming woman, and interestingly, her name is not mentioned anywhere in the book. This is a fantastic plot device used by Du Maurier, because the whole story is about the \"other woman\" Rebecca.  The young protagonist starts the story as a paid companion for an overbearing woman, who is taking a holiday in Monte Carlo. There they meet the mysterious Maxim De Winter, who is a rich widower, having lost his wife Rebecca in a boating accident. Maxim and the young girl strike up a friendship, and the girl is shocked, when after a short time, Maxim asks her to marry him. This will make her mistress of Manderley, a huge stately residence in Cornwall, with a huge estate and many servants. Naturally, she finds the thought of this intimidating.  They marry and return to Manderly, to be met at the gate by a line of servants standing to attention, and of course, the housekeeper, the formidable Mrs Danvers. It soon becomes apparent that although the previous lady of the house is dead, her influence is very much alive in the house, with everything being kept as it was before she died, even her room and her clothes. Mrs Danvers adored Rebecca, and resents this young newcomer who can never take Rebecca's place.  Daphne Du Maurier is brilliant at showing the feelings of the young woman, who is completely overwhelmed by her new situation. Rather than feeling mistress of the house, she feels like an intruder. When the phone rings and someone asks for Mrs De Winter, her new married name, she replies sheepishly that Mrs De Winter died in a boating accident. When she breaks an ornament, she hides it in a drawer as if she were a naughty child. Gradually events unfold to an amazing climax, as the woman gets more paranoid, thinking that Max loved Rebecca and can never love her. But did he? In an amazing plot twist everything is turned on its head.  I love the way Du Maurier describes in detail the surroundings of Cornwall and the house. It makes the story come alive in your mind in a way that no TV adaptation can. Her writing pulls you into the story and consumes you as a reader, the sights the smells and the atmosphere.  I would recommend this book to anyone, male or female, as it has a huge appeal to a wide range of people. This is a true classic, and one that can be read with fresh eyes time and time again, because you always see something new in the detail that you didn't notice before.en her room and her clothes. Mrs Danvers adored Rebecca, and resents this young newcomer who can never take Rebecca's place.   Daphne Du Maurier is brilliant at showing the feelings of the young woman, who is completely overwhelmed by her new situation. Rather than feeling mistress of the house, she feels like an intruder. When the phone rings and someone asks for Mrs De Winter, her new married name, she replies sheepishly that Mrs De Winter died in a boating accident. When she breaks an ornament, she hides it in a drawer as if she were a naughty child. Gradually events unfold to an amazing climax, as the woman gets more paranoid, thinking that Max loved Rebecca and can never love her. But did he? In an amazing plot twist everything is turned on its head.   I love the way Du Maurier describes in detail the surroundings of Cornwall and the house. It makes the story come alive in your mind in a way that no TV adaptation can. Her writing pulls you into the story and consumes you as a reader, the sights the smells and the atmosphere.   I would recommend this book to anyone, male or female, as it has a huge appeal to a wide range of people. This is a true classic, and one that can be read with fresh eyes time and time again, because you always see something new in the detail that you didn't notice before.

review_body: Wie der Titel schon sagt, geht es darum, John Malkovich zu sein. Der Author Charlie Kaufman hat sich wirklich etwas ganz Außergewöhnliches einfallen lassen, allerdings ist die Handlung insgesamt zäh und der Set bedrückend, nicht zuletzt wegen der 7 1/2 Etage. John Cusack spielt den Puppenspieler brillant, Cameron Diaz ist als seine Ehefrau mit ihrer Perücke kaum wiederzuerkennen. Aber die Liebschaften wirken gekünstelt, alles dreht sich letztendlich nur ums John-Malkovich-Sein. Trotzdem ein guter, außergewöhnlicher Film. Die DVD [UK Import] ist gut, wenn auch nicht herausragend. Das Menü ist Durchschnitt, dafür besticht die deutsche Tonspur durch ihren guten Dolby Digital 5.1 Sound. Wenn im Film die Nachbarn hinten rufen „Ruhe, da drüben\" glaubt man wirklich, daß dies die eigenen Nachbarn sind. Zur UK-DVD ist auch ein kleines Booklet als Erklärung zum „Jemand-Anderes-Sein\" beigelegt. Dies sollte man aber erst nach dem Film studieren, wenn man den Clou noch nicht kennt. Sehenswert auf eine andere Art ist das Interview mit dem Regisseur Spike Jonze, das wohl nach einer durchzechten Nacht aufgenommen wurde. Achtung: Die DVD Halterung gibt die Scheibe ungern heraus. Wer die DVD nicht irgendwann durchgebrochen haben möchte, sollte diese in einer CD-Box aufbewahren.

review_body: J'ai beaucoup, beaucoup aimé ce roman. Un roman dont le souffle gagne peu à peu le lecteur. Entre fantasy et romance, l'histoire a de formidables atouts pour étourdir en nous entraînant dans ce monde merveilleux et inquiétant des Gracelings. Les personnages sont de toute beauté, Katsa en tête est une jeune femme forte et qui revendique son désir d'indépendance et d'être libre. Elle refuse le mariage, les enfants et les prétendants. Aussi, est-elle bien embêtée lorsqu'elle prend conscience de ses sentiments pour le prince Po (formidable personnage, entre nous, compréhensif, charmeur, vaillant.). Il n'y a néanmoins pas un torrent d'érotisme dans ce roman (ou si peu), nous sommes à la frontière du roman pour jeunes adultes, mais point d'hypocrisie non plus car Katsa et Po vont vivre leur amour en choisissant d'être des amants. D'où passage à l'acte. (Je le précise, si vous souhaitez le confier à des lecteurs qui pourraient s'émouvoir d'une telle audace ! ;o) La description de la scène reste néanmoins gentille.)  A partir du moment où la liaison est affichée, le couple n'en devient pas niaiseux pour autant, et c'est tant mieux ! La demoiselle est une tigresse, son alter ego se révèle d'une noblesse exemplaire et digne pour établir le bon équilibre. En fait, l'émotion est très souvent bridée, ou n'est-ce que mon sentiment, au profit de l'action : longues chevauchées dans la forêt, lente ascension des cols montagneux, et j'en passe. L'ennemi que doivent affronter Katsa et Po est particulièrement redoutable, à tel point que la fin de l'histoire en devient frustrante (trop précipitée et improbable) ! Ce sont des défauts infimes, sans conséquence, car j'ai diablement savouré cette lecture !
translated_review: I really liked this novel. A novel whose breath also gains the reader little by little. Between Fantasy and Romance, the story has great assets to stun, leading us in this wonderful and disturbing world of graceling. The characters are beautiful, Katsa in mind is a strong young woman who claims her desire for independence and being free. She refuses marriage, children and contenders. Also, is well embellished when it becomes aware of his feelings for Prince Po (great character, between us, understanding, charming, valiant.). There is nevertheless not a torrent of eroticism in this novel (or so little), we are on the border of the novel for young adults, but point of hypocrisy either because Katsa and Po will live their love by choosing d to be lovers. Hence the act. (I specify it, if you want to confide it to readers that could be immersed by such a daring!; O) The description of the scene remains kind.) From the moment the bond is displayed, the torque n 'Do not become easeous, and it's so much better! The lady is a tigress, his alter ego is a nobility exemplary and worthy to establish the right balance. In fact, the emotion is very often bridle, or is my feeling, in favor of the action: long riding in the forest, slow climbing mountain passes, and I pass. The enemy that Katsa and Po face is particularly formidable, so much so that the end of history becomes frustrating (too hasty and unlikely)! These are tiny defects, without consequence, because I have savored this reading!

review_body: Ok, so maybe 'stunning' isn't quite the right word to describe this album - it doesn't grip you on the first listen, and maybe not even the second.  But that third time round, I was blown away.    There aren't many albums around that can just be played, straight through.  Even the greatest albums have tracks that you just skip through.  But this album? No. I enjoyed every single track on this album.  What does that make it?  The greatest album ever made, surely.  Maybe, as most great albums do, it doesn't have many tracks which are that well known and revered throughout society.  But who cares?  This is a beautiful, sublime album.  As such, I can't pick out the best songs from the album.  Whereas, before buying the album, I would have chosen 'Karma Police' and 'Paranoid Android' as my top two, now I really couldn't decide.    You have to buy this CD.  In twenty, thirty years when you dig out your old CD collection, albums by the Arctic Monkeys, Fall Out Boy and The Killers will seem rubbish, or at least unremarkable.  This album will not.  It is timeless.  When your kids ask about the music you used to listen to, expecting to be able to laugh themselves silly, play them this.  That'll shut them up.    And please, please, bring this back up to the five stars it deserves.  It is probably more worthy of it than any other album.

But that third time round, I was blown away.    There aren't many albums around that can just be played, straight through.  Even the greatest albums have tracks that you just skip through.  But this album? No. I enjoyed every single track on this album.  What does that make it?  The greatest album ever made, surely.  Maybe, as most great albums do, it doesn't have many tracks which are that well known and revered throughout society.  But who cares?  This is a beautiful, sublime album.  As such, I can't pick out the best songs from the album.  Whereas, before buying the album, I would have chosen 'Karma Police' and 'Paranoid Android' as my top two, now I really couldn't decide.    You have to buy this CD.  In twenty, thirty years when you dig out your old CD collection, albums by the Arctic Monkeys, Fall Out Boy and The Killers will seem rubbish, or at least unremarkable.  This album will not.  It is timeless.  When your kids ask about the music you used to listen to, expecting to be able to laugh themselves silly, play them this.  That'll shut them up.    And please, please, bring this back up to the five stars it deserves.  It is probably more worthy of it than any other album.

review_headline: Wenn ich das Bucht nicht gelesen hätte...
review_body: . hätte ich den Film sicher besser gefunden. Was passiert haben schon viele vor mir geschrieben, daher möchte ich mich nicht weiter darüber auslassen.  Die Schauspieler sind an und für sich gut gewählt, nur Hilary Swank als Holly kommt für mich etwas steif herüber. Der Film an sich ist eigentlich eine schöne Schnulze, aber wenn man vom Buch so begeistert war wie ich, dann ist der Film dazu einfach nicht gelungen. Da es meiner Meinung nach einige sehr gute Buchverfilmungen gibt (Herr der Ringe, Harry Potter), hätte man auch diesen Film ohne große Tricks und viel Aufwand um einiges besser machen können. Was mich am meisten störte, war die Änderung des Plots (Amerika statt Irland) und dass dadurch Holly plötzlich ganz andere Jobs hat (Immobilienmaklerin statt einfache Sekretärin, Schuhdesignerin statt Zeitungsmitarbeiterin), dass einige im Buch sehr liebenswürdige Figuren ganz gefehlt haben (Holly's Vater, Holly's Bruder), dass einige Figuren schon zu Anfang da waren (z.B. Daniel - den lernt sie ja eigentlich erst durch ihren Bruder und den Zeitungsjob kennen) und dass die sonst liebevolle Mutter eine solch verbitterte Frau ist. Hätte man sich einfach ein wenig mehr an die Buchvorlage gehalten, dann wäre auch ein etwas besserer Film dabei rausgekommen.  Fazit: wenn ich das Buch nicht vorher verschlungen hätte, dann hätte mir der Film wahrscheinlich besser gefallen. Allen die das Buch kennen & mögen rate ich, den Film besser nicht anzuschauen, man verdirbt sich die schöne melancholische Stimmung.
translated_review: . I would have found the movie certainly better. What happened many have written before me, so I do not want to leave myself further. The actors are in and chosen well, only Hilary Swank as Holly comes up for me a little stiff. The movie itself is actually a beautiful Schnulze, but if you were so enthusiastic about the book like me, then the movie just did not succeed. Since in my opinion, there are some very good book films (Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter), you could have done this movie without great tricks and much effort to make a lot better. What disturbed me most was the change of the plot (America instead of Ireland) and that Holly suddenly has completely different jobs (real estate agent instead of simple secretary, shoe designer instead of newspaper employee) that some in the book very lovely figures have been completely missing (Holly's father, Holly's brother) that some figures were already there in the beginning (eg Daniel - they really get to know by their brother and the newspaper job) and that the otherwise loving mother is such a bitter woman. If you just have held a little more to the book template, then a slightly better movie would have come out. Conclusion: If I did not get the book previously, then I would have liked the movie better. All those who know the book, I advise I better not to look at the movie, you spoil the beautiful melancholy mood.

review_body: .I like dirgey stuff.  They invented antidepressants for people like me.  Still.  I think old Lisa G could benefit from a regular dose of Lithium.  For God's sake, woman, smell the Roses.    Still, as with The Mirror Pool, it is haunting.  No, literally.  I was so spooked after listening to Mirror Pool and Duality in close succession that I had to turn all the house lights on and check the cupboards.  Lisa G's dirges have an overtone of brooding supernatural menace to them.    On the other hand, maybe I should stop eating those funny mushrooms that grow so rampantly on my cellar wall.  Yeah, Lisa G; she can come over and share medication with me any time.  Another round of mood stabilisers over here, mine host.  Spookily frothy, yet inspirational.  Just remember, leave the psycho-active drugs alone while you're listening to it.

review_headline: Schuhe sind der Spiegel zur Seele
review_body: Ich muss gestehen, dass ich mich vorher nicht wirklich für die Handlung des Films interessiert habe. Vielmehr habe ich mir den Film nur deswegen angeschaut, weil ich mal eine andere Seite von Emma Watson kennenlernen wollte.    Und das ist der Jungschauspielerin hiermit auch gelungen. Zwar sehe ich immer noch Hermine Granger in ihr, aber sie schafft es immer mehr, aus den Fußstapfen ihrer Harry Potter-Rolle herauszutreten.    Die Geschichte ist einfühlsam aus verschiedenen Sichten erzählt. Themen wie Liebe, Armut oder eben die Leidenschaft zum Tanzen werden auf einfühlsame Art und Weise dargestellt, sodass man sich bei diesem Film einfach nur wohlfühlen kann.    Der perfekte Film für verregnete Nachmittage.
translated_review: I have to confess that I have not really been interested in the action of the movie before.Rather, I only looked at the movie because I wanted to get to know another side of Emma Watson.And that's the young actress hereby succeeded.Although I still see Hermione Granger in her, but she always manages to move out of the footsteps of her Harry Potter role.The story is told sensibly from different views.Topics such as love, poverty or just the passion for dancing are shown in a sensitive way, so you can just feel comfortable with this movie.The perfect movie for rainy afternoons.

review_body: TesseracT, eine Band, die ich nun seit ihrem Bestehen über Youtube und andere Plattformen verfolge. Jay Postones an den Drums, James Monteith - Rhythm Guitar, Amos Williams - Bass, Ashe O`Hara -Vocals, und der Kopf der Band Acle Kahney -Guitar. Schon mit ihrem ersten Album \"One\" zeigten sie was in ihnen steckt. Dann der große Schock: Der Sänger Daniel Tompkins verließ die Band. Schnell wurde ein neuer Sänger gefunden: Elliot Coleman. Doch leider verließ auch er die Band nach dem Album \"Perspective\". TesseracT schien einfach kein Glück zu haben mit den Sängern. Letztendlich haben sie jedoch einen neuen Vocalisten gefunden: Ashe O`Hara ist sein Name. Ein unscheinbarer junger Mann, der auch wie die anderen Bandmitglieder aus England kommt. Ich selbst muss zugeben ich war ziemlich kritisch als ich ihn das erste mal zu Gesicht bekam. Allerdings wurde ich eines besseren belehrt.  Gestern kam nun endlich mein sehnlichst erwartetes Album \"Altered State\" an (Danke hier an Amazon! Wie immer super Versand!)und ich habe die 1te CD natürlich sofort in die Anlage geschmissen. (Die 2te CD ist eine reine instrumental version des albums!)  Das erste Lied \"Of Matter - Proxy\" erklang und schon nach einigen Sekunden hörte ich Ashe das erste mal singen. Und ich muss sagen, ich war einfach nur \"baff\". Was dieser unscheinbare Mann mit seiner Stimme anfängt sucht seines gleichen. Auch bei allen anderen Liedern merkt man, mit wie viel Seele , Gefühl und Können er eingesungen hat. Es ist unglaublich was er für einen Ambitus besitzt. Selbst die höchsten Töne kommen unglaublich perfekt. Und ja natürlich kann man im Studio mittlerweile so einiges hindrehen, ABER auch live ist Ashe der absolute Wahnsinn. Ich kann euch sagen ,man hört nur sehr sehr selten falsche Töne.  James Monteith gab 2012 bekannt, dass das Album melodischer werden würde als \"One\" und ,dass Einflüsse des Jazz und Folk zu hören sein würden. Viele standen dieser Aussage sehr kritisch gegenüber, doch ich kann alle beruhigen: Dieses Album besteht aus einer perfekten Kombination aus Rhythmik und Melodik, es ist schier unglaublich. Immer wieder tauchen sie auf, die bekannten \"Djent\"-Grooves. Drums, Bass und Rhythm-Guitar geben \"tighte\" Grooves zum Besten.  Nachdem ich das Album schon sehr weit durchgehört hatte, dachte ich mir, ob es denn noch besser werden könne. Und dann kam der Track \"Calabi-Yau\". Nichtsahnend setzt plötzlich ein Saxophon gespielt von Chris Barretto ein. Wie genial ist das denn! So wie ich das mitbekommen habe sind auch so ziemlich alle TesseracT Fans begeistert von dieser Neuerung. Die Kombination aus Groove, der treibt wie eine Dampflock (die Saiten der Gitarren natürlich absolut auf \"low\") und die darüber gespielten Melodien von Barretto machten mich einfach nur sprachlos. Bravo!  Im Vorletzten Lied \"Singularity\" und im letzten Lied \"Embers\" wird noch einmal alles gegeben und genial Rhythmen werden gespielt. Ganz am Ende lassen cleane Gitarren zusammen mit Barretto und seinem Saxophon das ganze in einer wundervollen Harmonie ausklingen.  Als der letzte Ton gespielt war, war ich wirklich bewegt, wie lange nicht mehr. Ich kann euch nur eines raten: KAUFT BITTE DIESES ALBUM. Ihr werdet es nicht bereuen.Und diese Band muss einfach unterstützt werden!  Von mir gibt es 11/10 Punkten! ;) Noch nie habe ich so leicht und gern so viele Punkte für ein Album vergeben!  DANKE TESSERACT!
translated_review: Tesseract, a band that I have followed since your existence about YouTube and other platforms. Jay Postones at the Drums, James Monteith - Rhythm Guitar, Amos Williams - Bass, Ashe O`hara-Vocals, and the Band Acle Kahney-Guitar's head. Already with her first album \ "One \" they showed what is in them. Then the big shock: The singer Daniel Tompkins left the band. Quickly a new singer was found: Elliot Coleman. Unfortunately, he also left the band after the album "Perspective \". Tesseract just did not seem to have luck with the singers. Ultimately, however, they have found a new vocalist: Ashe O`hara is his name. An inconspicuous young man who also comes like the other band members from England. I must admit myself I was pretty critical when I got him first. However, I was taught a better. Yesterday, my sincere expected album finally came to "Altered State \" (thanks here at Amazon! As always super shipping!) And I have the 1th CD of course also thrown into the system immediately. (The 2nd CD is a pure instrumental version of the album!) The first song \ "of Matter - Proxy" sounded and after a few seconds I heard ase for the first time singing. And I have to say I was just \ "Baff \". What this inconspicuous man begins with his voice looking for his identical. Even with all other songs, you realize how much soul, feeling and can he advise. It is unbelievable what he owns for an ambitary. Even the highest sounds are incredibly perfect. And yes, of course, in the studio you can meanwhile a lot, but also live is the absolute madness. I can tell you, you just hear very rarely false tones. James Monteith announced in 2012 that the album would become a melodic as \ "one \" and that influences of jazz and folk would be heard. Many stood very critical to this statement, but I can soothe all: This album consists of a perfect combination of rhythm and melodics, it is unbelievable. Again and again they look up, the well-known \ "Djent \" - Grooves. Drums, bass and rhythm guitar give \ "Tighte \" grooves to the best. After I had heard the album very far, I thought if it could get better. And then came the track \ "Calabi-Yau \". Nonetheless suddenly a saxophone played by Chris Barretto. How awesome is that! Just as I have noticed that are pretty much all Tesseract fans delighted from this innovation. The combination of Groove, who drives like a steam candle (the strings of guitars of course absolutely on "low \") and the melodies of Barretto played above just made me speechless. Bravo! In the penultimate song \ "singularity \" and in the last song \ "embers \" everything is given again and ingenious rhythms are played. At the end, Clean Guitars together with Barretto and his saxophone end the whole thing in a wonderful harmony. When the last sound was played, I was really moving how long nothing more. I can only advise you: please buy this album. You will not regret it. And this band must be easily supported! From me there are 11/10 points! ;) I have never been so easy and like to give as many points for an album! Thank you Tesseract!

review_body: Why didn't they just make do with the original Matrix and leave it at that? The two sequels could have been stuck together into one sequel, but no, they had to spread it out and destroy all the credibility of the original. There are some fantastic ideas, effects and so forth, but this and Reloaded really aren't that good. You need to watch this is you've watched the second film. But if you've not seen Reloaded, just stick to the original movie - the sequels spoil the whole franchise.
translated_review: Why didn't they just make do with the original Matrix and leave it at that? The two sequels could have been stuck together into one sequel, but no, they had to spread it out and destroy all the credibility of the original. There are some fantastic ideas, effects and so forth, but this and Reloaded really aren't that good. You need to watch this is you've watched the second film. But if you've not seen Reloaded, just stick to the original movie - the sequels spoil the whole franchise.

review_body: I've been listening to this non stop since I got it. Whilst there is a few songs I'm slightly unsure of, I still like them. I love the album as a whole. It's really well put together, and worth the wait. Whilst some might say it's not the 'old Paramore', no bands/artists keep their image and sound the same all the way through their career, it's boring. They lost two main members and have grown up, matured and changed since Brand New Eyes yet people expect them to sound the same? It isn't going to happen. As long as you go into this with an open mind, I'm sure you'll like it.

Un scénario qui manque d'ingéniosité, trop répétitif dans ses séquences, que ce soit dans ses scènes d'action (ou disons dans le train) ou avec les journalistes et au siège de l'entreprise. Au final un film pour moi prévisible et ennuyeux.

review_body: I enjoyed the previous X-Men films, although I'm not fanatical about them, but hmmm hmmm, Hugh Jackman.    This was another film on a plane (it seems all my viewing is on planes, reading my other reviews!) but being a captive audience with a decent choice and ten or twelve hours to kill, it seems rude not to cram four or five films in!    I really liked this actually. It makes sense of the previous films and it's always interesting to see how characters have come into being as it were. Hugh Jackman was as good as he is in everything and Wolverine got a chance to show a range of emotions other than agression which made it more personal. It didn't really explain why there were mutants in the first place - not being fanatical, this may be obvious to some or explained somewhere - but that didn't really matter. I liked the other characters, and their interaction with Wolverine and the super smooth Partick Stewart appearing at the end. The action was fast, furious and fantasic and the effects were really very slick.    Not something I'd watch again and again, but a decent way to spend a couple of hours.

review_headline: Nicht herausragend aber Clooney war schon schlechter..
review_body: Anscheinend, (den Bewertungen nach) scheiden sich bei diesem Film die Geister.  Der Film in seiner Machart, Geschichte und Ablauf erinnerte mich an die Krimis der späten 60ger.irgendwas ala Leno Ventura. Im Film spielt Clooney einen Auftragskiller der aussteigen will und bei seinem letzten Auftrag in der schön gefilmten italienischen Landschaft unter Beschuss gerät.  Ich weiss nicht warum so viele den Film so mega langweilig fanden, vieleicht hatte man falsche Erwartungen, den mit Action wird seeeehr sparsam umgegangen, dennoch (und das war die eigentliche Stärke des Films) weiss man eigentlich nie was als nächstes passiert, vieleicht gerade weil sich der Film seine Zeit nimmt.  Ich empfand den Film jedenfalls um einiges besser als die letzten Clooney Filme die ich sah (Syriana, The Good German oder Men who stare at Goat).  Die Schauspieler selber, holen das heraus aus ihren Rollen, was möglich ist. Clooney spielt seine Rolle solide aber ohne Ớscarreif zu sein, ich persönlich hätte mir für Clooneys Rolle einen Schauspieler gewünscht, der mehr Charakterzüge im Gesicht hat (Jean Reno zb.), Clooney wirkte mir zu glatt.  Ein zweites Manko ist die, für das Filmtempo, viel zu spärlich benutzte Musik, dadurch verliert der Film an Tiefe. Mehr musikalische Untermalung, hätte dem Film sehr gut getan.  Ton und Bild der DVD empfend ich als gut, über die Extras kann ich nichts sagen.  Wer sich auf einen Krimi der alten  Schule einlassen mag und kann, der wird an diesem Film seine Freude haben, einige mehr einige weniger, wer Action sucht, der sollte sich etwas anderes anschauen.

review_body: If you want to read a good book set in India, try Rohinton Mistry's books - I've read A fine Balance, and Family Matters and they are both excellent. This book however, is not. At least, I didn't enjoy reading it nearly as much. My main problem was just that all the characters were so unlikeable, especially the main protagonist who I just found quite annoying. It wasn't awful, I read it to the end and I was fairly interested in the outcome, but definitely not on my list of favourites.
translated_review: If you want to read a good book set in India, try Rohinton Mistry's books - I've read A fine Balance, and Family Matters and they are both excellent. This book however, is not. At least, I didn't enjoy reading it nearly as much. My main problem was just that all the characters were so unlikeable, especially the main protagonist who I just found quite annoying. It wasn't awful, I read it to the end and I was fairly interested in the outcome, but definitely not on my list of favourites.

review_body: 1791.  Orphaned on the ship crossing from Ireland to America, little Lavinia is taken under the wing of James Pyke, owner of Tall Oaks plantation in South Virginia.  No way, though, can she live in the big house - she instead to dwell with the servants, only white amongst coloureds.  Bewildered, she forever tries to adapt.  Increasingly she becomes aware of what slaves have to endure when certain whites take advantage - sexually abused, tortured, even killed if considered \"uppity\".  If put to the test, as most assuredly one day must happen, where will her loyalties lie?  The novel's first section is excellent - atmospheric, involving, the sense of injustice palpable and disturbing.  Sadly everything then sags with a change of location and a host of new characters.  The eventual return to Tall Oaks, in greatly altered circumstances, also fails to recapture earlier strengths - events there spread over too many years.  What scope for discussion in book groups!  Does the \"I\" approach work?  (Narration alternates between Lavinia and slave Belle.)  Is it only with the servants the novel really comes alive, the whites (good and bad) largely stereotypes?  Would the third section have far greater impact with events compressed into just a few months?  The end, when it comes, is certainly dramatic but does it convince?  I own to reservations increasing as the novel progressed, but throughout was absorbed enough to care about the outcome.  Stars?  Five for the first section, three for the others.  Overall four.

No way, though, can she live in the big house - she instead to dwell with the servants, only white amongst coloureds.  Bewildered, she forever tries to adapt.  Increasingly she becomes aware of what slaves have to endure when certain whites take advantage - sexually abused, tortured, even killed if considered \"uppity\".  If put to the test, as most assuredly one day must happen, where will her loyalties lie?  The novel's first section is excellent - atmospheric, involving, the sense of injustice palpable and disturbing.  Sadly everything then sags with a change of location and a host of new characters.  The eventual return to Tall Oaks, in greatly altered circumstances, also fails to recapture earlier strengths - events there spread over too many years.  What scope for discussion in book groups!  Does the \"I\" approach work?  (Narration alternates between Lavinia and slave Belle.)  Is it only with the servants the novel really comes alive, the whites (good and bad) largely stereotypes?  Would the third section have far greater impact with events compressed into just a few months?  The end, when it comes, is certainly dramatic but does it convince?  I own to reservations increasing as the novel progressed, but throughout was absorbed enough to care about the outcome.  Stars?  Five for the first section, three for the others.  Overall four.

review_body: Zusammen mit ihrer Mutter Joanne und ihrer jüngeren Schwester lebt die fünfzehnjährige Mia in einem grauen Wohnblock in Essex. Nachdem Joanne's Freund Connor einzieht, wird ihre Situation nicht besser. Mia hat Probleme in der Schule und träumt von einer Karriere als Tänzerin. Deshalb übt sie intensiv für ein Casting. Beim dem Besuch einer Sozialhelferin, rennt Mia weg. Dies hat Folgen. Sie muss auf ein Internat.    Nachdem Connor Joanne verlässt, spioniert Mia hinter ihm her und findet heraus, dass er bereits eine Familie hat. Spontan entführt Mia Connors Tochter und handelt sich damit weiteren Ärger ein.    Die düstere Milieustudie besitzt einige dramatische Höhepunkte, die ohne Vorankündigung spontan geschehen. Dialoge und schlüssige Handlungen zeigen die Begrenztheit der Protagonisten, die sich quasi in einem Terrarium bewegen. Die Szenabilder dokumentieren ein Ghetto, das letztendlich für die Protagonistin nicht ausweglos ist. Regie und Hauptdarstellerin ist ein interessanter Film gelungen.

After Joanne's friend Connor feeds, her situation will not be better. Mia has problems at school and dreams of a career as a dancer. That's why she practices intensively for a casting. When visiting a social assistant, Mia runs away. This has followed. She has to go to a boarding school. After Connor leaves Joanne, Mia spies behind him and finds out that he already has a family. Spontaneously kidnaps Mia Connors's daughter and is thus further anger. The gloomy milie studie has some dramatic highlights that happen spontaneously without prior notice. Dialogues and conclusive acts show the limited nature of the protagonists who are almost in a terrarium. The scenaries document a ghetto, which ultimately is not thrown out for the protagonist. Director and main actress has been a more interesting movie.

review_body: Battle Royale est dans la lignée des films de Kitano à la fois fascinant et effrayant. Une classe de  4eme sur une ile , une personne en sortira vivante; voilà la base de l histoire melant à la fois des scenes d extremes violences, d humour noirs et de philosophie sur les relations humaines. Scotcher devant son ecran on ne peut que contempler la beauté et l'atrocité des images accompagnées d une bande son convaincante. Ceux qui ont aimés \" C'est arrivé prés de chez vous \", ne seront pas deçus. En résumé, Battle Royale est un excelent film  à voir et revoir.

product_title: And Then There Were Three [Import allemand]
review_body: Album de la fin d'un groupe ou transition vers une approche plus commerciale? Les grands groupes de progressive à la fin des années 70 sont en manque d'inspiration (Yes, Pink Floyd, Supertramp.). Il reste encore dans cet album un souffle de symphonie qui s'éteindra à jamais. Je n'ai pas trop aimé la suite de Genesis, mais cet opus ne m'est pas désagréable. \"Follow You Follow Me\" clôture l'album et augure de l'avenir de Genesis. A cette époque la scène musicale est envahie pas le punk-rock et la progressive, la vraie, la pure renaitra avec Marillion ou IQ au milieu des années 80. Genesis passe brillamment la main et se tourne vers un nouveau public moins intellectuel, plus commercial. Tanpis, il y encore chez d'autres l'envie et la créativité.
translated_review: Album of the end of a group or transition to a more commercial approach?Large progressive groups in the late 1970s are lacking inspiration (yes, Pink Floyd, Supertramp.).It still remains in this album a symphony breath that will turn forever.I did not like the Suite of Genesis, but this opus is not unpleasant to me.\ "Follow you Follow me \" Closing the album and augurs for the future of Genesis.At that time the music scene is not invaded the punk-rock and the progressive, the real, the pure will return with Marillion or IQ in the mid-80s. Genesis brilliantly passes the hand and turns to a new public less intellectual, more commercial..Tanpis, there is still in others envy and creativity.

product_title: Dan Brown Boxed Set: "Digital Fortress", "Deception Point", "Angels and Demons", "The Da Vinci Code"  [Limited Edition]
review_body: Packaged brilliantly and no damage at all, all books in perfect condition. I had previously read Angels and Demons then the Da Vinci code, but wanted to read the other two he had written (apart from the 'Lost Symbol', which is also by Dan Brown, but not in this box set). I personally found Digital Fortress and Deception Code not as good as Angels and Demons or the Da Vinci Code, but good none the less. My personal favourite out of the four is Angels and Demons, but I'm sure most people would disagree and say the Da Vinci Code is better. I found that Angels and Demons (although 99% fiction) actually included quite a few non-fiction facts that I found very interesting when reading in a fiction novel. Dan Brown is an amazing author, and I suggest him to anyone.

review_body: Album culte grâce au titre phare "Smoke On The Water", "Machine Head" fait partie des grandes œuvres du hard rock ainsi qu'aux prémices du heavy metal. Il a été enregistré à Montreux, au bord du lac Léman, mais dans un endroit assez inhabituel pour y installer un studio : un grand hôtel. Peut-être que ce sont ces conditions particulières de production qui rendent cet album très abouti tout en restant assez abordable, tant au niveau du prix du CD qu'au niveau de l'écoute. Cet album a sa place parmi d'autres comme "Who's Next" des Who, "Exile on Main Street" des Rolling Stones et "A Night At The Opera" de Queen. En outre, la qualité sonore de cet enregistrement est remarquable. Sur les titres "Highway Star" et "Lazy", Ritchie Blackmore révèle son talent de guitariste en proposant des riffs monstrueux. Alors si vous appréciez le rock sous ses multiples formes, "Machine Head" est pour vous.
translated_review: Cult album thanks to the flagship title "Smoke on the water", "Head machine" is one of the great works of the hard rock as well as the premises of the Heavy Metal.It was recorded in Montreux, on Lake Geneva, but in a pretty unusual place to install a studio: a large hotel.Perhaps these are these particular production conditions that make this album very successful while remaining affordable, both at the price of the CD and at the level of listening.This album has its place among others as "Who's Next", "Exile on Main Street" of the Rolling Stones and "A night at the opera" of Queen.In addition, the sound quality of this recording is remarkable.On the titles "Highway Star" and "Lazy", Ritchie Blackmore reveals his talent as a guitarist by offering monstrous riffs.So if you enjoy rock under its multiple shapes, "Head machine" is for you.

product_title: Supernatural - Season 7 Complete (Blu-ray + UV Copy) [2012] [Region Free]
review_body: the problem with addictive TV shows, they start out with a pilot show, back in series 1. That was a bit shaky, then the characters grew. By season 5 they had done their thing and that was it! End of Show!  BUT then they came back due to DEMAND! Series 6 was a bit shaky, as it was all new ground, with new possibilities that didn't work in most cases, so season 7 was either going to bring a lot of loss ends together or not!  BUY IT, WATCH it and FIND out!  If it gives you an idea, we cannot wait a year for season 8 to become available in the UK!  we have tried other series now to help with the pain and withdrawal symptoms, but they are not a patch on SUPERNATURAL, we are now watching season 1 - 7 again while we wait :-)

review_body: This book is an endless poem of the little things in life as we experience them in the grand scheme of things.  I found myself re-reading certain lines because I was amazed at how well Roy poeticized simple things.  By  this I mean the sound of a trunk closing, the actual physical feeling of a  heart ache.  At times, I did get a bit lost and confused due to the names  and the unfamiliarity of Indian culture.  The disturbing behavior of the  characters in the book did not surprise me, instead it just reminded me how  cruel and strange people can be.  It's a different sort of read and I  recommend trying it out.

I found myself re-reading certain lines because I was amazed at how well Roy poeticized simple things.  By  this I mean the sound of a trunk closing, the actual physical feeling of a  heart ache.  At times, I did get a bit lost and confused due to the names  and the unfamiliarity of Indian culture.  The disturbing behavior of the  characters in the book did not surprise me, instead it just reminded me how  cruel and strange people can be.  It's a different sort of read and I  recommend trying it out.

review_body: Now I'm 14 years old and with the help of Weisenburger's companion, I can read and understand this book just fine. I really don't see what the big deal is, the novel is just simply an aquired taste that you have to read  for a little while and get used to. Pynchons writing style is different to  say the least (I'll admit that), but after 100 or so pages you get used to  his form and really start to appreciate it's poetic beauty. You're actually  in these people's heads, and the narrative is broken because human thought  is so all over the place. It's a brilliant Joycian technique that keeps  everything interesting and fresh. Now I realize this book is long (I still  have yet to finish it after 3 months, page 634), but I wouldn't want it  other way. This is a desert island piece, made to serve many purposes and  meanings (or none at all). There is somewhat of a plot, but I'll let you  find it yourself. And true, this book is quite a marathon, and only the  dedicated will ever get it done.I found the only way to do this is to  develope some sort of pattern in your reading so that you can get through  it. I would read a section (2-50 pages depending) at a time and never worry  about getting through the whole chapter or book. This probably allowed me  to keep my sanity and keep up interest in the novel. You however should  create your own pace. Ớverall, this is without a doubt the greatest reading  expieriance that I have yet to have (14 years let me remind you). This book  can be long and boring yes, but on the other hand you have to remember  through the bad parts how zany and entertaining most of the book is. It's  fun people, fun for intelectuals, and that is what reading is about,  FUN! If there is something that you don't understand, move on and come  back to it another day. You'll never be able to understand it all, so as I  said, MỚVE ỚN. This is an incredible work of art that with the help of a  companion piece (Weisenburger's) can be 'almost'  totally enjoyed by many.  Give it a chance if you consider yourself a skilled reader (or just a lover  of good books), and please, for all of you naysayers out there, QUIT YỚUR  GỚDDAMN WHINING, and let all of us just simply enjoy a great book.
