review_body: Wer jetzt meint, dass ich mit der Überschrift gespoilert habe, dem sollte sich bewusst sein, dass er hier auf eine große Bildungslücke trifft, denn Gia Carangi war eine sehr berühmtes Top-Model und darüberhinaus die erste öffentliche Frau mit Aids. Der Film gibt interessante Eindrücke in dieser Branche, rüttelt auf, ist durch die Tagebuchsätze von Gia sogar etwas philosophisch, und hat große Momente. Leider wird immerzu von einer schlechten, unpassenden Saxophonmelodie begleitet, die mehr nach Pornomusik klingt und die ganz tragischen Szenen irgendwie damit kaputt macht. Ja, auch die wenigen Nacktszenen, da diese zu einem gewissen Teil auch tragisch sind und so - und auch durch die Aufmachung dort dabei - einen pornorösen Abklatsch kriegen. Sehr sehr schade

Ich habe bei der Umtauschaktion von der Extended Edition als Steelbook zur 10th Anniversary Edition mit gemacht.     Ich war seiner Zeit eigentlich nicht so zufrieden mit dem Bild, habe aber echt nicht damit gerechnet, dass so viel   Potenzial vorhanden ist um eine total andere Qualität abzuliefern als die Extended Edition. Bin doch schwer angetan   und sehr überrascht.    Der Ton ist ebenso auf hohem Niveau, sehr kraftvoll, voller Elan und räumlich sehr dynamisch wie das Bild.  Das Bild ist im Vergleich zur erst Auslieferung durch die Extended Edition ein Quantensprung. Unglaublich  Hochwertig und detailreich. Hohe Schärfe und viel Kontrast, top!    Ich freue mich endlich diesen Film als qualitativ hochwertige BR in meiner Sammlung zu haben.    Story: 5 Sterne  Ton: 5 Sterne  Bild: 5 Sterne  Extras: 5 Sterne

review_body:
Dieser Klassiker ist köstlich. Ich könnte ihn mir immer wieder ansehen.
Besonders bestchend ist die Zeit, in der die Handlung spielt. Mit viel Liebe zum Detail hat Polanski hier gearbeitet. Auch der Erzählstil ist flüssig und der Film weist keine unnötigen Längen auf.
Das lustigste an diesem Film sind keine albernen Dialogwitze oder gar Slapstick, Nein!
Einfach die Absurdität der Personen ist zum totlachen. Professor Abronsius ( der bei Kälte andauernd einfriert.) mit seiner Naivität, die so gar nicht zu einem derart gebildeten Mann passt oder gar der homosexuelle Sohn des Grafen persönlich, der sich in den Gehilfen des Professors ( Roman Polanski himself) verguckt.
Die lustigste Person ist aber der Hofdiener des Grafen ( hat Ähnlichkeiten mit dem Glöckner von Notre Damme), der nicht richtig sprechen kann und in fast jeder Szene zu sehen ist. Ein Film für jedermann also, denn zu dieser anspruchsvollen Satire kann man einfach nicht nein sagen.
translated_review:
This classic is delicious.I could watch him again and again.
Particularly stitching is the time in which the action plays.With great attention to detail Polanski has worked here.The narrative style is also fluid and the film has no unnecessary lengths.
The funniest on this film are not a silly dialogue jokes or even slapstick, no!
Simply the absurdity of people is toilize.Professor Abronsius (who is always freezed in cold.) With his naivety, so not to succeed in such a man or even the homosexual son of the Count personally, who is in the assistant of Professor (Roman Polanski Himself).
The funniest person is the courtyard of the Count (has similarities with the glory of Notre Damme), who can not speak properly and to see in almost every scene.A film for everyone, because to this challenging satire you just can not say no.

review_headline: Cataclysmic, Profound Movie Bigger Than Controversy
review_body: As with almost everyone, I was stunned. I know the Stations of the Cross as well as anyone who grew up Catholic, and I know the Gospels as well any Baptist. However, like movie critic Roger Ebert, I was connected with the reality of the suffering Christ went through in a very real way. It is just a movie, and the guy on the cross wasn't Jesus. But it caused me to think about Jesus in a whole new way. I knew this was coming. I have read dozens of articles on this and tuned into every show on the movie. Not good enough. It still hit me. It wasn't the blood that spattered on my face, but the love that spattered on my heart. I viewed the movie as a Christian who believes, but I experienced something very heavy that evening. There is no separating my Christian beliefs from my reaction to the movie. The subtitles take nothing from the experience, and add to the focus on the movie's story rather its dialogue. The beginning sets the dramatic tone, delivering us into the Garden of Gesthemene as Jesus prays. Judas kisses him softly on the cheek, and a fight ensues between the posse of soldiers and Jesus' disciples. Jesus himself waits, and even heals the ear wounded by Peter, whom Jesus rebukes. The following events include a trial and flogging. Jesus never raises a hand or comment against his accusers, nor does he deny their accusations that he claims to be God. Pilate is torn politically, wanting to do the right thing and wanting to save his own position. Unwilling to assert a position, he lays the call onto the town's citizen who are in a blood-frenzy. What grabbed me in the movie were unexpected scenes, like Jesus and Mary connecting sight on the Via Dolorosa. Jesus stumbles, and the movie flashes back to Mary running to a four year old Jesus who stumbled in a field. She picks him up, holds him motherly. Now, Jesus is 33, all battered and worn from a vicious, sadistic abuse by Roman soldiers. Mary runs to him. He speaks to her, whispering cryptically, \"See mother, I make all things new,\" and does his best to press on. It is his cross to carry, and he raises to his feet. The ending is ingeniously subtle. In some ways, they are the 30 most important seconds of the movie in which it all comes together. Every drop of blood, every rejected silver piece, and every cross-dragged furrow in the road to Golgotha comes together in probably the most understated yet complete climax to a movie I have ever seen. I understand now why people bought tickets for friends, dragged people to see it. I expected to be blown away, but I didn't expect to be hit at my core on so many different levels. The movie isn't perfect. Some scenes took more poetic license than can be historically supported. Herod was different than I expected, and perhaps the least like the real Herod. His reactions to the Christ situation were consistent with the Bible, and add texture to Pilate's dilemma. Some vague scenes confused me, like when Satan carries a grimacing, sneering man-child. However, this still provided an eerie, insidious tone to the evil nature of Satan. A knowledge of Christian scripture will augment an understanding of the film's secondary flashback scenes. The movie does stand on its own, and meets the vision of its controversial director. Whether the audience is a devout believer, or seeing the movie as an artistic portrayal of history's most influential figure, the movie will work. I expect it to be rerun in theaters every Easter season. I fully recommend this DVD. Anthony Trendl\"See mother, I make all things new,\" and does his best to press on. However, this still provided an eerie, insidious tone to the evil nature of Satan. A knowledge of Christian scripture will augment an understanding of the film's secondary flashback scenes. The movie does stand on its own, and meets the vision of its controversial director. Whether the audience is a devout believer, or seeing the movie as an artistic portrayal of history's most influential figure, the movie will work. I expect it to be rerun in theaters every Easter season. I fully recommend this DVD. Anthony Trendl
translated_review: As with almost everyone, I was stunned. I know the Stations of the Cross as well as anyone who grew up Catholic, and I know the Gospels as well any Baptist. However, like movie critic Roger Ebert, I was connected with the reality of the suffering Christ went through in a very real way. It is just a movie, and the guy on the cross wasn't Jesus. But it caused me to think about Jesus in a whole new way. I knew this was coming. I have read dozens of articles on this and tuned into every show on the movie. Not good enough. It still hit me. It wasn't the blood that spattered on my face, but the love that spattered on my heart. I viewed the movie as a Christian who believes, but I experienced something very heavy that evening. There is no separating my Christian beliefs from my reaction to the movie. The subtitles take nothing from the experience, and add to the focus on the movie's story rather its dialogue. The beginning sets the dramatic tone, delivering us into the Garden of Gesthemene as Jesus prays. Judas kisses him softly on the cheek, and a fight ensues between the posse of soldiers and Jesus' disciples. Jesus himself waits, and even heals the ear wounded by Peter, whom Jesus rebukes. The following events include a trial and flogging. Jesus never raises a hand or comment against his accusers, nor does he deny their accusations that he claims to be God. Pilate is torn politically, wanting to do the right thing and wanting to save his own position. Unwilling to assert a position, he lays the call onto the town's citizen who are in a blood-frenzy. review_body: Travis is your typical bad boy, i.e, takes part in street fights for money, is covered in tattoos and sleeps with girls and tosses them away. Abby however is the good girl who has gone to college with her friend America to get away from her father. When America starts dating Travis' room mate (and cousin) Abby starts becoming friends with Travis. When they make a bet and Abby loses she has to stay in Travis' apartment for a month. When she starts to see Travis for who he truly is, she begins to fall in love. But falling in love isn't always enough.  Abby has gone to college to get away from a deep dark past which we find out about half way through the book. Now, no spoilers, but it really didn't seem like that dark a past though I will admit she obviously needed to get away from her father. Travis is your stereotypical bad boy. He takes part in street fights for money and sleeps with girls and tosses them away. Nothing new so far, right? That's pretty much how the rest of the book goes on, with new nothing really unique to this book happening, except for one aspect of the story which I'll come to later in the review.  Now down to the characters. The main characters in the story are Abby Abernathy and Travis Maddox. The whole story is told from Abby's point of view. Through this the author constantly tries to explain away Travis' behaviour but never really succeeds. You see, Travis is a manipulative, controlling man who seems to only want Abby to be a part of his life, his world, and nothing else. This is definitely not a love story! In my opinion it takes it a few steps past \"Twilight\" into an obviously abusive relationship. (Slight spoilers ahead) In one part of the book, after Abby and Travis break up, he manipulates her into going to his family home and cooking dinner for him, his father and his brothers. All because she said she would when they were still together and now he doesn't want to have to disappoint his family by telling them thathe and Abby have broken up!  That's not to say that Abby is a character I particularly liked either. She allows Travis to put her into these situations. A number of times she sees clearly that he is trying to manipulate her and she still just goes along with it! The only aspect of this story that was different to most love stories was the thoroughly unhealthy relationship Abby had with Travis. From the start they used each other's weaknesses against each other. Abby using other men to make Travis jealous and Travis using his many manipulating ways to keep Abby under his control. I truly disliked the main characters in this story and can barely remember any of the secondary characters, who serve only to provide a backdrop to the so called \"romance\".  The romance between Abby and Travis is basically the whole plot, with little distractions along the way. It was a very slow paced read, and went in circles continually going back to Travis and Abby breaking up and then their reconciliation. For me it was a struggle to get as far as I did in the book and I never managed to finish. I simply couldn't force myself to continue reading. In general I would not recommend this book, however I know it may appeal to those who think obsession is equal to true love. I would recommend this book if you enjoyed \"Fifty Shades of Grey\" or \"Twilight\".

review_body: Qui était Patton ? un chef de guerre exceptionnel ?, un meneur d'hommes hors de pair ?, un mégalomane délirant ?, un bravache \"jugulaire jugulaire ? Il y avait de tout ça dans cette personnalité fascinante, exaspérante, détestable et admirable. L'époque, le plus terrible conflit qui n'ait jamais existé dans l'histoire, les enjeux qui le sous-tendaient, tout cela rendait indispensable des hommes comme Patton.  Face à la démence allemande, à son inexpugnable opinatrieté, à sa soif ardente de destruction, seuls des De Gaulle, Churchill, Roosevelt, Truman, Staline (eh oui, même lui) Joukov, Eisenhower, Bradley, Patton, Montgomery et tous les hommes auxquels ils impulsaient leur énergie, leur volonté et leur ardeur, pouvaient endiguer un tel flot de haine, détruire la force armée allemande (la meilleure armée du monde à cette époque, outil de guerre exceptionnel pour un furieux assoiffé de mort)et amener à rescipiscence cette nation devenue totalement hors la loi.  Patton, interprété de façon magistrale par George Scott, a été un des acteurs majeurs du sauvetage des démocraties européennes et de la fin de l'Allemagne. Grâces lui en soient rendues quel qu'aient pu être ses immenses défauts. On ne se frotte pas victorieusement au Diable si l'on ne possède pas de quoi s'en sortir, même si cela vous rend infréquentable dans la vie de tous les jours. Mais la guerre de tous les jours n'a rien à voir avec la vie de tous les jours.
translated_review: Who was Patton? An exceptional warlord ?, a leader of men out of hand ?, a delirious megalomaniac ?, a bravache \ "jugular jugular? There was all that in this fascinating personality, exasperating, detestable and admirable. The time, The most terrible conflict that has never existed in history, the issues that underlies it, all this made men like Patton. In the face of German dementia, to his unexplanable Onglasses, to his ardent thirst for destruction, Only from Gaulle, Churchill, Roosevelt, Truman, Stalin (yes, even him) Joukov, Eisenhower, Bradley, Patton, Montgomery and all the men they impulsed their energy, their will and their ardor, could stem such a stream of hate, destroy the German army force (the best army of the world at that time, an exceptional war tool for a furious thirsty of death) and bring to rescuence this nation that has become totally out of the law. Patton, interpreted in a masterly manner by George Scott, was one of the major players of the rescue of the European democracies and the end of Germany. Thanks to him what they could have been his immense defects. We do not rub victoriously to the devil if you do not have anything to get by, even if it makes you lower in everyday life. But everyday war has nothing to do with everyday life.

review_headline: People back home wouldn't buy a ring if they knew it cost someone else their hand
review_body: I think that this movie is the perfect blend of a documentary and an action-drama. Clearly the intent was to bring to the forefront the issue of conflict diamonds in Africa. But instead of going for a factual film, the creators decided to throw together a group of great actors and a set of interesting sidelines to the story, polishing it into a magnificent jewel. The issue at hand is the brutal slaughtering in several parts of Africa, especially Sierra Leone, related to the control of diamonds. The situation in the movie is best described as TIA (This is Africa), a political mess, where those that govern only want to steal for their own benefit, and where there is no way to help, not even for the peace corps.    Solomon Vandy (Djimon Hounsou) is a fisherman that dreams of his son, Dia, becoming a doctor and moving on to better things. This dream is stopped in its track when the Revolutionary United Front (RUF) comes to his village and brutally slaughters most of the inhabitants. Luckily, Solomon's family escapes, but the RUF captures him and takes him to work on the diamond fields as a slave. Meanwhile, politicians in the industrialized world are aware of the problem resulting from diamonds from conflict zones and there is an agreement not to buy them anymore. The big diamond houses in Europe and the US agree, but you probably know by now that they will go around it in one way or another.    Then there is Danny (Leonardo DiCaprio), who is a local from Zimbabwe that gives arms to different guerrilla groups in exchange for diamonds and then smuggles them to Liberia, from where they can be imported into the consumer countries as conflict free rocks. When he is captured during one of his diamond operations, he is thrown in jail, where he meets Solomon. Solomon was in jail as a result of a raid of the RUF camp, but not before finding a big pink diamond that he hid underground. When the greedy Danny finds out about this, he makes sure that his future path is linked to Solomon's.    Besides the greedy and unscrupulous Danny, and the moral Solomon, who just wants his family back, we have Maddy (Jennifer Connelly), a journalist that is frustrated by the situations she witnesses all around the globe and that wants her work to be effective in stopping the destruction. The three characters go through a journey of self-discovery while everyone around them is out to kill each other for the control of the diamonds. The situation is so bad that the different revolutionary groups kidnap and train children to join them. Seeing the transformation these young minds go through in a short time breaks your heart.    The film definitely achieves its purpose of making people aware of the issues, and even though the story is gut-wrenching and some portions are extremely violent, I think that it was needed to convey the message clearly. What I did not expect before watching this movie was the outstanding performances I was going to witness. This is definitely DiCaprio's best. He even altered his accent to make it sound like a local and he does this very well. But he also has to play a character with multiple facets and that goes through somewhat of a transformation, and his performance really helps to make this believable. I have never heard of Hounsou before, but was impressed by the emotion he put into his role, and I am sure there will be many starring roles for him in the future. Jennifer Connely is the one I expected the best from, and she did not disappoint, since she delivers a performance on par to the one she gave us on excellent \"The House of Sand and Fog\". This is definitely one of the best releases of 2006, and if you can stomach the violence I believe you will agree.
translated_review: I think that this movie is the perfect blend of a documentary and an action-drama. Clearly the intent was to bring to the forefront the issue of conflict diamonds in Africa. But instead of going for a factual film, the creators decided to throw together a group of great actors and a set of interesting sidelines to the story, polishing it into a magnificent jewel. The issue at hand is the brutal slaughtering in several parts of Africa, especially Sierra Leone, related to the control of diamonds. The situation in the movie is best described as TIA (This is Africa), a political mess, where those that govern only want to steal for their own benefit, and where there is no way to help, not even for the peace corps.    Solomon Vandy (Djimon Hounsou) is a fisherman that dreams of his son, Dia, becoming a doctor and moving on to better things. This dream is stopped in its track when the Revolutionary United Front (RUF) comes to his village and brutally slaughters most of the inhabitants. Luckily, Solomon's family escapes, but the RUF captures him and takes him to work on the diamond fields as a slave. Meanwhile, politicians in the industrialized world are aware of the problem resulting from diamonds from conflict zones and there is an agreement not to buy them anymore. The big diamond houses in Europe and the US agree, but you probably know by now that they will go around it in one way or another.    Then there is Danny (Leonardo DiCaprio), who is a local from Zimbabwe that gives arms to different guerrilla groups in exchange for diamonds and then smuggles them to Liberia, from where they can be imported into the consumer countries as conflict free rocks. When he is captured during one of his diamond operations, he is thrown in jail, where he meets Solomon. Solomon was in jail as a result of a raid of the RUF camp, but not before finding a big pink diamond that he hid underground. When the greedy Danny finds out about this, he makes sure that his future path is linked to Solomon's.    Besides the greedy and unscrupulous Danny, and the moral Solomon, who just wants his family back, we have Maddy (Jennifer Connelly), a journalist that is frustrated by the situations she witnesses all around the globe and that wants her work to be effective in stopping the destruction. The three characters go through a journey of self-discovery while everyone around them is out to kill each other for the control of the diamonds. The situation is so bad that the different revolutionary groups kidnap and train children to join them. Seeing the transformation these young minds go through in a short time breaks your heart.    The film definitely achieves its purpose of making people aware of the issues, and even though the story is gut-wrenching and some portions are extremely violent, I think that it was needed to convey the message clearly. What I did not expect before watching this movie was the outstanding performances I was going to witness. This is definitely DiCaprio's best. He even altered his accent to make it sound like a local and he does this very well. But he also has to play a character with multiple facets and that goes through somewhat of a transformation, and his performance really helps to make this believable. I have never heard of Hounsou before, but was impressed by the emotion he put into his role, and I am sure there will be many starring roles for him in the future. Jennifer Connely is the one I expected the best from, and she did not disappoint, since she delivers a performance on par to the one she gave us on excellent \"The House of Sand and Fog\". This is definitely one of the best releases of 2006, and if you can stomach the violence I believe you will agree.

product_title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier [Blu-ray] [Region Free]
review_body: Switch your brain off and enjoy
translated_review: Switch your brain off and enjoy

review_body: The film dos'nt need describing as everyones seen it, except to say that this is the original uncut edition which is more violent as it has for example headcuts in the fight scenes that were orginally left on the cutting room floor. The improved picture and the sound quality especially are incredible.     The extras on the second disc are also excellent. there are various featurettes, everything from the pre-production press conference with a nervous looking Pierce Brosnan to behind the scenes of the tank chase and a look at Derek Medding's amazing minatures. Theres also some deleted scenes not all of which are good but worth a look.    I'm one of the Bond fans who had most of the films on the previous DVDs but decided to splash out for this one mainly because I wanted to see the 'uncut' version of the film and because the special features on the previous disc were weaker than on the other Bond films. I can safely say that Goldeneye at least is a worthy investment if you like the film as there is loads on here not on the previous DVD. Top sound and picture quality, great extras and fantastic presentation all round. If your thinking of getting some of the new Ultimate Edition Bond DVDs then this is a good one to start with.     Top marks

review_body: Qu'on se le dise, Paulo est de retour. Mais il faut un peu de temps pour s'en convaincre. À la première écoute, 50% de l'album paraît dispensable contre une autre moitié de très grande qualité. Puis les jours passent, et les titres \"dispensables\" deviennent plus évidents, plus attachants puis c'est un plaisir quasi intégral à terme. Pourquoi pas 5 étoiles me direz-vous? Parce qu'une chose n'est plus tout à fait au rdv, et elle est de taille: la voix. À 71 ans, le meilleur ami musicien qu'on puisse rêver d'avoir n'a plus la netteté et la précision de l'époque. Cela va bientôt faire 10 ans que sa voix chevrotte un peu, hésite parfois, comme si l'angine/laryngite avait précédé les prises et qu'on n'avait pas attendu que la maladie soit totalement guérie! Alors bien sûr, on se console comme on peut avec certains titres où l'illusion est bien là (Queenie Eye, Alligator, etc.), on croirait que le temps n'a pas encore alors fait son oeuvre, puis patatras c'est le grand âge qu'on entend derrière certains titres. Quoiqu'il en soit, il reste toujours un très grand compositeur et s'avère un parolier surprenant de profondeur simple, un talent qu'on n'avait pas forcément tout à fait bien repéré par le passé. Ce disque dépasse bien des albums de 2013, et montre, s'il fallait encore le prouver, qu'il reste encore bien des choses à dire et à jouer quand on s'appelle Sir Paul.
translated_review: Let him say, Paulo is back. But it takes a little time to be convinced of it. At first listening, 50% of the album seems dispensable against another half of very high quality. Then the days pass, and the titles \ "dispensable \" become more obvious, more endearing then it is a quasi-full pleasure event. Why not 5 stars tell me? Because a thing is no longer quite on the appointment, and it is size: the voice. At 71, the best musician friend that you can dream of having the sharpness and the accuracy of the time. It will soon be 10 years since his voice rated a little, sometimes hesitates, as if the angina / laryngitis had preceded the catches and that I did not wait for the disease to be totally healed! So of course, we console as one can with certain titles where the illusion is there (Queenie Eye, alligator, etc.), it is believed that time has not yet done, then Patatras it is The old age we hear behind certain titles. Be that as it may, there is always a very large composer and is a surprising parchment of simple depth, a talent that had not necessarily quite well spotted in the past. This disc exceeds many of the 2013 albums, and shows, if it was still necessary to prove it, that there are still many things to say and play when Sir Paul is called.

review_headline: Uupps da muss Geld verdient werden...
review_body: Als absoluter David Garrett Fan der (fast) ersten Stunde, habe ich fast alle seine Scheiben im Schrank und ihn mittlerweile 3mal life gesehen.    Was er hier abliefert ist in meinen Augen nach dem Motto produziert: die Massen des Crossover müssen bedient werden! Lieblos und einfallslos heruntergefiedelt, mit ein bisschen Beat versehen, lieber David, das reicht nicht ansatzweise an die zwei vorhergehenden Crossover CD's heran, tut mir leid.    Vielleicht hätte er einfach mal Pause machen sollen, er war ja schließlich jetzt wie lange? 2 Jahre ? ununterbrochen on Tour, und hätte sich einfach in sein stilles Kämmerlein setzen sollen, um seiner Kreativität (die er zweifelsohne hat) freien Lauf zu lassen.    Dazu kommt, dass die Fotos von ihm mittlerweile lächerlich gestylt sind (mit Eyeliner und gefönter Wellenfrisur.;-))), wer da Berater war sollte eigentlich sein Gehalt zurück zahlen.    Tut mir leid, aber ich habe den Eindruck, dass David massiv falsch beraten wird, was sein Auftreten, sein Aussehen und auch seine Kunst angeht, es befällt mich leicht der Verdacht des Verheizens, da irgendjemand hier mächtig viel Geld verdienen möchte, solange es noch geht.    Für diese CD kann ich leider keine Kaufempfehlung abgeben, was mir schon ein bisschen wehtut, wie gesagt, als eigentlich schon wirklich großer Fan von David Garrett.    Aber: Geschmack ist ja subjektiv, daher hört Euch die Ausschnitte an und urteilt dann selber.
translated_review: As an absolute David Garrett fan of the (almost) first hour, I have seen almost all his slices in the closet and now 3 times life. What he delivered here has been produced in my eyes after the motto: the masses of crossover have to be served! Liebless and unerring fieders, dear David, dear David, is not approaching the two previous Crossover CD's, I'm sorry. Maybe he would just have to take a break, he was after all how long? 2 years ? Continuous on tour, and could simply have set itself in his quiet chamber to leave his creativity (which he is undoubtedly). In addition, the photos of him are ridiculously styled (with eyeliner and fendered bodies. ;-))) who was there a consultant should actually pay his salary back. I'm sorry, but I have the impression that David is massively advised against what his appearance, his appearance and also concerns his art, it makes me easy the suspicion of burning, as someone wants to make a lot of money here, as long as it still wants to earn goes. Unfortunately, I can not give a buy recommendation for this CD, which is already a bit hurting, as I said, as actually really big fan of David Garrett. But: taste is subjective, so the excerpts listen to you and then judges yourself.

review_body: L'étrange histoire de Benjamin Button est un très beau film. C'est vraiment une histoire d'amour entre deux personnes à la croisée des âges. Mais on voit de l'action et de l'émotion. Brad Piit interprète très bien Benjamin et Cate Blanchett joue très bien le rôle de Daisy. Le film est par moment triste mais en même temps il est parfois joyeux. Je le conseille vraiment.
translated_review: The strange story of Benjamin Button is a very beautiful movie.It's really a love story between two people at the crossroads.But we see action and emotion.Brad Piit interprets very well Benjamin and Cate Blanchett plays the role of Daisy very well.The movie is at a sad moment but at the same time it is sometimes happy.I really advise it.

review_body: Edguy haben hier wieder was richtig Großes abgeliefert! Ein erstes WOW gab es von mir bei der Lieferung: "WOW, du Idiot! Du hast Vinyl bestellt!" Nach dem ersten Schreck habe ich aber doch die richtige version in den Händen gehalten. Space Police-Limeted Edition, schön gemacht im LP-Format! Ein toll gestalteter Bildband mit Texten, Infos zu den Songs, Fotos und der Geschichte der Band und den Tourdaten seit der Bandgründung.Alles macht einen sehr hochwertigen Eindruck. Ach ja, dann waren da ja noch die zwei CD´S! Rein in den Player und los geht´s: Das nächste WOW beim ersten Song: Hab ich eine Version von Avantasias "The Mystery Of Time" erwischt? "Sabre & Torch" erinnert anfangs sehr stark daran. Nach ca. 40 Sekunden weiß man aber: Hier spielt Edguy! Und wie? Großartig! Der ganze Hype vorab war meiner Meinung nach berechtigt. Die zehn Songs auf der ersten CD sind durchweg gelungen. Bei "Love Tyger" fühlt man sich ein bisschen in die 80er versetzt und es fühlt sich gut an! "Do me like a caveman" gehört schon jetzt zu meinen Favoriten. Auch die unvermeidliche Ballade "Alone in myself" fällt nicht so schmalzig aus. Edguy beweisen mit diesem Album ihren Sonderstatus in der Metal-Welt. Ist das Metal? Wenn ja, was für einer? In meinem Alter (Bj. ´66) denkt man bei Metal immer an growlende, böse guckende Schreihälse. Ich weiß natürlich, dass es dutzende verschiedene Untergruppierungen gibt, aber Edguy scheint irgendwie nirgends rein zu passen."Sammetal" wäre vielleicht der richtige Begriff. Kann ich mir das schützen lassen? Ich schweife ab. Auf der zweiten CD finden sich mehrere Instrumentalversionen, eine "Prog-Version" von "Space Police" und zwei Bonus Titel. "England" ist eine sehr unterhaltsame Hymne, da hat jemand beim Schreiben richtig viel Spaß gehabt! Und dann gibt es noch "Aychim in Hysteria". Der Song fängt an und ich dachte: "Das klingt wie." Dann beginnt Tobias Sammet zu singen und ich dachte weiter: ".der SINGT sogar wie Joe Elliott!" Wieder ein Volltreffer für meine Gehörgänge, ich mag die älteren Songs von Def Leppard sehr gern. Ein Resümee? Falls sich das noch nicht aus dem obenstehenden Text ergibt: Eine absolute Kaufempfehlung! Für mich das beste Album von Edguy, alles klingt sehr reif, durchdacht, erwachsen und doch frisch. Weiterso, ich freue mich auf die Tour!
translated_review: Edguy have returned here again! A first wow there was from me on delivery: "Wow, you idiot! You have ordered vinyl!" After the first fright, I kept the right version in the hands. Space Police-Limeted Edition, beautiful in LP format! A great designed image tape with texts, information about the songs, photos and history of the band and the tour data since the start of the belt. All makes a very high quality impression. Oh yes, then there were the two CDs! Pure in the player and starting is: The next Wow at the first song: I got a version of Avantas' The Mystery of Time "? "Sabre & Torch" initially reminds you very much. After about 40 seconds you know: here Edguy plays! And how? Great! The whole hype in advance was justified in my opinion. The ten songs on the first CD are consistently successful. At "Love Tyger" one feels a bit in the 80s offset and it feels good! "Do Me Like A Caveman" is already one of my favorites. Even the inevitable ballad "Alone in Myself" does not fall out so narrowly. Edguy with this album prove their special status in the metal world. Is the metal? If so, what kind of? At my age (year '66), Metal always thinks about growling, evil looking screams. Of course, I know that there are dozens of different subgroups, but Edguy seems to fit somehow anywhere. "Sammetal" would be the right term. Can I protect that? I welt off. On the second CD, there are several instrumental versions, a "PROG version" of "Space Police" and two bonus titles. "England" is a very entertaining anthem, someone has had a lot of fun while writing! And then there is still "Aychim in Hysteria". The song starts and I thought, "That sounds like." Then Tobias starts to sing Sammet and I thought, ".der sings even like Joe Elliott!" Again a direct hit for my belongings, I like the older songs from DEF Leppard very much. A summary? If this does not result from the above text: an absolute buy recommendation! For me the best album of Edguy, everything sounds very ripe, thought out, adult and yet fresh. Furthermore, I'm looking forward to the tour!

product_title: L HOMME QUI VOULAIT ETRE HEUREUX
review_body: Magique, magnifique, sublime, jubilatoire, passionnant, troublant, déroutant, entêtant…. Comment décrire ce livre atypique ?  On passe de la curiosité à la fascination, du rire à l’enchantement !  On m’a offert ce livre dernièrement et je n’étais pas sûr que cela me plairait beaucoup. Et bien quelle erreur ! Je ne pouvais pas le refermer et dès que je devais interrompre sa lecture, je n’arrêtais pas d’y penser au bureau. Le soir, j’étais heureux de rentrer chez moi pour pouvoir m’y replonger ! Si, si, j’étais devenu accro.  À une époque où les livres ne parlent plus que de violence, de meurtres, de vulgarité en tous genres, ce livre nous fait du bien, c’est une bonne bouffée d’air pur.  J’applaudis des deux mains et en redemande encore. Je le recommande à tout le monde autour de moi, car c’est un vrai coup de cœur. J’en ai déjà offert une dizaine à mon entourage le plus proche, et cela nous a donné matière à débat car il y a une foule de découvertes et de thèmes qui nous ont permis d’échanger entre amis.  À mon avis c’est un livre qui va faire du bruit.
translated_review: Magical, beautiful, sublime, jubilant, exciting, disturbing, confusing, heard .... How to describe this atypical book? We go from curiosity to fascination, laughter to enchantment! I was offered this book lately and I was not sure it would like me a lot. And what an error! I could not close it and as soon as I had to interrupt his reading, I did not stop thinking about it. In the evening, I was happy to go home to be able to go back! If, if I had become addicted. At a time when books do not speak only of violence, murders, vulgarity in all kinds, this book makes us good, it is a good breath of pure air. I applaud from both hands again. I recommend it to everyone around me, because it's a real favorite. I have already offered a dozen to my nearest surroundings, and this has given us a lot of debate because there is a crowd of discoveries and themes that allowed us to exchange with friends. In my opinion it's a book that will make noise.

Oh boy! :)
Dieses Album ist endlich mal wieder eine wunderbare Jackson CD nachdem das "Blood On The Dancefloor" "Dingen" zur Hälfte aus remixes bestand! :-P

review_body: Für mich eine der schönsten und packendsten Enteckungen der letzten Zeit.  Eine derartige Mischung aus Alter Musik, Klassik und Jazz habe ich vorher noch nicht gehört und sie hat mich direkt in ihren Bann gezogen.  Ich kannte Jaroussky schon vorher, aber diese CD gefällt mir am besten.  In einem Clip von einer Live-Version auf YouTube kann man schön die Stimmung sehen, die Spielfreude der Musiker, einen lockeren tanzenden (!, das bei Klassik) Jaroussky.  Ich finde das unterstreicht noch einmal die Energie der Aufnahme.
translated_review: For me one of the most beautiful and gripping unclims of the last time.Such a mix of old music, classical music and jazz I have not heard before and she pulled me directly into her spell.I already knew Jarousky before, but I like this CD best.In a clip from a live version on YouTube you can see the mood nice, the playfulness of the musicians, a loose dancing (! "Classic) Jarousky.I find that underlines the energy of the recording again.

product_title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
review_body: Harry Potter IV lives up to the hype and expectations.  We picked up the book first thing in the morning and my daughter (age 9) finished before she feel asleep.  Her review is "wow!"  I (age 43) took a bit longer  (4 days) but had the same reaction. I've seen many comments on the length  of the book, and I agree, it feels like it could be 100 pages tighter.  If  you're a Harry Potter fan, I think the first 150 pages are a bit slow as  much of the story from the first three books is repeated, but once the new  school year starts, the book takes off.  I'm also tempted to say that there  are too many extraneous details, but with Potter, it's hard to know which  details are unimportant now, but central later on.  (Remember Scabbers?).  So while Rita Skeeter seems sort of a distracting subplot, who knows?
translated_review: Harry Potter IV lives up to the hype and expectations.  We picked up the book first thing in the morning and my daughter (age 9) finished before she feel asleep.  Her review is "wow!"  I (age 43) took a bit longer  (4 days) but had the same reaction. I've seen many comments on the length  of the book, and I agree, it feels like it could be 100 pages tighter.  If  you're a Harry Potter fan, I think the first 150 pages are a bit slow as  much of the story from the first three books is repeated, but once the new  school year starts, the book takes off.  I'm also tempted to say that there  are too many extraneous details, but with Potter, it's hard to know which  details are unimportant now, but central later on.  (Remember Scabbers?).  So while Rita Skeeter seems sort of a distracting subplot, who knows?

review_body: . so kommen die Solo-Alben von Mark Knopfler seit geraumer Zeit daher: ausgereift, geerdet, vollmundig, was für Kenner. Klar, als Ex-Dire Straits Fan ist man natürlich etwas enttäuscht, dass es vergleichsweise betulich zugeht, aber sowohl das Arrangement als auch die Produktion sind über jeden Zweifel erhaben: hier sitzt jeder Ton und der Mix ist hervorragend.  Knopfler setzt einmal mehr auf keltische Elemente (Fiddle, Flöte), verzichtet aber auch nicht auf seine Trademark-Riffs, die er zunehmend - aber erkennbar! - in Watte packt. Die Songs sind sehr autobiographisch, wie es scheint und man kann immer noch sehen, dass der gelernete Journalist MK es versteht, Geschichten zu erzählen, wie die von seinem Onkel, der als Piper in die Schlacht zog oder die vom stolzen Schiff, gebaut in den Werften am Clyde, das nun in Südostasien in einem Schiffsfriedhof traurig ausgeweidet wird. Das Ganze wird wie gewohnt bei Knopfler mit der Gitarre fein nuanciert und es finden sich neben den dominierenden Folk-Elementen auch Soul und Rock'n roll, zwar oft nur hingetupft, aber dafür umso feiner.   Eine ganz wunderbare CD für die kühlen Herbsttage: golden and warm-hearted.

Of course, as an ex-dire straits fan, one is somewhat disappointed that it is comparatively inspected, but both the arrangement and the production are raised over every doubt: here sits everyone and the mix is ​​outstanding. Buttonflow once rinses more on Celtic elements (Fiddle, Flute), but does not dispense with his trademark riffs, which he increasingly - but recognizable! - packs in cotton. The songs are very autobiographical, as it seems and you can still see that the Journalist MK understands it to tell stories, like that of his uncle, who moved as a piper into the battle or built by the proud ship, built in the Shafts at the Clyde, which is now sad out in Southeast Asia in a ship's cemetery. The whole thing is finely nuanced as usual in the buttonler with the guitar and there are also soul and rock'n roll, but often only the dominant folk elements, but often only stapped, but for the finer. A very wonderful CD for the cool autumn days: Golden and Warm-Hearted.

review_body: Ich habe den Film damals beim Fantasy Filmfest in Hamburg in der Originalfassung gesehen und war sehr begeistert. Joseph Gordon-Levitt spielt seine Rolle selbstverständlich bestens und auch Natalie Portman und Rainn Wilson liefern großartiges ab. Es macht einfach Spaß zuzusehen, wie Hesher plötzlich im Leben von T.J. (und seinem Vater Paul) auftaucht und welchen Unfug er anstellt.  Zur deutschen Synchronisation kann ich bisher noch nichts sagen, da ich den Film noch nicht auf Deutsch gesehen habe, aber sobald ich ihn habe, werde ich meine Meinung dazu nochmal äußern.  Zu den Extras lässt sich leider auch noch nicht viel sagen, da diese hier noch nicht gelistet sind. Aber ich vermute sie werden ähnlich sein, wie in der amerikanischen Fassung: - Gelöschte Szenen - Outtakes - Behind the Scenes - Trailer  Bezüglich der Laufzeitunterschiede, wie in einer anderen Rezension erwähnt wurde, kann ich auch nur sagen, dass die scheinbar nur bei der DVD auftreten und ich nicht denke, dass da etwas geschnitten wurde, sondern es vermutlich entweder einfach ein Fehler ist oder es etwas mit dem Format DVD/Blu-Ray bzw. NTFC/PAL zu tun hat. PAL-Filme haben aufgrund der niedrigeren Bildwiederholungsfrequenz gegenüber NTFC-Filmen immer eine ca. 4% kürzere Laufzeit.
translated_review: I saw the film at the Fantasy Film Festival in Hamburg in the original version and was very enthusiastic. Joseph Gordon-Levitt plays his role of course well and Natalie Portman and Rinn Wilson also deliver great off. It's just fun to watch, like Hesher suddenly in the life of T.J. (and his father Paul) appears and whatever mischief he hits. For German synchronization, I can not say anything yet because I have not seen the movie in German, but as soon as I have him, I will comment my opinion again. Unfortunately, the extras can not say much, as they are not listed here. But I suppose you will be similar, as in the American version: - Deleted Scenes - Outtakes - Behind The Scenes - Trailer regarding the runtime differences, as mentioned in another review, I can only say that the seemingly only with the DVD Occur and I do not think there was something cut, but it is probably just a mistake or it has something to do with the format DVD / Blu-ray or NTFC / PAL. Pal films always have about 4% shorter runtime due to the lower refresh frequency compared to NTFC films.

review_headline: Sehr gute Doku, sollte aber kostenlos sein.
review_body: Zugegeben, Al Gore klärt in diesem Film äusserst gut und amüsant darüber auf, was zur drohenden Klimakatastrophe beiträgt. Die Synchronisation ins deutsche ist ebenfalls hervorragend. Jedoch bin ich der Meinung, das diese sehr gute Doku der öffentlichkeit kostenlos zur verfügung gestellt werden sollte.  Für 18 € erreicht man hier leider nur einen Bruchteil der Menschen, die sich ernsthaft mit dem Thema auseinanderzusetzen und bereit sind dafür auch noch Geld auszugeben. Dabei geht dieses Thema doch uns alle an und eine kostenlose Veröffentlichung an die breite Masse würde sehr viel mehr bringen, um uns alle ein wenig nachdenklicher zu stimmen, was uns da droht, wenn wir uns nicht irgendwann ändern.
translated_review: Granted, Al Gore clarifies extremely good in this film and amusing about what contributes to the threatening climate catastrophe.The synchronization into German is also excellent.However, I think that this very good documentary should be provided to the public for free.Unfortunately, you can only reach a fraction of the people for 18 €, which seriously deal with the topic and are ready to spend money.This topic is all about and a free release to the broad mass would bring much more to all of us to vote all a little more thoughtful, which threatens us if we do not change each other.

product_title: V wie Vendetta (2 DVDs, Limited Edition, Steelbook) [Special Edition]
review_body: Der Autor der Comic Vorlage, Alan Moore, ist vermutlich neben Neil Gaiman der beste Comic Texter der Gegenwart -  und V for Vendetta ist vermutlich neben \"Watchmen\" sein Meisterwerk. Um so enttäuschter war ich, als er seinen Namen aus den Credits des Films streichen lies. Auch wenn Alan Moore inzwischen wohl ziemlich exzentrisch ist, und dies auch bei anderen Umsetzungen seiner Werke schon getan hat, so hat mir das die Vorfreude auf den Film ziemlich verhagelt. Dazu kommt, dass ich zwar den ersten Matrix Film sehr gut fand, die beiden Nachfolger jedoch in meinen Augen nur ein müder Abklatsch für das Action verwöhnte Publikum darstellten, nach dem Motto \"schneller, weiter, höher\". Daher hielt ich die Wachowski Brüder für eine klare Fehlbesetzung.    Um so überraschter war ich dann vom Ergebnis. Dieser Film ist für mich die beste Comic Umsetzung überhaupt. Er hält sich eng genug an die Vorlage, ohne hier wie so oft durch unnötige Abweichungen zu verschlimmbessern, auf der anderen Seite erlaubt er sich genügend künstlerische Freiheit, um als eigenständiges Kunstwerk zu gelten (und nicht nur als 1:1 Nacherzählung wie bei den Frank Miller Vorlagen \"Sin City\" und \"300\"). Die Verweigerung von Alan Moore erscheint mir inzwischen als Überreaktion eines weltfremden Puristen.    Die Schauspieler sind durchweg gut besetzt, und auch wenn man ihn nur durch seine Maske sieht, macht Hugo Weaving hier eine weit bessere Figur als er dies zuletzt als Elrond tat. Am meisten rehabilitiert sich jedoch Natalie Portman. War sie in den Star Wars Filmen eigentlich eine einzige Peinlichkeit (was natürlich auch an ihren schwachsinnigen Dialogen lag), so mausert sie sich hier zu einer Charakterdarstellerin, die auch mutig genug war, für den Film die Haare zu opfern.    Die Handlung ist hier schon genügend breit getreten worden. Man sollte jedoch ergänzen, dass auch ein guter Film eine zweifelhafte Moral haben kann. V ist ein waschechter Psychopath und Terrorist, auch wenn er gegen ein diktatorisches Regime ankämpft. Er eignet sich als Rollenmodel eines Demokraten ungefähr so sehr wie Hannibal Lector Vorstand der pazifistischen Vegetarier sein könnte. Seinen Spruch: \"Bürger sollten nicht vor ihren Regierungen Angst haben, sondern Regierungen vor ihren Bürgern\" würde ich so nicht stehen lassen. Beide sollten voneinander keine Angst haben.
translated_review: The author of the Comic Template, Alan Moore, is probably next to Neil Gaiman the best comic copywriter of the present - and V for Vendeta is probably besides \ "Watchmen \" his masterpiece. I was so disappointed when he lies his name from the credits of the film. Although Alan Moore is probably quite eccentric, and that has already done in other implementations of his works, so that the anticipation of the movie has quad. In addition, I found the first matrix movie very well, but the two successors in my eyes only a tired copy for the action spoiled audience presented, after the motto "faster, further, higher". Therefore, I held the Wachowski brothers for a clear miscast. The more surprised I was from the result. This movie is for me the best comic implementation at all. He keeps close enough to the template without worrying like unnecessary deviations as so often by unnecessary deviations, on the other hand, he allows himself sufficient artistic freedom to consider as a stand-alone artwork (and not only as 1: 1 post-count as with the Frank Miller templates \ "Sin City \" and \ "300 \"). The refusal of Alan Moore now seems to me as an overreaction of a glorious purist. The actors are well occupied well, and even if you only see him by his mask, Hugo Weaving makes a far better figure here as he did the same as Elrond. The most rehabilitates Natalie Portman. When she was in the Star Wars movies actually a single embarrassment (which of course was also on their imbalance dialogues), so they moused here to a character actress, which was also brave enough to sacrifice the hair for the movie. The plot has already been leaved here. However, you should complement that a good movie can also have a dubious morality. V is a true psychopath and terrorist, even if he fights against a dictatorial regime. It is suitable as a roll model of a Democrats about as much as Hannibal Lector's board of the pacifist vegetarian could be. His saying: \ "Citizens should not be afraid of their governments, but governments in front of their citizens \" I would not let that stand. Both should not be afraid of each other.

review_headline: Film über die Geschichte um das berühmte Foto vom Hissen der Flagge während Schlacht gegen die Japaner in WK 2!
review_body: Inzwischen sind 66 Jahre nach der Schlacht um Iwo Jima vorbei. Macht es da noch immer Sinn, einen \"Kriegsfilm\" um diese bekannte Schlacht am Ende des 2. Weltkrieges zu drehen? Ich würde sagen: ja. Zumindest, wenn man die Art der Darstellung und die Zielsetzung dieses Filmes berücksichtigt. Und in diesem SInne ist es schon mal kein schlechter Film.  \"Iwo Jima\", eine schwach besiedelte, aber strategisch bedeutsame zu Japan gehörende Insel, war eine der blutigsten Schlachten am Ende des 2. Weltkrieges, womit sich die Amerikaner erfolgreich den Weg zum japanischen Mutterland erkämpften. Die Schlacht war für beide Seiten verlustreich und grausam; die Schlacht kostete auch die Amerikaner durch den Einsatz von zig Tonnen Bomben u.a. Kriegsgerät noch einmal sehr viel Geld, bevor sie den Kampf für sich entschieden. Da die amerikanische Bevölkerung aber inzwischen kriegsmüde geworden war, und sie nicht mehr sehr gewillt war, weitere viele ihrer Söhne und vor allem viel Geld für den unglaublich teuren Krieg zu opfern, zudem enttäuscht war über die in den letzten Monaten geringen \"Fortschritte\" der Amerikaner an der pazifischen Front, wurde die Propaganda immer wichtiger, um die Zustimmung der Bevölkerung für die Weiterführung des Krieges zu sichern. Dabei entstand das berühmte Foto des Hissens der amerikanischen Flagge auf Iwo Jima, das den Amerikanern vor Augen führen sollte, dass der endgültige Sieg gegen den sehr zähen und unglaublich opferbereiten Gegner Japan in große Nähe gerückt war. Was die amerikanische Öffentlichkeit nicth wusste: so unglaublich \"glorreich\", wie es dieses Foto vermitteln wollte, war die Schlacht für die Amerikaner nicht! Abgesehen von den vielen toten GI's infolge dieses Kampfes waren auch alle \"originalen\" \"Flaggen- Hisser\" kurze Zeit nach diesem Ereignis ums Leben gekommen! Die \"Geschichte\" um dieses Hissen der Flagge hätte - wahrheitsgemäß überliefert - also eher die weitere Ablehnung der Amerikanerfür den Krieg gefördert. Und so wurde halt in bester propagandistischer Manier die \"Geschichte umgeschrieben\": das Hissen der Flagge wurde von anderen Soldaten \"werbewirksam\" nachgestellt. Die Soldaten brauchte man danach auch für weitere Propagandazwecke lebend: sie wurden im Anschluss daran \"auf Tournee\" durch's Land geschickt, um für den Kauf weiterer Kriegsanleihen zur Finanzierung der Fortführung des Krieges zu werben. Im Film kommen die einfachen Soldaten diesem Auftrag recht ungerne nach: sie verabscheuen insgeheim die Inszenierung des Krieges an der \"Heimatfront\", wünschen sich nach Hause zu ihren Familien, und betrachten ihre Stilisierung als Kriegshelden, zu denen sie von der Propaganda gemacht werden, eher skeptisch. Schließlich haben sie den Krieg selber erlebt, mit all seinen Gräueltaten, haben ihre besten Freunde verloren, usw. Kurz: sie kennen die Realität des Krieges und werden jetzt für dessen falsche Darstellung missbraucht. Das merken sie erst langsam; am Anfang machen sie noch mit, weil sie es für eine gute Sache halten. Zum Schluss aber sind sie enttäuscht: als Werbeträger wurden sie vielfach gebraucht. Doch nach Ende des Krieges geraten sie in Vergessenheit und Niemand interessiert sich mehr für sie und ihre Probleme. Niemand braucht sie mehr. Sie begreifen, dass sie missbraucht wurden für die Zwecke Anderer, und dass ihr Status und ihre \"Werbung\" allen möglichen Institutionen und Firmen genutzt hat, nur ihnen selber nicht. Im Nachkriegs- Amerika werden ihre Hoffnungen enttäuscht: sie haben Schwierigkeiten im Zivilleben einen Platz zu finden. Schließlich landen sie in niedrig bezahlten Jobs. Posttraumatische Störungen u.Ä. belasten sie, . Am schlimmsten kommt es für den naiven Indianer Ira Hayes. Dieser war unglaublich stolz in der Armee dienen zu können, und glaubte, sein Einsatz in und für diesen Krieg würde die Indianer in den USA populärer machen, und den Rassismus einzudämmen helfen. Doch sieht er sich in dieser Hoffnung bald getäuscht. Völlig desillusioniert, arbeitslos und verkannt kehrt er schließlich in sein Reservat zurück, und entwickelt sich zu einem groben, gewalttätigen Trinker, der für die Medien nun erst recht nicht mehr vorzeigbar ist. Tragisch findet er schließlcih unter nicht geklärten Umständen einen frühen Tod, in einem Land, das für ihn nicht viel übrig hatte, und in dem er immer ein Fremder und Außenseiter geblieben ist (über ihn existiert auch die berühmte \"Ballade von Ira Hayes\", ein Folksong aus den 60ern).  Clint Eastwood's Film zeigt die reale Sicht auf den Krieg: er verzichtet auf Heroisierung und Glorifizierung, wie man das schon von anderen, dutzenden US- Spielfilmen kennt, sondern versucht, den Krieg so zu zeigen, wie er wirklich ist, die Tragik des Krieges, wie das Heldentum vermarktet wird, u.Ä. Er stellt also diese Glorifizierungen in ein kritisches Licht. Patriotismus ist seiner Meinung nach erlaubt; aber man sollte bei der Wahrheit bleiben, und die Bürger haben ein Recht darauf, welche Rolle die Propaganda hat, und wie wenig letztlich die einzelnen Soldaten. Eastwood will den wahren Begebenheiten und den Beteiligten mit diesem Film ein Denkmal setzen, und - 66 Jahre nach diesen Ereignissen - noch einmal daran erinnern, und verzichtet dabei auf jegliches übertriebene Pathos. Der Film ist somit ein typischer Eastwood- Film, der Ruhe und Nachdenklichkeit über Action- Szenen und \"Spannung\" stellt; er vermeidet laute Töne. Wer hier einen \"aufregenden\" Kriegsfilm erwartet, wird natürlich von diesem Film enttäuscht sein; die Kriegsszenen sind nur kurz und spielen sich eher im Hintergrund der Handlung ab. So gesehen ist es kein \"echter Kriegsfilm\", sondern eher ein Anti- Kriegsfilm, der zwar nicht Krieg schlechthin negativ darstellt, aber eben realistisch. Wer mit der Realität aber seine Probleme hat, und immer noch naiv- romantischen Märchen und Idealisierungen nachhängt, wird mit dem Film seine Probleme haben.  Natürlich könnte man von dem Film andere Erwartungen haben; nämlich, dass es hier vorrangig um den Kampf um die Insel Iwo Jima geht, dass man es also mit einer Art \"echten\" Kriegsfilm zu tun haben würde. Tatsächlich aber steht im MIttelpunkt die Geschichte um das berühmte (aus propagandistischen Gründen gefälschte) Hissen der Flagge auf der Insel, und um das mehr oder weniger tragische Schicksal der Soldaten, die dazu \"auserkoren\" waren, insbesondere das Schicksal des Indianers Ira Hayes.  Die Kriegshandlungen erfolgen hier nur in gelegentlichen Rückblenden, in Erinnerungen der Soldaten (der Krieg ist also eigentlich schon längst für sie aus). Diese \"Technik\" ist gut gewählt; denn sie unterstützt das Gefühl der Traumatisierung bei den Soldaten. Für ein realistisches ERfahren der Zuschauer, was diese Schlacht aus Sicht der Soldaten bedeutete, schreckt der Regisseur auch nicht vor Einstellungen von herausquellenden Eingeweiden, Selbstmord verübenden japanischen Soldaten, u.Ä. zurück. Den Film sollte man daher möglichst nicht Kinder zu sehen lassen.  Die Bilder, Kostüme, Kulissen, usw. sind perfekt, und hätten einen Oskar verdient gehabt. Ebenso ist die Leistung der Darsteller im Wesentlichen gut. Der Soundtrack umfasst u.A. typische Songs dieser Zeit, und ist m.E. auch nicht schlecht.  Dennoch wirkt der Film doch stellenweise ziemlich zäh und langatmig; sein größter Fehler ist, dass die Handlung sehr arm ist: letztlich geht es ja nur um dieses Foto und seine Geschichte, dem der Regisseur so unglaublich viel Platz einräumt, und den FIlm über 2 Stunden werden lässt. Da nur relativ wenige Kampfszenen vorkommen, ist der Film sehr spannungs- und handlungsarm. AUch halte ich die enorme Bedeutung, die dieses simple Hissen einer Flagge haben soll, doch um Einiges übertrieben. Auch bietet der Film kaum Informationen, die man nicht schon vorher durch Internetrecherche kennt; also wenig Neues. Der Film zeigt im Wesentlichen das Wesen von Kriegspropaganda. Und das dürfte den Meisten ja ohnehin schon klar sein, wie das in Kriegszeiten abläuft, und dass mitnichten Propaganda mit Wahrheit gleichzusetzen ist (vgl. George Orwell: \"1984\": das dortige \"Wahrheitsministerium\" ist in Wirklichkeit das \"Propagandaministerium\"!). Und dieses Thema hätte man natürlich auch wesentlich kürzer fassen können. So ist die Thematik auch nicht besonders \"komplex\", und der Film ist - so gesehen - auch wiederum nicht besonders \"anspruchsvoll\": man muss sich kaum auf den Film konzentrieren, verpasst dennoch nichts (vor allem, wenn man mit dieser Thematik schon vorher vertraut war), und hat dann keine Lust mehr, sich den FIlm ein zweites Mal anzusehen. Trotz der guten Absicht und Darstellung daher stellenweise doch etwas langweiliger Film.  Dennoch finde ich das Unternehmen Eastwood's mutig und anerkennenswert, seinen Landsleuten auch die \"hässliche\" Seite dieses Krieges zu zeigen, ohne jegliche Glorifizierung ihrer \"heldentaten\", wie das in Betrachtung der amerikanischen Geschichte sonst eher die Regel ist. Dazu kommt, dass Eastwood sogar mit diesem FIlm eher auf \"Versöhnung\" mit dem ehemaligen Feind setzt, auf \"Verbesserung der \"US- japanischen Beziehungen\", indem er einen zweiten Film (\"Letters from Iwo Jima\") spielt, in der er die rein japanische Sicht des Filmes zeigen wollte (film habe ich aber noch nicht gesehen). Er bewegt sich also weg vom selbstherrlichen, aber antiquiierten Isolationismus der Amerikaner, dem diese Art von Filmen sonst eher dienen sollen. Ob seine Landsleute Eastwood diese Intention anerkennen, ist fraglich. Aber für Nicht- Amerikaner macht es diesen Film sicherlich nicht weniger sehenswert.  FAZIT: Ein sehr ruhiger FIlm, in dem es hauptsächlcih um Kriegspropaganda im Allgemeinen geht, im Speziellen um die (wirkliche) Geschichte des \"Flaggen hissens\"von Iro Jima; eine Geschichte, die aber etwas langweilig dargestellt wird (und tatsächlich wohl auch nie so besonders aufregend war).
translated_review: Meanwhile, 66 years after the battle are past Iwo Jima. Does it still make sense to turn a \ "war film \" to turn this known battle at the end of World War II? I would say yes. At least if one takes into account the type of presentation and the objective of this film. And in this sense it's not a bad movie. "Iwo Jima", a weakly populated, but strategically important to Japan, was one of the bloodiest battles at the end of World War II, with the Americans successfully fought the way to Japanese motherland. The battle was lossy and cruel for both sides; The battle also cost the Americans through the use of tens of tons of bombs, etc. war apparatus again a lot of money before they decided to fight for themselves. However, since the American population has become a war-tired, and she was no longer very willing to sacrifice another many of her sons and, above all, a lot of money for the incredibly expensive war, was also disappointed with those in recent months of "progress" The American at the Pacific Front, the propaganda became more and more important to secure the consent of the population for the continuation of the war. The famous photo of Hissens of the American flag on Iwo Jima was born, which should lead to the Americans in mind that the final victory against the very tough and incredibly sacrificial opponents Japan was in close proximity. What the American public Nicth knew: so incredibly \ "Glorreich \", as this photo wanted to convey this photo, was the battle for the Americans! Apart from the many dead Gi's as a result of this fight, all \ "original \" \ "flag-hisser \" had come to life for a short time after this event! The "History \" for this hurt of the flag - truthfully delivered - so the further rejection of the Americans promoted the war. And so stopped in best propagandistic manner the \ "history rewritten \": Hanging the flag was adjusted by other soldiers \ "advertising. Afterwards, the soldiers were also living for further propaganda purposes: they were sent afterwards \ "on Tournee \" by the country to promote the purchase of further war bonds to finance the continuation of the war. In the movie, the simple soldiers to this mission are quite reluctant to: they secretly detest the staging of the war on the "home front", want to go home to their families, and consider their stylization as war feels to which they are made by the propaganda , Rather skeptical. Finally, they have experienced the war himself, with all his atrocities, their best friends have lost, etc. briefly: they know the reality of the war and are now abused for its false representation. You only notice that slowly; In the beginning, they still do with because they hold it for a good thing. Finally, but they are disappointed: as an advertising medium they were used many times. But after the end of the war they advised forgotten and no one interests more for them and their problems. Nobody needs her anymore. They realize that they were abused for the purposes of others, and that their status and their "advertising" has used all sorts of institutions and companies, not only themselves. In post-war America, their hopes are disappointed: they have difficulties in civil life to find a place. Finally, they land in low-paid jobs. Post-traumatic disorders and the like. Deplet ,. The worst is the Naive Indian Ira Hayes. This was incredibly proud of being able to serve in the army, and believed his commitment in and for this war, the Indians in the US would make more popular, and to contain racism. But he looks clear in this hope soon. Completely disilused, unemployed and misjudged, he finally returns to his reserve, and becomes a rough, violent drinker, who is now no longer pretending to the media. Tragically, he finds an early death under non-clarified circumstances, in a country that had not much left for him, and in which he has always remained a stranger and outsider (about him also the famous \ "Ballad of Ira Hayes \" , a folksong from the 60s). Clint Eastwood's Film shows the real view of the war: he renounces heroization and glorification, as it is already known from other, dozens US feature films, but tries to show the war as he really is, the tragedy of war, How the Heldentum is marketed, etc. He thus sets these glorifications into a critical light. Patriotism is allowed in his opinion; But one should stay with the truth, and the citizens have a right to what role the propaganda hasAnd how little ultimately the individual soldiers. Eastwood wants to set the true events and the parties with this film a monument, and - 66 years after these events - recall again, and renounces any exaggerated pathos. The film is thus a typical Eastwood film, rest and thoughtfulness about action scenes and "tension \"; He avoids loud tones. Who expects a "exciting \" war film here, of course, will be disappointed with this film; The war scenes are only short and play more in the background of the action. Seen so it is not a "real war film", but rather an anti-war film, which is not war a negative war, but just realistic. But who has his problems with reality, and still naive-romantic fairy tales and idealizations is repeated, will have his problems with the film. Of course you could have other expectations from the movie; Namely, that it is primarily about the fight for the island of Iwo Jima, that one would have to do it with a kind of \ "real \" war film. In fact, the focus is on the story about the famous (fake out of propagandistic reasons) hits the flag on the island, and the more or less tragic fate of the soldiers who were "choosing \", especially the fate of the Indian Ira Hayes . The war acts are made only in occasional flashbacks, in memories of the soldiers (the war is actually already for them). This \ "Technik \" is well chosen; Because it supports the feeling of traumatization in the soldiers. For a realistic experienced the viewer, which meant this battle from the point of view of the soldiers, the director does not deter with settings of swelling guts, suicide commuting Japanese soldiers, etc. back. The movie should therefore not be seen as much as possible. The pictures, costumes, scenes, etc. are perfect, and had earned an Oskar. Likewise, the performance of the performers is essentially good. The soundtrack includes u.a. Typical songs of this time, and is M.E. Not bad either. Nevertheless, the film acts pretty tough and long-breathable; His biggest mistake is that the plot is very poor: ultimately it's just about this photo and its history that the director grants so incredibly plenty of space, and the film can be over 2 hours. Since only relatively few fighting scenes occur, the film is very exciting and action. Also, I consider the enormous meaning, which should have this simple hits of a flag, but a lot exaggerated. Also, the film has little information that is not already known by internet research; So little new. The film essentially shows the essence of war propaganda. And that is likely to be able to do most of them, as that runs in war times, and that they are equivalent to propaganda with truth (see George Orwell: \ "1984 \": The "Truth Department \" is in fact that \ " Propagandaminium \ "!). Of course, this topic could of course be much shorter. Thus, the topic is not particularly "complex", and the film is - in this way - not particularly "demanding \": you hardly have to focus on the movie, still misses nothing (especially if you join This topic was already familiar before), and then has no desire to look at the movie a second time. Despite the good intention and therefore presentation, some boring film. Nevertheless, I find the company Eastwood's brave and acknowledged to show its compatriots also the "ugly \" side of this war, without any glorification of your \ "heroic deeds \", as that is the rather the rule in view of the American history. This happens that Eastwood even with this film rather focuses on "reconciliation" with the former enemy, on "improving the" US Japanese relationships "by making a second movie (\" letters from Iwo Jima \ " ) Plays in which he wanted to show the purely Japanese view of the film (but I have not seen movie yet). So he moves away from the autocratic but antiquated isolationism of the Americans who should serve this kind of films more. Whether his Country people Eastwood recognize this intention is questionable. But for non-Americans, this film certainly does not worth seeing. Conclusion: A very quiet movie in which it is mainly due to war propaganda in general, especially for the (real) history of the \ "Flags Hissen \" of Iro Jima; a story that is displayed a bit boring (and actually never so particularly exciting).

review_headline: Der Engländer, der auf einen Hügel stieg und von einem Berg herunterkam
review_body: Wer glaubt, auch hier mit Hugh Grant wieder wilde Romanzen zu erleben, wird (fast) enttäuscht - aber auch nur fast. Denn in dieser wunderbar verrückten Dorfkomödie darf auch die Liebe nicht so ganz fehlen. Dennoch dreht sich alles erst mal um ein kleines walisisches Dörfchen und dessen ganzer Stolz: ein Berg - und zwar der erste Berg in Wales. Doch bei einer Neuvermesseung wird der Berg zu einem Hügel degradiert, was das Dorf natürlich nicht auf sich sitzen lassen will - und dabei ganz eigenwillige Wege geht. Dabei kommt auch Hugh Grant auf seine (flirt-)Kosten.  Meiner Meinung nach ein absoluter Geheimtipp!

product_title: How to Talk to a Widower
review_body: I had to cancel my day in order to read 'how to talk to a widower'. I read a lot, and am always disappointed with the hype of new books, but I was utterly gripped by this. I literally could not put it down. I laughed so much I had tears running down my cheeks. (The parents are adorable and hilarious) and I cried as much too. I have had my own losses in life and never have I read something that cuts to the bone so well than this book. It is deeply insightful, touching, real, emotional, but the real skill and expertise in Jonathan's writing is combining the humour with such catastrophe and making it work. A work of art, truly. Read it and be changed forever.
translated_review: I had to cancel my day in order to read 'how to talk to a widower'. I read a lot, and am always disappointed with the hype of new books, but I was utterly gripped by this. I literally could not put it down. I laughed so much I had tears running down my cheeks. (The parents are adorable and hilarious) and I cried as much too. I have had my own losses in life and never have I read something that cuts to the bone so well than this book. It is deeply insightful, touching, real, emotional, but the real skill and expertise in Jonathan's writing is combining the humour with such catastrophe and making it work. A work of art, truly. Read it and be changed forever.

review_body: Nach den vielen schlechten Meinungen war ich gespannt auf diesen Film. Kurzum: ich fand ihn sehr gut. Viel besser als der Film damals von Emmerich, denn dieser hier kommt viel näher an das Original heran. Die, die den Film so schlecht bewerten, würde ich behaupten, haben nie das Original gesehen. Denn da ist Godzilla mitunter noch seltener zu sehen gewesen. Das hier ist kein Monster Film ala 120 Minuten Mord und Totschlag zwischen Godzilla und den M.U.T.O.s. Es erzählt auch eine Legende über Godzilla, ganz anders als bei Emmerichs Film. Aber jeder hat seine freie Meinung. ;-) Ich kann nur empfehlen, den Film zu schauen und sich ein eigenes Urteil zu bilden.
translated_review: After the many bad opinions, I was looking forward to this movie.In short: I found him very well.Much better than the film at that time by Emmerich, because this here comes much closer to the original.The ones who evaluate the movie so badly would I say, have never seen the original.Because because Godzilla has sometimes been rarer to see.This is not a monster movie Ala 120 minutes murder and manslaughter between Godzilla and the M.U.T.O.S.It also tells a legend about Godzilla, unlike Emmerich's film.But everyone has his free opinion.;-) I can only recommend to look the movie and to make your own verdict.

review_body: Special Effects und (zugegebenermaßen) digitale Filmkunst täuschen nicht über eine fade Geschichte hinweg!  So wie Michael Bay ist auch James Cameron ein Freund des opulent gestalteten Films aber in diesem Fall hat die Geschichte meiner Meinung nach nicht einmal genug hergegeben. Ist es Avatar von James Cameron oder Pocahontas von James Cameron?  Das die Geschichte nicht neu ist ist hier nicht einmal das Problem-die lieblose Umsetzung schon.  Ich habe oft gehört dass diese Welt die für das Auge geschaffen wurde so toll ist-was war dann bitte Herr der Ringe?  Das einzig schöne neben der Technik finde ich vielleicht noch Sigourney Weaver, ansonsten fand ich die Charaktere-oder die Schauspieler?-so unemotional und aufgesetzt und.  Aber es ist auch schwer noch beeindruckt zu sein wenn alle Welt sagt und schreibt dass das der beste Film aller Zeiten ist-aber Geschmäcker sind ja zum Glück verschieden! :-)

product_title: The Final Frontier (Limited Metal Tin Box)
review_headline: ...die Metal-Götter drehen sich im Grab um...
review_body: .nein, ganz so schlimm kam es dann doch nicht!    Aber nach dem ich vom Video \"The Final Frontier\" so begeistert war, enttäuscht der neuestete Jungfrauensilberling einen erstmal.  Wie schon von vielen festgestellt ist das Intro des Songs viel zu lang geraten oder hätte wenigstens als \"einzelner\" Track zum überspringen dargereicht werden sollen.  Auch bin ich der Meinung, daß die Stücke seit der \"Dance of Death\"-Ära, sich sehr ähneln und meist auf die gleiche Weise anfangen.  Da wünsche ich mir fast eine Neuauflage vom viel geschmähten \"X-Factor\" - mit Bruce als Sänger - da stimmte wenigstens das abwechslungsreiche und druckvolle Songwriting!  Dennoch gibt es positives in Bezug auf die beiden Vorgänger-Alben zu berichten, die Melodien sind eingängiger und mit \"The Final Frontier\" (ohne Intro), sowie \"Mother of Mercy\" und \"The Alchemist\", sind Songs vertreten, die die Faszination an Iron Maiden weiter am Leben halten.    Eigentlich hat das Album 4 Sterne Verdient aber die Lim.Ed. ist Ihr Geld nun wirklich nicht wert. Ein Stern abzug, der sich nur auf diese Abzock-Masche bezieht.

As already noted by many, the intro of the song has rated far too long or would have been at least as \ "single \" track to skip. Also, I believe that the pieces have been very similar since the "Dance of Death \" era, and usually start in the same way. Since I wish myself almost a new edition of the much-blamed \ "X-Factor \" - with Bruce as a singer - at least the varied and pushed songwriting agreed! Nevertheless, there are positive in relation to the two predecessor albums to report, the melodies are catchy and with \ "The Final Frontier \" (without intro), as well as \ "Mother of Mercy \" and \ "The Alchemist \", are Songs representing the fascination of Iron Maiden continues to live further. Actually, the album deserves 4 stars but the lim.ed. Is your money really not worth it. A star deduction, which only refers to this rip-off mesh.

As a beginner of using digital painting I've learned a lot of new things to use in my progression of art. review_body: Es ist sehr schade, dass sich dieses Album , so elektronisch überladen anhört, man kann den Texten, die ziemlich gut sind, nicht in Ruhe lauschen, auch ihre Stimme klingt sehr mechanisch - leider. Die lieder sind zwar gut aber überladen. Hoffe das diese Album in einer Acoustikversion oder Klavierversion nochmal veröffentlicht wird. Nun hört sich Taylor wie jede zweite Popsängerin an. Ich weiß das sie unter gewissen Vertraglichen Vorschriften gebunden ist, aber ich hoffe das, ihr Plattenlabel merkt, dass die echt Mist gebaut haben, wobei, die Verkaufszahlen sagen ja das Gegenteil. Ich denke für Taylorfans die ihr Musik lieben und achten, sich in ihren liedern verlieren und gerne Träumen, ist dieses Album leider nicht zum Träumen gedacht, man bekommt eher Albträume mit elektronischen Foltertönen.

review_body: Even a detractor could not deny the specialness of Dylan in his time in this pretty amazing cinema-verite masterpiece. Beyond the music and the personality, the most arresting moments are seen in the sense of drossy post-war England in the 60s before it really started swinging and the way that Dylan is so cruel to outgoing squeeze Joan Baez at her most unpleasantly shrill. A great 'document'.

I felt the love story was slightly ruined, there is not enough love in the world that would excuse the way he treated her and I would not want that in a relationship which put a dampener on it to be honest. The last 20% was the best. It was nice having his point of view but again this made the book hard to get into because it was very different from the last 3 books. I will read the last book to end the story but I prey there are no more and it is finished properly. I also hope there is not another 18 month wait

review_body: I can't understand how people can say this album is a failure. This album is unbelievable. It's an achievment that I doubt will ever be matched. It is undoubtably the best Floyd Album by far. There may not be as many stand out tracks as in some Floyd work but the whole album blends perfectly to create something so beautiful that you are totally overwhelmed by the whole thing. It's not music, with individual songs; it is in fact a perfect mixture of instruments and sounds that create an experience quite unlike anything else. There's something about this album that makes you keep coming back. When you're in a reflective mood this album will literally break you down into tears. The mix of acoustic guitars and the classic soft but powerful Floyd solos executed by David Gilmour flood you with emotion. This album got me through some tough times and it could do the same for you. Just be prepared to cry at the end.

It's not music, with individual songs; it is in fact a perfect mixture of instruments and sounds that create an experience quite unlike anything else. There's something about this album that makes you keep coming back. When you're in a reflective mood this album will literally break you down into tears. The mix of acoustic guitars and the classic soft but powerful Floyd solos executed by David Gilmour flood you with emotion. This album got me through some tough times and it could do the same for you. Just be prepared to cry at the end.

review_body: My 2 grandchildren (5 & 4) enjoy watching Disney dvid's, however the collection I have bought for their sleepovers are the classic cartoon's however over Christmas we happened upon a TV channel showing Mary Poppins, much to my surprise they were completely taken with the film and at the end the 4 year old asked to watch it again, explaining it was on TV she asked if I would buy it for them so they could watch it at their next sleepover.  The second showing was just as good as they sat through the whole film again, I can see it being a regular theme for sleepovers!
