review_body: This book gives life to the movie as the reader is allowed to view the script, much in the same way the actors did as they put life to this story. It is fascinating to read the screenplay and compare it to the actual film,  noting the instances where the actors improvised and personalized their  charactors lines.  Most notable is the charactor of Lisa, only Angelina  Jolie could possibly get away with portraying such a disturbing charactor  in such an alluring and heroic light. If you enjoyed the movie Girl,  Interrupted you must read this screenplay, as it will leave you feeling   enlightened with a new found awareness.

review_body: It's hard to know what to say about this book. It had a lot of potential, but for me, it didn't live up to it. I enjoyed the story, but it wasn't really great. It's also rather unrealistic and upsetting. Having been through ivf, it seems implausible that after so many rounds, suddenly she could get pregnant, more than once. If only it were that way in real life. Perhaps I'm being unfair. I'm sorry if I am.

It's also rather unrealistic and upsetting. Having been through ivf, it seems implausible that after so many rounds, suddenly she could get pregnant, more than once. review_body: Dies ist Robert Downey Jr.'s zweiter Einsatz als Iron man,der hier wieder brilliert,und aus dem Jahr 2010. Es werden unglaublich viele Stars wie Mickey Rourke,Don Cheadle,Sam Rockwell,Gwyneth Paltrow,Scarlett Johansson und Samuel L. Jackson geboten, welche meines Erachtens komplett überzeugen. Die Geschichte mit den zwei Gegnern Whiplash und Justin Hammer,Tony Stark,der gegen den Senat kämpfen und einen Ersatz für den Arc-Reaktor in seiner Brust finden muss und dem Auftauchen von Black Widow hätte vielleicht für Iron man 2,3 und vielleicht auch noch 4 gereicht,ist aber sehr unterhaltsam umgesetzt und macht beim Anschauen einfach unheimlichen Spaß. Die Action ist hier besser getrickst als im ersten Teil und wieder dezent gestreut,aber unheimlich abwechslungsreich und innovativ.Ich dachte damals zuerst im Kino,dass man das spektakuläre Aufnandertreffen von Iron man und Whiplash nicht mehr toppen könne,was aber die Macher im Endkampf doch geschafft haben.Wesentlich hierfür war,dass Tony Stark ein neues Element erschaffen hat(!),weshalb sein Anzug ein paar tolle Tricks mehr draufhatte.Der Humor wurde hier deutlich ausgebaut und macht Iron man 2 zu einem Spaßfilm,weshalb ich der Meinung bin,dass der zweite Teil den ersten übertrifft. Nick Fury's Auftritt lässt die coole Marvel-Atmosphäre aufkommen und der erstklassige Soundtrack wurde diesmal von John Debney komponiert und coole ACDC-Stücke sind auch wieder dabei.Die Schauplätze,vor allem Monaco,sind sehr gut in Szene gesetzt. Am Ende gibt es noch einen coolen Gag.Ich freue mich schon auf Teil 3,der am 1.Mai bei uns anlaufen wird. Fazit:Extrem gute Unterhaltung.
translated_review: This is Robert Downey Jr.'s second use as Iron Man, who brillt here again, and from the year 2010. It will incredibly many stars like Mickey Rourke, Don Cheadle, Sam Rockwell, Gwyneth Paltrow, Scarlett Johansson and Samuel L. Jackson Bed, which all think completely convince. History with the two opponents Whiplash and Justin Hammer, Tony Strong, who fight against the Senate and find a replacement for the Arc reactor in his chest and the emergence of Black Widow maybe for Iron Man 2,3 and maybe 4, but is very entertaining translated and makes while watching simply scary fun. The action is better met here than in the first part and discreetly scattered, but weirdly varied and innovatively. I thought at that time first in the cinema that one could not top the spectacular open-end meeting of Iron Man and Whiplash, but what the makers in the final fight have done to do so that Tony was strongly creating a new element (!), Why his suit has a few great tricks more driving battles. The humor was clearly developed here and makes Iron Man 2 for a fun film, which is why I think I think that the second part exceeds the first. Nick Fury's appearances reveals the cool Marvel atmosphere and the first-class soundtrack was composed by John Debney this time and cool ACDC pieces are also there again. The locations, especially Monaco, are very well staged. In the end there is still a cool gag. I'm looking forward to Part 3, which will start at the 1st MAI with us. Conclusion: Extremely good entertainment.

review_body: Dumbo ist der Beweis, dass ein Film ohne kostspielige Finessen auskommt. Die Geschichte über einen kleinen Elefanten, der sich getrennt von seiner Mutter als Außenseiter behaupten muss kann sich ganz auf das Potential der Charaktere verlassen. Dumbo entstand in einer finanziellen Notlage des Disney-Studios. Er hat eine Länge von knapp einer Stunde und es wurde bewusst auf teure Effekte mit der Multiplan-Kamera (Kamerafahrten in Pinocchio) vezichtet. Aber gerade dadurch erhielt Dumbo den gewissen Charme der kurzen Trickfilme der 20 er Jahre. Vermutlich lässt sich gerade dadurch der Erfolg begründen, den etwa zeitgleiche gigantische und vor allem zeichnerisch weitaus anspruchsvollere Produktionen wie Fantasia nicht hatten. Untermalt wird die rührende Geschichte von oscargekrönter Musik. Ein wahrer Klassiker!
translated_review: Dumbo is proof that a movie works without costly finesse.The story about a small elephant who has to assert himself separately from his mother as an outsider can rely entirely on the potential of the characters.Dumbo was built in a financial distress of the Disney Studio.He has a length of just under an hour and it was aware of expensive effects with the multiplan camera (camera movies in Pinocchio).But this was precisely because Dumbo received the certain charm of the short cartoons of the 20 he years.Presumably, it is particularly due to the success, which did not have any more demanding productions such as Fantasia, for example, simultaneous gigantic and above all are drawners.The touching story of Oscar-crowned music is accompanied.A true classic!

product_title: Band of Brothers - Wir waren wie Brüder: Die komplette Serie [6 DVDs]
review_body: Die Schilderung einer amerikanischen Fallschirmjägereinheit von der Ausbildung bis zum Ende des 2. Weltkrieges ist sehr gut gemacht, sehr Anschaulich und Eindrucksvoll. Das zu jeder Folge vorher echte Veteranen dieser Einheit zu Wort kommen rundet diese DVD-Box ab.  Nicht schlecht finde ich auch, dass eigentlich in jeder Folge die Handlungsabläufe aus dem Blickwinkel einer bestimmten Person geschildert werden. Das Einzigste Manko in meinen Augen ist, das bisweilen die historischen Hintergründe etwas zu kurz kommen, daher nur 4 Sterne. Mag es natürlich bei der 'Ớperation Market-Garden' (die Schlacht um die Brücken von Arnheim) daran liegen, dass eben DIESE Einheit eher am Rande des Geschehens eingesetzt war hätte man dennoch hier (und auch in den anderen Folgen wie z.B. der Landung in der Normandie) durchaus mehr in dieser Richtung tun können.  Alles in allem aber genau das Richtige für jemanden, der sich für dieses Thema interessiert und sich auch nicht daran stört, das es häufig doch sehr realistisch (sprich: blutig) zugeht.
translated_review: The description of an American paratrooper of the training until the end of World War II is very well done, very vividly and impressive. The previously genuine veterans of this unit to speak for each episode of this unit completes this DVD box. Not bad, I also find that actually in each episode the actions are described from the perspective of a particular person. The unique shortcoming is in my eyes, which sometimes the historical backgrounds come slightly too short, therefore only 4 stars. Of course, with the 'ớperation Market Garden' (the battle for the bridges of Arnheim) are because this unit was more likely to be used on the edge of the action, one would still have here (and also in the other consequences such as the landing in Normandy) can do more in this direction. All in all, just right for someone who is interested in this topic and does not bother it, which is often very realistic (say: bloody).

review_body: Version 4.0.2  Was ist schlechter.  - Kein Querformat mehr  - Zwangsanmeldung sonst kann man lokale Musik nicht mehr damit abspielen (Kein MP3 Player Funktion ohne Anmeldung)  - Eine gemeinsame Anmeldung für alle Amazon Apps. Warum? So was finde ich als wählbares Feature noch ok.  - Man möchte vielleicht nicht auf allen Geräten mit allen Kauffunktionen angemeldet sein.   z.B. Tablet das offenrum liegt um Musik zu machen und Gäste auch selbst Musik auswählen können, möchte ich nicht das auch die Amazon App alle Einkäufte preisgibt etc.    Was sich verbessert hat kann ich nicht sagen,  da ich bei der Handhabung an sich keine grossen Unterschiede feststellen konnte, habe die neuen Version aber auch nicht lang getest und mir wieder die 2.8.1 installiert.    Die macht was eine MP3 und Kauf App machen sollte.  Hoffe die kann man noch lange benutzen bis man die 4 Version mal vernüftigt geändert hat.

review_body: Soft-rock ? Cela veut dire du rock doux pour le vieux que je suis devenu ou pour les jeunes romantiques qui veulent un peu de douceur dans ce monde devenu trop speed. Angus & Julia Stone. Second album, « Down The Way ». Une musique qui respire le calme, les vagues déferlantes et le soleil australien. Douce, soft, de quoi s'endormir ou s'aérer l'esprit avec de suaves mélodies. Les voix s'alternent pour éviter, peut-être, la monotonie d'un long monologue de Julia ou d'Angus. Julia a une voix troublante et enfantine, elle me fait penser aux deux saeurs CocoRosie, à la fois fragile et espiègle ; Angus est lui aussi émouvant, avec une voix qui sonne plus « roots », plus folk, plus baroudeur genre je-prend-ma-guitare-et-je-marche-seul-le-long-des-highways-au-milieu-de-la-nature-du-désert-ou-du-béton. Et c'est ce que j'apprécie tout particulièrement dans cet album, l'enchaînement des deux voix, l'alternance des deux esprits, l'ambiance des deux univers musicaux.
translated_review: Soft-rock?This means sweet rock for the old one I became or for romantic young people who want a little sweetness in this world that has become too Speed.Angus & Julia Stone.Second Album, "Down The Way".A music that breathes calm, breaking waves and the Australian sun.Sweet, soft, something to fall asleep or to be in mind with suaves melodies.The voices alter to avoid, perhaps, the monotony of a long monologue of Julia or Angus.Julia has a troubling and childish voice, she makes me think of the two hearts cocorostic, both fragile and mischievous;Angus is also moving, with a voice that sounds more "roots", plus folk, plus foggy kind I-Take-my-guitar-and-je-walk-only-long-des-highways-to-the-midde-the-nature-of-desert-or-du-concrete.And that's what I particularly appreciate in this album, the sequence of the two voices, the alternation of the two spirits, the atmosphere of the two musical universes.

review_body: un début agréable , un film prometteur pour son sujet original et sympathique mais dont on se lasse très vite ,à la suite des 20 minutes du début l'ennui se fait ressentir et il est quasi-impossible de ne pas s'endormir au bout d'1h30.Bon ce n'est pas grave, 1 étoile pour avoir tenté le coup et (pour les acteurs pas mauvais, dont la trame détruit tous leurs efforts).
translated_review: A nice start, a promising film for its original and friendly topic but we are very quickly tired, following the 20 minutes of the start the boredom gets felt and it is almost impossible not to fall asleep at the end of'1h30.Good does not matter, 1 star for trying and (for not bad actors, whose frame destroys all their efforts).

review_headline: A Space Odyssey for our times
review_body: This film is close to being a cross between Space Odyssey 2001 and Space Odyssey 2010. A crew of four astronauts travel deep into space in order to save human existence. There is also an AI robot in there.  Space Odyssey 2010 is a bit slower than it could be because it includes a lot of explanatory dialogue. Interstellar doesn't include a large amount explanatory dialogue, which in some ways makes for a slicker film, but means that there are some jumps in the story line. Like Space Odyssey 2001, there is an 'unusual' section in the film.  I enjoyed the film. It is nice to have a film in which the 'good guys' don't get to righteously kill the 'bad guys'. Instead the characters are allowed to dominate the story.

Instead the characters are allowed to dominate the story.

review_headline: A fine release, but could have been even better...
review_body: This double DVD, is in many ways a bona-fide 5-Star worthy product.  Some of the content has been previously available on various VHS releases (Maiden England, 12 Wasted Years) and other DVD releases (Visions Of The Beast). But there is also plenty of 'new' archive stuff (3 concert encores) and the continuation of the 'History Of Iron Maiden' documentary with part 3 of the series.  The main feature is a visually spectacular Iron Maiden concert from 1988 with a fine, and now complete, set-list boasting classic tracks and rarely played gems.  It also features a couple of documentaries in the form of the decades old '12 Wasted Years' and the more enlightening 'History Of Iron Maiden Part 3'.  Then, there are also the 5 promotional videos from 1986 - 1988 including the fantastic concert performance of 'Stranger In A Strange Land'.  However, there are flaws and missed opportunites too.  The concert staging and set list are all great, but the performance is, by Maiden standards, a bit below par.  The songs, in my opinion, are played too fast for their own good and Bruce, one of the greatest frontmen of any genre in music, is not having his best night as he struggles with a cold.  There is also the fact that the the promo video for SIASL aside, there is very little footage here of the equally spectacular 'Somewhere On Tour' from 1986/87.  This is a sad omission by Maiden given that their previous DVD releases were not just reissues of an old VHS but also a paltform for presenting previously overlooked tours.  For example, the 'Number Of The Beast' and 'Piece Of Mind' album tours were previously given very little exposure until their appearance on the excellent 'Early Days' DVD release.  One would have hoped that since this release continues the 'History Of Iron Maiden' documentaries, footage for the 'Somewhere On Tour' concerts could have been located and used.  Yes, it was shockingly never professionally filmed, but there appears to be some not too bad footage on YouTube so, one wonders.  And as for the promo videos, fine.  But they have been seen before on 'Visions Of The Beast'.  Instead, more TV performances from the era would have been a nice treat (as can be found in the 'Early Days' DVD)  And as for the documentaries, '12 Wasted Years' was probably great in its time but is now very much of little use as subsequent releases (notably the 'Early Days' DVD) have covered the contents far better.  And as for 'Part 3 of the History Of Iron Maiden', it reveals very little new information over a rather restricted 40 minutes.  All Maiden fans know that Bruce presented some accousitc tracks for the Somewhere In Time album and these were rejected, it's been documented with any reference to the 1986 album for the last 25 years.  So, how about letting us Maiden fans know or hear those songs - now that would have been of interest!  And that really sums up this release. It is, as a stand alone product, bloody amazing!  It's just that whatever is presented here has been done better by the band elsewhere and there really was the scope for the band to have done better here too.  Frankly, the care and attention given to this release falls short of what the Early Days DVD release achieved.  So, I find myself in the odd position of really enjoying this release, whilst also being somewhat frustrated.appears to be some not too bad footage on YouTube so, one wonders.  And as for the promo videos, fine.  But they have been seen before on 'Visions Of The Beast'.  Instead, more TV performances from the era would have been a nice treat (as can be found in the 'Early Days' DVD)  And as for the documentaries, '12 Wasted Years' was probably great in its time but is now very much of little use as subsequent releases (notably the 'Early Days' DVD) have covered the contents far better.  And as for 'Part 3 of the History Of Iron Maiden', it reveals very little new information over a rather restricted 40 minutes.  All Maiden fans know that Bruce presented some accousitc tracks for the Somewhere In Time album and these were rejected, it's been documented with any reference to the 1986 album for the last 25 years.  So, how about letting us Maiden fans know or hear those songs - now that would have been of interest!  And that really sums up this release. It is, as a stand alone product, bloody amazing!  It's just that whatever is presented here has been done better by the band elsewhere and there really was the scope for the band to have done better here too.  Frankly, the care and attention given to this release falls short of what the Early Days DVD release achieved.  So, I find myself in the odd position of really enjoying this release, whilst also being somewhat frustrated.

product_title: Gravity - Oscar® 2014 du Meilleur Réalisateur - Blu-Ray 3D + Blu-ray + DVD + Digital Ultraviolet (Ultimate Edition) [Ultimate Edition - Blu-ray 3D + Blu-ray + DVD + Copie digitale]
review_body: La réalisation du film est une prouesse, combinée à une 3D de bonne facture cela donne un film ultra immersif qui par moments donne réellement le vertige. Néanmoins le prix du BD 3D, la minceur du scénario (et ses quelques faiblesses/incohérences) ainsi que la courte durée de ce dernier le plombe carrément ! C'est un film qu'il faut voir,  mais obligatoirement en 3D et sur un vidéo projecteur sinon il n'en reste que les mauvais cotés et là effectivement c'est très moyen.
translated_review: The realization of the film is a feat, combined with a 3D of good invoice it gives an ultra immersive movie that at times actually gives vertigo.Nevertheless the price of BD 3D, the slimming of the scenario (and its some weaknesses / inconsistencies) as well as the short duration of the latter the plumps downright!It is a movie that must be seen, but obligatorily in 3D and on a video projector otherwise it remains only the bad side and there actually it is very average.

review_headline: Klasse Debut-Album von Sound of Contact
review_body: Simon Collins, Sohn des legendären Phil Collins, legt mit seinem Projekt „Sound of Contact“( u.a. mit Porcupine Tree Gitarrist John Wesley und dem Keyboarder Dave Kerzner als Co-Writer/Co-Producer) nach 3 Solo-Alben im Pop-Bereich (wobei die letzte Scheibe „U-Catastrophe“ schon einige progressive Anklänge aufwies) mit „Dimensionaut“ sein erstes Prog-Album vor.  In diesem SciFi-Konzeptalbum geht es um den Raum-und Zeitreisenden Dimo, der die Grenzen menschlicher Erfahrungen erweitern will. Nach dem kurzen sphärischen Intro gibt es ein Instrumental, dass einen erst mal auf die falsche Fährte lockt. Dieses etwas vertrackte, recht rockige Stück klingt ein wenig wie Porcupine Tree mit Phil Collins an den Drums. Das nächste Stück „Pale Blue Dot“ zeigt uns dann, wohin die Reise auf dem Album geht: Keyboard betonter melodischer Prog mit hervorragender Rhytmusarbeit und Simon Collins’ Stimme, die im Timbre sehr oft der seines Vaters ähnelt.  Wer von den Prog Freunden auf schräge Rhythmen, vertrackte Songs mit Ecken und Kanten steht, dürfte auf diesem Album nicht fündig werden. Collins und Kollegen kreieren meist sphärische Keyboard Sounds, die nicht selten an die Genesis Ende der 70er Jahre erinnern. Dazu trommelt sich Simon oftmals die Seele aus dem Leib. Ganz klar ist hier zu hören, dass er bei seinem Vater in die Lehre gegangen ist. Und in den Songs kommt dann Simon Collins als Sänger noch mit Melodien um die Ecke, die sich in die Gehörgänge fressen und einen nicht mehr loslassen. Selbst in den balladesken Stücken schafft es aber Simon, die süßlichen seichten Stellen, die sein Vater oft ansteuerte, gekonnt zu umschiffen. Große Solo-Eskapaden der einzelnen Instrumente gibt es hier nicht, die Musik wirkt im Ganzen, ist mehr auf Atmosphäre denn auf großartiges Solieren ausgelegt. Obwohl sich das Album vorwiegend im Midtempo bewegt, wird es nie langweilig. Sound of Contact schaffen es immer wieder, neue Reizpunkte zu setzen, so in dem etwas reduzierten, leicht beatlesken „Remote View“ oder in dem wundervollen „Beyond Illumination“, das mit Trip Hop und Reggae Anklängen und der Gastsängerin Hannah Stobart als Simons Duettpartnerin aufwartet. Stobart wurde als weiblicher Part von Wishing Tree, dem Sideproject vom Marillion Gitarristen Steve Rothery bekannt. Und hat man dann bei der (trotzdem sehr schönen) Ballade „Closer to you“ den Eindruck, dass so langsam doch das süßliche Fahrwasser von Phil Collins erreicht wird, schaffen es Sound of Contact mit dem folgenden proggigen „Omega Point“ rechtzeitig, das Ruder wieder herumzureißen. Als Abschluss folgt noch das knapp 20 minütige Prog-Rock Stück „Möbius Slip“, das wie das erste Instumental auch vereinzelte Alternative-Einflüsse aufweist und das Album praktisch musikalisch nochmal zusammenfasst.  Fazit: Für Freunde von melodischem Progressive Rock ist das hervorragende Debüt-Album von „Sound of Contact“ eine unbedingte Empfehlung. Auch Hardcore Progger und Fans der Musik von Phil Collins sollten dem Album eine Chance geben. Denn dieses Album braucht etwas Zeit und wächst mit jedem Hördurchgang. Und das ist doch eigentlich das Beste, was man von einem Album sagen kann.
translated_review: Simon Collins, son of the legendary Phil Collins, puts with his project "Sound of Contact" (including Porcupine Tree Guitarist John Wesley and the Keyboarder Dave Kerzner as Co-Writer / Co-Producer) to 3 solo albums in the pop area ( Where the last slice "U-Catastrophe" already had some progressive contests) with "dimensional" his first prog album. This SCIFI concept album is about the room and time traveling DIMO, which wants to expand its boundaries of human experiences. After the short spherical intro there is an instrumental that it attracts first to the wrong track. This somewhat satisfied, quite rocky piece sounds a bit like Porcupine Tree with Phil Collins to the drums. The next piece "Pale Blue Dot" shows us where the journey on the album is: Keyboard stressed melodic prog with excellent rhythm work and Simon Collins' voice, which is very often similar to his father in Timbre. Anyone who stands by the Prog friends on sloping rhythms, satged songs with corners and edges should not be found on this album. Collins and colleagues usually create spherical keyboard sounds that often remember the Genesis at the end of the 1970s. Simon often drums the soul from the body. Of course, it is clear here that he went to his father in the teaching. And in the songs, Simon Collins as a singer still comes with melodies around the corner, which eat into the ears and no longer let go. But even in the balladesque pieces, Simon creates the sweety places that spoiled his father often controlled. Large solo escapadas of the individual instruments is not here, the music looks throughout the whole, is more designed on atmosphere because great soled. Although the album moves mainly in midtempo, it never gets boring. Sound of contacts always create new stimulus points, so in the somewhat reduced, easily beating "remote view" or in the wonderful "Beyond Illumination", which attaches to Trip Hop and Reggae and the guest singer Hannah Stobart as Simons Duettpartner . Stobart was known as a female part of Wishing Tree, the Sideproject of the Marillion guitarist Steve Rothery. And then, in the (still very nice) ballad "Closer to you", the impression that so slowly the sweet waters of Phil Collins is achieved, it creates Sound of Contact with the following example "Omega Point" in good time, the rudder To push around. As a degree, the nearly 20 minute prog rock piece "Möbius Slip", which as the first Instumentental also has scattered alternative influences and the album converge virtually musically again. Conclusion: For friends of melodic progressive rock, the excellent debut album of "Sound of Contact" is an unconditional recommendation. Hardcore Progger and fans of the music of Phil Collins should also give the album a chance. Because this album needs some time and grows with every listening passage. And that's the best thing you can say about an album.

review_body:
En plus des magnifiques passages musicaux, portés avec bonheur par un Stephano Dionisi séduisant à souhait, on trouve dans ce film une vrai intrigue sur la relation entre les deux frères Broschi. Les liens qui les unissent sont évidents, mais ce qui les sépare l'est un peu moins. Heureusement tout s'éclaircit à la fin (et c'est sans doute à ça qu'on reconnait un grand film).
Une petite déception toutefois, mais qui ne concerne pas le film mais le bonus \"Nostalgie d'une voix perdue, documentaire consacré aux castrats\": je m'attendais à trouver plus d'informations sur les castrats, alors qu'il ne s'agit que de montrer comment ils ont obtenu cette voix halucinante. Ce n'est pas inintéressant, loin de là, mais je reste sur ma faim en ce qui concerne le volet historique.
translated_review:
In addition to the beautiful musical passages, worn with happiness by a seductive Dionisi stephano, we find in this film a true plot on the relationship between the two brothers Broschi.The links that unite them are obvious, but what separates them is a little less.Fortunately everything clears up at the end (and that's probably that we recognize a big movie).
A little disappointment, but who does not concern the film but the bonus \ "nostalgia in a lost voice, documentary dedicated to the castrates \": I was expecting to find more information on the castrates, while'It's just about showing how they got this illuminating voice.It is not uninteresting, far from it, but I remain on my hunger regarding the historic pane.

product_title: Amy Winehouse - At the BBC (3 Discs + Audio-CD)
review_body: Als großer Amy-Fan hab ich mir die Box direkt zugelegt. Deshalb kann ich keine \"neutrale\" Rezension schreiben; meine Begeisterung für ihre Stimme und authentischen Texte kann ich nicht ausblenden (um zu wissen, in welchem Kontekt beurteilt wurde).  Diese Sammlung zeigt ihre Vielfältigkeit als Singer/Songwriter, den Einfluss verschiedener musikalischer Genres und veranschaulicht damit ihren künstlerischen Werdegang. Sie war eine fantastische Jazzsängerin und hat im Laufe ihrer kurzen Karriere einen einzigartigen Sound entwickelt, in dem sich verschiedene Musikstile verbinden. Deshalb ist die Auswahl gut gelungen, sie bietet einen Überblick über Amys Lebenswerk. Ob sie Klassiker neu interpretiert und ihnen da-bei ihre persönliche Note verleiht, ob sie in einer kleinen Kirche fast unplugged singt (atmosphärisch, stimmlich auf dem absoluten Höhepunkt) oder als irgendwie trotzig wirkende 19jährige mit E-Gitarre auf der Bühne steht: man lernt verschiedene Seiten ihrer Musik und unterschiedliche Stimmungen (die untrennbar mit ihrer Wirkung bei Perfomances verbunden sind) von Amy kennen und bekommt einen umfassenden Gesamteindruck ihres Talents und den Stationen ihrer musikalischen Entwicklung. Wer sie neu oder besser kennenlernen will: uneingeschränkte Kaufempfehlung.  Eingefleischte Fans werden wahrscheinlich so gut wie nichts Neues finden. Es sind schon etwas rarere und nicht nur sehr bekannte Aufnahmen dabei. Die, die aber große Unbekannte erwartet haben, werden enttäuscht. Allerdings sind viele Sachen das erste Mal offiziell in Deutschland veröffentlicht und liegen  -vermutlich- in guter Qualität von Bild und/oder Ton vor (übrigens: die verfügbaren deutschen Untertitel erleichtern das Verständnis bei Problemen mit dialektbehaftetem Englisch). Weil ich an Technik kein Interesse und darum kaum Ahnung davon habe, kann ich diesen Aspekt nicht sachgerecht beurteilen. Dennoch bin ich der Meinung: der Kauf lohnt sich auch für Fans, diees schön länger sind. Wer nicht einen strikten Sparkurs einhalten muss, darf ruhigen Gewissens zugreifen.  Auch wenn es immer häufiger getan wird: ich finde es nicht von Vorteil, wenn CDs/DVDs etc. \"überlappend\" in ihrer Verpackung untergebracht sind, anstatt sie einzeln zu platzieren. Das könnte besser sein. Ansonsten bin ich mit meinem Kauf absolut zufrieden.
translated_review: As a big Amy fan, I have bought the box directly. Therefore, I can not write a "neutral \" review; My enthusiasm for her voice and authentic texts I can not hide (to know in which concecation was assessed). This collection shows its diversity as a singer / songwriter, the influence of different musical genres and thus illustrates their artistic career. She was a fantastic jazz singer and has developed a unique sound in the course of her short career, in which different music styles connect. Therefore, the selection has succeeded, it offers an overview of Amys life's work. Whether you reinterpret classics and gives you there-with your personal touch, whether she sings almost unplugged in a small church (atmospheric, vocally on the absolute highlight) or as somehow stupid 19-year-old with electric guitar on stage is: one learns Various sides of your music and different moods (which are inextricably linked to their effects with Perfomances) from Amy and gets a comprehensive overall impression of their talent and the stations of their musical development. Who wants to get to know you new or better: unrestricted purchase recommendation. Deep fans will probably find anything new as well. There are already something rarere and not only very well-known shots. The ones who expect big unknowns are disappointed. However, many things are officially published in Germany for the first time and pronounced in good quality of image and / or tone (by the way: the available German subtitles make it easier to understand in terms of dialect-based English). Because I have no interest in technology and therefore hardly any idea of ​​it, I can not judge this aspect properly. Nevertheless, I think that the purchase is also worthwhile for fans who are nice longer. Who does not have to comply with a strict austerity price, can access calm conscents. Even if it is always done more and more frequently: I can not advantage if CDs / DVDs etc. \ "overlapping \" are housed in your packaging instead of placing them individually. That could be better. Otherwise, I am absolutely satisfied with my purchase.

Das finde ich auch bei Lego echt Klasse. Die Aufbauanleitungen kann man gut umsetzen.  Ansonsten ist es ein optisch ansprechendes Spielzeug, was von unserem Sohn gut im Spiel eingesetzt wird, auch wenn er mit 7 eigentlich noch nicht ganz altersgerecht ist
translated_review: What happens to many Ninjago toys is that it is very fragile.This does not completely remain here.Building instructions have been able to implement our super.I think that's really great at LEGO.The construction instructions can be implemented well.Otherwise it is an optically appealing toy, which is used by our son well in the game, even if he is not quite aged with 7

review_body: An sich wäre dieses Puzzle sehr unterhaltsam, aber eine Kleinigkeit stört massiv: Tippt man auf einem Schnittpunkt, der technisch nicht erreichbar ist - etwa, weil man einen dazwischen übersprungen hat - so teilt einem das Spiel diesem Fehler in der Form mir, dass sämtlicher Fortschritt im Level gelöscht wird. Da man sich einfach gerade bei den größeren Levels gelegentlich mal vertippt, ist das sehr ärgerlich! Ein einfacher Warnton hätte es auch getan, aber so?  Ich hätte es gerne gespielt, doch durch diesen Blödsinn hat man schon nach den ersten Levels keine Lust mehr.
translated_review: In itself, this puzzle would be very entertaining, but a little thing botheres massive: you tap on an intersection that is technically unavailable - for example, because you have skipped one in between - such a game of this mistake in the form tells me that all the progressis deleted in the level.Since you just smell even at the larger levels occasionally, that's very annoying!A simple warning sound would have done it too, but so?I would have liked to play it, but through this nonsense you have no desire after the first levels.

review_body: La nouvelle formule de Rhapsody version Turilli regagne un peu du souffle que la précédente formation avait perdu sur son dernier opus. Un peu moins ampoulé et plus efficace, cet album est un bon premier pas dans une nouvelle saga.
translated_review: The new version of Rhapsody Version Turilli returns a little bit of the breath that the previous training had lost on its last opus.A little less bulb and more efficient, this album is a good first step in a new saga.

review_body: At the start of this book I was hesitant that it would be similar to 50 first dates, however how wrong could I have been.  As other people have mentioned, the last 150 pages or so are so intense you literally can't put the book down. The twisting relationship of love and confusion Christine has is intense and throughout the book your left wondering where the story will take you.  Certainly worth a read!

product_title: Belgarath the Sorcerer (The Belgariad & The Malloreon)
review_body: With the end of the fabulous cycles of the Belgariad and the Mallorean, the story seems accomplished and that usual sad emotion shows up as the last book is regretfully put back in the shelter. But here comes a glimpse of hope.   Although the reader knows the epic story of the rise of King Belgarion and the defeat of the Child of Dark, Eddings opens a new door by telling us what happened before. And so Ancient Belgarath picks up his feather (although nit voluntary) to tell us about his time.  This book is devoted to the life and adventures of Belgarath.     His youth, his life in the Vale, his brothers and families, everything is brought up under a new light. Although many hints to these times are mentioned in the cycles and the common thread is already known, the reader is still enjoying the adventures of the old sorcerer.

review_body: Books that deal with a glimpse of the future at times have gone on to inspire mankind in its creativity, however what is presented within is a brief glimpse for each human into their own future 21 years ahead.  Which allows each to examine that part in the minutae and not get the full picture as if mankind were being manipulated by the gods and taunted with the possibilities in much the same way that the Cyclops of ancient Greece were.      Beautifully written and whilst its dated over ten years ago its inspired a tv series that will have many people hoping for answers from within this novels pages.  A great look into the possibilities and the madness knowning our own future would inspire but upon whom is the great cosmic joke and what exactly does this portent precede?  This was a book that kept me gripped from the first few pages to the last and is definitely something that's a tad different to the norm of the usual fiction that's out there.

review_headline: Il manque un je ne sais quoi....
review_body: Enfin un film de SF qui a des airs de Stars Wars avec ses extra terrestres et ses engins volants. Seulement, voilà : le fameux John Carter, le héros, manque de profondeur, d'étoffe pour que vraiment on se sente emballé par son aventure. C'est vraiment dommage car les effets spéciaux sont splendides, de même que les décors. Personnellement, c'est son héros que je n'ai pas vraiment aimé. Est ce le fait que le roman ait été écrit il y a un siècle? Était il aussi peu attachant dans le livre? Mais le fim reste un bon divertissement et la pirouette finale sauve un peu le reste.
translated_review: Finally a movie of SF who has tunes of stars wars with his extra terrestrial and his flying gear.Only, here: the famous John Carter, the hero, lacks depth, stuff so that you really feel packed by his adventure.It's really a shame because the special effects are splendid, as well as the sets.Personally, it's his hero that I did not really like it.Is the fact that the novel was written a century ago?Was he as little endearing in the book?But the FIM remains a good entertainment and the final pirouette saves a little the rest.

review_body:
ich verstehe nicht warum soviele Leute über den Film herziehen. Ich denke wer behauptet, dass der Film eine flache Handlung hat, hat nicht aufmerksam zu geschaut. Schon der Anfang des Films (die Kamerafahrt durch den Matrixcode, der Maschinen darstellt) ist ein großer Tip, wie es im dritten Teil weiter geht. Jeder Dialog im Film scheint mir sehr überlegt, allerdings erst wenn man mal drüber nachdenkt. Der Film ist voller Hinweise auf den dritten Teil. soviel zur story. ich denke zu den spezial effekten ist schon genug gesagt worden. ja, der bullettime effekt wurde immer wieder verwendet, aber wer wäre auf die idee gekommen diesen bei 2 explodierenden LKWs einzusetzen? klar, es gibt keine neuen innovationen, aber trotzdem wurden die alten effekte stark verbessert.
meiner meinung ein film, den man auf jeden Fall gesehen haben sollte.
translated_review: I do not understand why so many people bring about the movie.I think who claims that the movie has a flat action did not look attentive.Already the beginning of the movie (the camera shot through the matrix code that represents machines) is a big tip, as it goes on in the third part.Every dialogue in the film seems to me very much, but only when you think about it.The film is full of hints on the third part.So much to the story.I think about the special effects has already been said enough.Yes, the Bulletime effect was used again and again, but who would have come up with the idea to use this with 2 exploding trucks?Sure, there are no new innovations, but still the old effects have been greatly improved. In my opinion, a movie you should have seen in any case.

review_headline: Une suite différente et un très bon blu-ray
review_body: Le premier "Ghost Rider", sorti en 2007, était un excellent film issu du Comics Marvel du même nom, avec une ambiance unique et des scènes d'action nerveuses et spectaculaires. Une réussite totale emmenée par un Nicolas Cage au top de sa forme! Ce deuxième opus nommé "L'esprit de vengeance", sorti en 2012 et réalisé par Mark Neveldine et Brian Taylor (Les réalisateurs de "Ultimate Game et "Hyper tension" 1 et 2 entre autres.), n'a pas rencontré le succès escompté lors de sa sortie au cinéma et est très différent de son aîné sur certains points. L'histoire, déjà, se passe comme si il n'y avait jamais eu de premier opus, ou presque. A aucun moment "Ghost Rider : L'esprit de vengeance" n'évoque le premier film au niveau des événements ou encore de l'absence de certains acteurs du premier opus, Eva Mendes et Peter Fonda en tête. Le film suit donc les aventures de Johnny Blaze qui se retrouve exilé en Roumanie. Il doit protéger un enfant convoité par le diable qui désire prendre possession de son corps pour pouvoir régner encore plus longtemps sur Terre. L'histoire est un peu simpliste mais demeure assez intéressante à suivre et ne manque pas d'humour ni de suspense. Le look du Rider a changé, il parait plus sombre et complexe et sa fameuse moto est complètement différente et a perdu en charme, dommage. L'ambiance générale est plus déjantée, voire peut-être même trop, on sent bien la patte des réalisateurs des fous furieux "Hyper Tension 1" et "2". Il y a trop d'effets de style à la "Matrix" qui gâche un peu le tout. Malgré ça, le film possède un rythme assez soutenu, on ne s'ennuie jamais. Les scènes d'action sont nerveuses et efficaces et les effets spéciaux sont très spectaculaires. Le casting est moins charismatique que le premier opus, on regrettera l'absence d'Eva Mendes et Ciaran Hinds, qui incarne ici le rôle diable, est moins convaincant que Peter Fonda. Heureusement, Nicolas Cage assure à nouveau dans le rôle du Ghost Rider et sauve une bonne partie du film de la noyade. A noter également la présence au casting de Christophe Lambert et de Idris Elba. En bref, "Ghost Rider : L'esprit de vengeance" est moins intéressant que son prédécesseur et si on passe quand même un bon moment devant ce film Marvel, il est loin d'égaler le premier opus en tous points. Un divertissement malgré tout efficace et spectaculaire, à voir au moins une fois pour se faire une idée.  Le blu-ray offre une superbe qualité d'image, digne du support HD. Les couleurs sont belles et l'image est très propre et nette. Rien à dire, c'est bien mieux que le DVD. Au niveau du son, la VF est proposée en 5.1 DTS-HD MA, tout comme la VO. Un son d'une qualité irréprochable, merci M6 Video!  En bref, même si vous avez adorer le premier "Ghost Rider", il n'est pas sûr que vous accrocherez à "Ghost Rider : L'esprit de vengeance", qui est une suite un peu décevante. Le film est réalisé de manière différente et est bien plus rythmé que son prédécesseur, peut-être même un peu trop, ça peut vite devenir saoulant. L'histoire n'a aucun de lien avec le premier volet donc si vous n'avez pas vu ce dernier, vous pourrez voir sans problème ce deuxième épisode qui est plus une sorte de Reboot qu'une véritable suite. Malgré tous ses défauts, il contient l'essentiel pour passer un agréable moment devant la télévision : Une histoire assez banale mais intéressante à suivre, des décors et costumes superbes, un rythme soutenu, des scènes d'action nerveuses et bien menées, des effets spéciaux spectaculaires, un casting très correct, de l'humour et de l'émotion. Un divertissement assez correct mais à voir avant d'acheter pour éviter une éventuelle déception. Le blu-ray lui est exempt de tout reproche.
translated_review: The first "Ghost Rider", released in 2007, was an excellent film from the Marvel Comics of the same name, with a unique atmosphere and scenes of nerve and spectacular action. A total success taken by a Nicolas Cage at the top of its shape! This second opus named "the Spirit of Revenge", released in 2012 and directed by Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor (the directors of "Ultimate Game and" hyper tension "1 and 2 among others.), Did not meet success. expected during his exit to the cinema and is very different from his elder on some points. The story already happened as if there had never been a first opus, or almost. At any time "Ghost Rider: L 'Spirit of revenge "does not mention the first film at the level of events or the absence of some actors of the first opus, Eva Mendes and Peter founded in mind. The film follows the adventures of Johnny Blaze who finds himself exiled in Romania. He must protect a child coveted by the devil who wants to take possession of his body to be able to reign even longer on earth. The story is a little simplistic but remains quite interesting to follow and does not lack humor or suspense . The look of the rider has changed, it seems darker and complex and His famous motorcycle is completely different and lost in charm, damage. The general atmosphere is more crazy, or perhaps even too, one feels the paw of the directors of the furious crazy "hyper tension 1" and "2". There are too many style effects at the "Matrix" who spoils a little. Despite this, the film has a rather sustained rhythm, we never get bored. The action scenes are nervous and efficient and the special effects are very spectacular. The cast is less charismatic than the first opus, we will regret the absence of Eva Mendes and Ciaran Hinds, which embodies here the devil role, is less convincing than Peter Fonda. Fortunately, Nicolas Cage assures again in the role of Ghost Rider and saves a good part of the drowning film. Also note the presence at the cast of Christophe Lambert and Idris Elba. In short, "Ghost Rider: The Spirit of Revenge" is less interesting than his predecessor and if we still spend a good time in front of this film Marvel, he is far from equal to the first opus in every way. An entertainment despite everything effective and spectacular, to see at least once to get an idea. The Blu-ray offers superb image quality, worthy of HD support. The colors are beautiful and the image is very clean and clear. Nothing to say, it's much better than the DVD. At the sound level, the VF is proposed in 5.1 DTS-HD MA, just like the VO. A sound of an irreproachable quality, thank you M6 Video! In short, even if you have to worship the first "Ghost Rider", it is not sure that you hang on to "Ghost Rider: The Spirit of Revenge", which is a little disappointing sequence. The film is made differently and is much more punctuated than its predecessor, perhaps even a little too much, it can quickly become taught. The story has no link with the first component so if you have not seen the latter, you will be able to see this second episode without problem that is more a kind of reboot than a real suite. Despite all its faults, it contains the essentials to spend a pleasant time in front of the television: a rather banal but interesting story to follow, decorations and superb costumes, a steady pace, nerve and well-conducted action scenes, effects Spectacular special, a very correct cast, humor and emotion. An entertainment fairly correct but to see before buying to avoid any disappointment. The Blu-ray is free from reproach.

review_body:
Pocahontas ist ein sehr wertvoller Film. Die Geschichte orientiert sich nur oberflächlich am Leben der historischen Häuptlingstochter Pocahontas. Aber das aufeinandertreffen der unterschiedlichen Kulturen wird sehr gekonnt in Bildern dargestellt, die auch Kinder verstehen können.
Die Indianer führen ein naturnahes Leben, dass vom Geisterglauben bestimmt wird. Die Weißen fahren zu den \"dreckigen Heiden\" auf der Suche nach Land und Gold. Während die Indianer ein selbstzufriedenes Leben führen, denken die Weißen daran, wie sie am meisten aus dem Land herausholen können. Der Konflikt ist unausweichlich – aber im Märchen siegt das Gute.
Die moralische Botschaft ist heute noch aktuell: \"Für dich sind echte Menschen nur die Meschen, die so denken und so aussehen wie du. Doch folge nur den Spuren eines Fremden, so verstehst du, und du lernst noch was dazu\"
translated_review:
Pocahontas is a very valuable movie.The story is based only superficially on the life of the historic chief daughter Pocahontas.But the meeting of the different cultures is very skilfully portrayed in pictures, which can also understand children.
The Indians lead a natural life that is determined by the ghost belief.The white driving to the \ "dirty heaths \" looking for land and gold.While the Indians lead a self-satisfied life, the whites think of how they can get the most out of the country.The conflict is inevitable - but in the fairy tale the good is the good.
The Moral Embassy is still up to date today: \ "For you, real people are just the Meschen, who think so and look like you. But just follow the traces of a stranger, so you understand, and you learn something else"

product_title: A Matter Of Life And Death (Limited Edition mit Bonus-DVD)
review_headline: Endlich wieder ein grandioses Maiden Album!
review_body: Zugegebenermassen war das Vorgängerwerk mit Ausnahme des Titeltracks, NO MORE LIES und PASCHENDALE einfach nur eintönig und es durfte befürchtet werden, dass MAIDEN nach dem wirklich guten Reuinon-Album BRAVE NEW WORLD ins Mittelmass abdriften. Was sich allerdings die 6 Briten in nur 2 Monaten Aufnahme- und Produktionszeit aus Ihren, nicht mehr ganz taufrischen Rippen, geleiert haben, ist einfach nur gnadenlos gut. Mit DIFFERENT WORLD steigen MAIDEN gewohnt fetzig in das Album ein, das einzige Manko des Tracks ist, das er genau wie die Opener der beiden letzten Alben gestrickt ist, ansonsten kommt das Ding wunderbar daher. Mit THESE COLORS DONT RUN geht es munter weiter, gefolgt von dem 8.44 Minuten Epos BRIGHTER THAN A THOUSAND SUNS. THE PILGRIM, eine typische Jannick Gers-Komposition mit orientalischen Elementen a la NOMAD von BRAVE NEW WORLD, wird gefolgt von einem der beeindruckendsten Stücke des Albums THE LONGEST DAY. Mit OUT OF THE SHADOWS werden \"ruhigere Töne\" angeschlagen, allerdings weitaus gelungener als dem einschläfernden JOURNEYMAN von DANCE OF THE DEAD. Mit Track 7 und 8, nämlich THE REINCARNATION OF BENJAMIN BREGG und FOR THE GREATER GOOD OF GOD, werden MAIDEN wirklich alle Kritiker zum Verstummen bringen - hinsetzen, anhören, staunen, geniessen.absolute Höchstklasse. LORD OF LIGHT fällt in meinen Augen etwas gegen die anderen Songs ab, mit THE LEGACY legen MAIDEN den besten Abschlusssong eines Albums seit ALEXANDER THE GREAT vom 86-er SOMEWHERE IN TIME Album vor. Weltklasse. Nicht nur die gnadenlos gute Production des Albums stechen ins Auge bzw. Ohr, auch die Lyrics sind diesmal ausgesprochen gelungen. MAIDEN beschäftigen sich - ausser bei DIFFERENT WORLD, PILGRIM und OUT OF THE SHADOWS - auf diesem Album ausschliesslich mit Kriegsthemen, somit könnte man es schon fast ein KONZEPTALBUM nennen. Sicher, MAIDEN haben schon früher derartige Themen aufgegriffen, das Textmaterial kommt diesmal allerdings wesentlich überlegter und ausgereifter daher, als seinerzeit in Stücken wie TAILGUNNER oder PASCHENDALE, in der eine seltsam, zum Wohle der Engländer, verfälschte Geschichtsdarstellung betrieben wurde, die ebenso fragwürdig wie überflüssig war. Insgesamt bietet dieses Album also über 70 Minuten feinsten, reinrassigen Heavy-Metal, der - Gott sei Dank - in der Musikwelt wieder eine massgebliche Rolle spielt, und der Beweis dafür ist, dass 6 Männer die gut in ihren 40gern sind, die - angeblich so talentierten - Newcomer der Szene luftig, locker, leicht an die Wand spielen. Es wird nicht mehr viele Bands geben, die nach 13 Alben und gut 40 Mio. verkauften Tonträgern noch das Mark in den Knochen haben, ein derart frisches Album zu produzieren. Dafür gebührt Ihnen Respekt und - knappe - 5 Punkte.  Die DVD enthält ein unterhaltsames 30-Min. Filmchen über den Aufnahmeprozess im Studio, das REINCARNATION OF BENJAMIN BREGG Video, DIFFERENT WORLD live im Studio eingespielt und eine Fotogalerie von den Aufnahmen. Ganz nett, aber nix weltbewegendes!
translated_review: Admittedly, the predecessor, with the exception of the title track, No more read and paschendale just monotonous and was allowed to be feared that Maiden after the really good Reukon album Brave New World in the Mediterranean. However, what the 6 British has joined their recording and production time in only 2 months of recording and production time from their, no longer very torn ribs, is just mercilessly good. With Different World, Maiden are lived in the album, the only drawback is the track, which he is knitted just like the opener of the last two albums, otherwise the thing comes wonderful therefore. With Thesis Colors Dont Run, it goes well, followed by the 8.44 minutes Epos Brighter Than A Thousand Suns. The Pilgrim, a typical Jannick Gers composition with oriental elements a la nomad of Brave New World, is followed by one of the most impressive pieces of the album The Longest Day. With out of the shadows, "quieter tones \" are struck, but far more successful than the deadly Journeyman of Dance of the Dead. With Track 7 and 8, namely The Reincarnation of Benjamin Bregg and For The Greater Good of God, Maiden will really bring all critics to silent - sit down, listen, marvel, enjoy.BSOLTE Maximum Class. Lord of Light falls in my eyes something against the other songs, with the legacy Maiden present the best ending song of an album since Alexander The Great from the 86-he Somewhere in Time Album. World class. Not only the mercilessly good production of the album stinging into the eye or ear, even the lyrics are very successful this time. Maiden - except for Different World, Pilgrim and Out of the Shadows - excluded war topics on this album, so you could already call it almost a concept album. Safe, Maiden have already taken up such topics, the text material, however, comes much more thoughtful and mature this time, as at the time in pieces such as Tailgunner or Paschendale, in which a strange, for the benefit of the English, falsified historical representation was operated, which is equally questionable as superfluous was. Overall, this album offers over 70 minutes of the finest, purebred heavy-metal, which - thank God - in the music world plays a significant role in the music world, and the proof is that 6 men are well in their 40sgs, allegedly so Talented - newcomers of the scene airy, loose, easy to play the wall. There will not be many bands that after 13 albums and more than 40 million toners sold have the marrow in the bones to produce such a fresh album. This is due to them respect and - even - 5 points. The DVD contains an entertaining 30-min. Milks about the recording process in the studio, the Reincarnation of Benjamin Bregg Video, Different World Live in the studio recorded and a photo gallery of the recordings. Very nice, but nothing world moving!

review_headline: Edgar Poe a bon dos mais ne pas abuser de la mort rouge
review_body: This is a very funny though quite gory series. A serial killer has built behind him a whole underground social network which works like a cult: it recruits people who have problems with life, who have already killed one or more people, who have had the intention of doing so or who are just asocial, sociopaths or psychopaths who consider the world has to be destroyed, the human beings in it have to be killed and who are ready to die if their death can achieve that aim. In other words they work like a terrorist cult.  The first objective is to get the serial killer, Joe Carroll, out of death row to take the lead of the crusade, vendetta, purification of whatever he has in mind. He sees his adventure as a novel that follows the stories by Edgar Allan Poe. I must say that literary reference as the basis of a criminal adventure has already been used and Poe is maybe not the best since he contains no religious or mystical or even mythical references like Dante or other esoteric or apocryphal Christian texts. What’s more such a reference in a series is not easy to follow from one week to the next. But that must be the fun of the audience memorizing the various and successive references, or just taking them blindly.  On the other side the FBI and all other agencies and a conflict between an ex-agent who has already arrested that killer some years before and the standard bureaucrats of these agencies who cannot accept a non-agent having any leading position, especially since this non-agent is not limited really by any ethics he has not sworn to respect, though he was deputized once in this season for a short while.  The first season is extremely dense in action, violence and emotional situation, with a small six year old boy in the midst of the action of his own father against society and against his own mother and father’s ex-wife. There are some sloppy moments when they let anyone in a crisis situation penetrate in some kind of safe area without checking her or him or them out properly. They also forget that cars have GPS’s, though they think of it from time to time.  The series is cruel and the end of the first season gives us only waste lands for the next season. How are they going to grow any kind of a story in the devastated landscape they abandon behind them, on both sides, the serial killer’s and the FBI’s?  Dr Jacques COULARDEAUithout checking her or him or them out properly. They also forget that cars have GPS’s, though they think of it from time to time.  The series is cruel and the end of the first season gives us only waste lands for the next season. How are they going to grow any kind of a story in the devastated landscape they abandon behind them, on both sides, the serial killer’s and the FBI’s?  Dr Jacques COULARDEAU

review_body: Un excellent Rogue-like (jeu d'exploration de dongeons générés aléatoirement et où la mort du héros a un caractère définitif) au graphisme inspiré de Secret of Mana.  Le jeu est assez difficile (surtout au début) mais on progresse grâce aux améliorations du héros qui sont conservées entre chaque partie.  La jouabilité est excellente (et encore meilleure pour les possesseur de tablettes munies de contrôles physiques, comme la NVIDIA shield).  La durée de vie est énorme, d'autant que Noodlecake publie régulièrement des mises à jour (toujours gratuites) qui rajoutent du contenu (nouveau dongeon.).  Le jeu ne propose aucun achat in-app (ce qui est un vrai plus).  Il est nécessaire d'être connecté à internet pour bénéficier de certaines fonctionnalités (gestion des \"achievements\"et du mode \"endless\") mais il est possible de refuser la connexion en cliquant sur \"non merci\" ce qui est indispensable pour les possesseur de tablette WiFi only (Je joue sur une JXD s7300b) en déplacement (et aussi pour économiser la batterie).
translated_review: An excellent rogue-like (dongeon exploration game generated randomly and where the death of the hero has a definitive character) to the graphics inspired by Secret of Mana. The game is quite difficult (especially at first) but it is progressing thanks to the improvements of the hero who are kept between each part. Playability is excellent (and even better for owners of tablets with physical controls, such as Nvidia Shield). The lifespan is enormous, especially as Noodlecake regularly publishes (always free) updates that add content (new dongeon.). The game does not offer in-app purchase (which is a real plus). It is necessary to be connected to the Internet to benefit from certain features (management of achievments \ "and mode \" endless \ ") but it is possible to refuse the connection by clicking \" No thanks \ "which is essential for WiFi Only tablet owner (I play on a JXD S7300B) on the move (and also to save the battery).

product_title: Diamonds On The Inside - Copy control
review_body:
En marge d'une logique commerciale et loin des machines à tubes,Ben Harper nous offre ici un nouveau bijou. Toujours sincère et profond, Ben explore avec sensibilité des styles musicaux variés : reggae, blues, funk, hard-rock, ballade.
Voici donc un album aussi varié qu'attachant, avec lequel Ben ajoute une nouvelle perle au collier de son oeuvre.
translated_review:
On the sidelines of a commercial logic and far from tube machines, Ben Harper offers us here a new jewel.Always sincere and deep, Ben explores with a sensitivity of various musical styles: reggae, blues, funk, hard-rock, ballad.<
Here is an album as varied as attempting, with which Ben adds a new pearl to the necklace of his work.

review_body: This book started really well but really disappointed me as it developed. Increasingly I had the feeling it was written to be an action movie, and then I wasn't surprised to find out the author is a screenwriter. The problem is that what works visually in a film doesn't work so well on paper. Secret agent comes out of retirement for one more job, to save America. Single-handedly of course. And he solves another murder along the way. I couldn't stop thinking of Tom Cruise in the starring role. The book is packed with action sequences from which the hero (and the villain) escape by the skin of their teeth. There are side-tracks and totally unbelieveable coincidences to beat the band. It's well enough written, and keeps moving along, it's just completely lacking any subtlety. Like an action movie.

The problem is that what works visually in a film doesn't work so well on paper. Secret agent comes out of retirement for one more job, to save America. Single-handedly of course. It's well enough written, and keeps moving along, it's just completely lacking any subtlety. Like an action movie.

review_headline: Such a let down! Ruins the first film!
review_body: Well this film is dreadful! Being a sequel to one of my favourite all-time films, I was a little but sceptical, and I was justified. All they have done is taken the great film "The Crow" and used it's idea to write a dreadful film based around the idea of revenge. It is dark and seedy. It is disgusting in places. The new "crow" acts badly and his character is very weak. How he ended up in this sitiuation is even more un-believable. The view from the birds eyes is poor, the very fact that this miracle of coming back from the dead has happened twice is even more un-believable seeing as it is centered around the same young girl as in the previous film. Basically this is a poor film that should never have been made. I hate the directors and producers for ruining the whole "The Crow" story as the first film was so wonderful, well written, beautifully shot with some of Brandon Lees best acting! If you have seen or even heard of (or even if you haven't heard of!)"The Crow" - I urge you to NEVER buy this sequel as it will leave you with a nasty bitter taste in your mouth! DREADFUL!

All they have done is taken the great film "The Crow" and used it's idea to write a dreadful film based around the idea of revenge. It is dark and seedy. It is disgusting in places. The new "crow" acts badly and his character is very weak. How he ended up in this sitiuation is even more un-believable. If you have seen or even heard of (or even if you haven't heard of!)"The Crow" - I urge you to NEVER buy this sequel as it will leave you with a nasty bitter taste in your mouth! DREADFUL!

review_body: La "venue au monde", la naissance de Dracula. Un sujet qui m'a immédiatement attiré. Concernant le film:  - Il est plaisant à voir,  - La réalisation est excellente  - Les acteurs le sont également  - La qualité de l'image et du son ? Irréprochable! Pourquoi seulement 4 étoiles? En réalité 3,5 auraient été plus adaptées car il manque cette étincelle, ce trait de génie qui aurait enflammé le spectateur que je suis.  Il est probable qu'une version "director's cut" comble cette sensation de vide que j'ai ressenti par moment, ces moments ou je me disais "il manque quelque chose" comme je l'avais déjà ressenti pour un grand nombre de film qui ont fini par être mis en vente en "version longue" (Alien, Seigneur des Anneaux, Abyss etc.) Il faut dire que pour des impératifs de commercialisation il faut supprimer un grand nombre de scènes au montage et ceci au détriment de l'œuvre.  Oui à voir car le sujet et l'idée sont excellents, mais de la à l'acheter? En attendant une version "director's cut" je vous conseille plutôt une location
translated_review: The "coming to the world", the birth of Dracula. A subject that immediately attracted me. Regarding the film: - It is pleasant to see, - the realization is excellent - the actors are also - the quality of the image and the sound? Irreproachable! Why only 4 stars? In reality 3.5 would have been more suitable because it misses this spark, this trait of genius that would have inflamed the viewer that I am. It is likely that a "Director's Cut" version felt this empty feeling that I felt at times, these moments or I told myself "something" lacks "as I had ever felt for a lot of movie that have ended up on sale in "long version" (Alien, Lord of the Rings, Abyss etc.) It must be said that for marketing imperatives it is necessary to delete a large number of scenes in assembly and this at the expense of the work . Yes to see because the subject and the idea are excellent, but from buying it? Waiting for a "Director's Cut" version I advise you rather a rental

review_headline: WT werden von Album zu Album ...
review_body: . kommerzieller, gieriger, anti-individueller!  Was mit dem \"Mother Earth\"- Album weltweite Aufmerksamkeit erregte (zurecht!) wird mit den Nachfolgewerken immer mehr verwässert.   \"Black Symphony\" ist ein schlichtes Live-Album, mit Interpretationen von Songmaterial, das ich auf früheren Konzerten schon mit \"mehr Herzblut\" erlebt hatte.  Nachdem ihre große \"Konkurrenz\" Nightwish ja mit neuer (schlechter) Sängerin einen Griff ins Klo getan hat, hab ich den Eindruck, WT will nun gerade mit Gewalt den Status \"Nr.1 im Gothic-Metal\" erzwingen.   Black Symphony kann man hören, ist aber mehr ein zwanghaftes Werbeprodukt, denn eine von Musikerherzen kommende Veröffentlichung.   Selbst ihr erster \"Welthit\" Mother Earth, klingt darauf eher wie Hintergrundberieselungsmusik in einem Supermarkt!  Mit Wohlwollen 3 Sterne, gefühlt maximal zwei.
translated_review: .Commercial, greedy, anti-individual!What caused the \ "Mother Earth \" album global attention (right!) Is more and more diluted with the succession plants."Black Symphony \" is a simple live album, with interpretations of song material, which I had already experienced on earlier concerts with \ "more Heartblood \".After her big \ "competition" Nightwish yes with new (bad) singer has done a grip in the toilet, I have the impression that WT now wants to force the status \ "No.1 in the Gothic-Metal \" just with violence.Black Symphony can be heard, but is more of a compulsive advertising product, because a publication coming from musician hearts.Even her first \ "Welthit \" Mother Earth, sounds more like background seasons in a supermarket!With benevolent 3 stars, a maximum of two felt.
