review_body: Es ist da. Das neue Album von Natalia Kills. Besser als drei Weihnachten zusammen. Oder vier.  Das Ziel war klar: Nach dem großartigen und - bei so ziemlich allen (wenigen), die es gehört haben - beliebten Debüt-Album \"Perfectionist\" waren die Erwartungen groß, und so musste ein Album her, dass mindestens genau gut ist wie dieses. Wer sich von \"Trouble\" in etwa dasselbe erwartet hat, was schon auf \"Perfectionist\" geboten wurde, dem kann ich gleich an dieser Stelle sagen, dass er seine wertvolle Zeit nicht mit dem Anhören von \"Trouble\" verschwenden sollte.  Wer allerdings nicht nur ein Fan von \"Perfectionist\" ist, sondern vielmehr von Natalia Kills selbst, den wird \"Trouble\" möglicherweise flashen und in Euphorie versetzen, denn hier liegt ein Album vor, welches ganz und gar ein Natalia-Kills-Album ist. Hier braucht mir niemand mehr mit albernen Lady-GaGa-Vergleichen kommen (wie sie vor zwei Jahren üblich waren), Natalias Musik klingt deutlich anders.  Was ist es nun, das \"Trouble\" zu einem echten, eigenständigen Natalia-Kills-Album macht? Zunächst ist ihr Gesang so viel besser geworden. Während dem Hörer bei \"Perfectionist\" zuallererst die Synthie-Beats anspringen, kommt diesmal immer deutlicher Natalias charakteristische, ausdrucksstarke Stimme zur Geltung, mit welcher sie gleich mehrere Songs deutlich veredeln kann. Schon die Single \"Saturday Night\" hat unter anderem von Natalias authentischem Gesang gelebt, und das zeigt sich beispielsweise auch bei \"Devils Don't Fly\", \"Outta Time\", \"Marlboro Lights\", \"Trouble\" und anderen.  Erwähnenswert ist die musikalische Bandbreite, die Natalia auf \"Trouble\" vorweisen kann: Da wären etwa eingängige Popnummern wie \"Television\", \"Stop Me\", \"Boys Don't Cry\" und \"Daddy's Girl\", die alles andere als alltägliche Massenware sind. Dann sind finstere Beat-Monster, von denen ich bei Natalia immer besonders schwärme, zum Glück auch dabei, wie \"Problem\", \"Rabbit Hole\" und \"Controversy\". Dass die Balladenrichtung ebenso eine Stärke von Natalia ist, wissen wir ja schon seit If I Was God\", jetzt kommen mit \"Devils Don't Fly\", \"Watching You\" und \"Marlboro Lights\" weitere Glanzstücke dazu. Des Weiteren schüttelt Natalia mit \"Outta Time\" mal eben einen sehr überzeugenden Retro-Song aus dem Ärmel , als würde sie so etwas ständig machen, und mit Trouble\" lässt sie gar eine stadiontaugliche Hymne auf den geneigten Hörer los. \"Saturday Night\" schließlich ist und bleibt der allerbeste Natalia-Song bisher und vielleicht sogar der beste Popsong des Jahres. Die Instrumentalisierungen der Songs sind einfallsreich und machen einen Song oftmals noch atmosphärischer (die Drums von \"Devils Don't Fly\"!), die Beats erweisen sich als innovativ und unverbraucht.  Natalia Kills hat also nicht einmal den Versuch unternommen, ihr \"Perfectionist\" übertreffen zu wollen, sondern hat gleich ein ganz anderes Album kreiert. Die Songs erzählen allesamt aus Natalias ziemlich turbulenter Vergangenheit, in welcher es teilweise drunter und drüber ging. Daraus entstanden Lyrics, die gleichzeitig ehrlich, authentisch, zum Großteil düster und verzweifelt sind und wunderschön formuliert wurden. Einige Textzeilen gehen einem nicht mehr aus dem Kopf, wenn man sie einmal gehört hat. Es passiert mir eigentlich relativ selten, dass ich den Songtexten auf einem Album so viel Beachtung schenke, aber hier hört man unweigerlich zu. Hoffentlich bleibt Natalia für immer und ewig \"Trouble\", wenn daraus dann solche Lieder entstehen.  Das Album-Booklet ist schön gestaltet und enthält löblicherweise auch die Songtexte, was ja nach wie vor keine Selbstverständlichkeit ist.  Fazit: Mein Flash-Album des Jahres. Ausgeschlossen, dass in diesem Jahr noch etwas erscheinen wird, das mir noch besser gefällt.  Meine Highlights:  1. Saturday Night 2. Television 3. Devils Don't Fly 4. Problem 5. Rabbit Hole
translated_review: It is there. The new album of Natalia Kills. Better than three Christmas together. Or four. The goal was clear: after the great and - with pretty much everyone (few) who have heard it - popular debut album \ "Perfectionist \" were the expectations great, and so an album had to be at least exactly good as this. Anyone who has expected the same thing about "Trouble \", which was already offered on "Perfectionist \", I can say that at this point that he does not waste his valuable time with listening to "trouble \" should. However, if you are not only a fan of \ "Perfectionist \", but rather from Natalia Kills itself, that will be "trouble \" possibly flashing and putting in euphoria, because here is an album that all and even a Natalia kills Album is. Here, no one needs to come with silly lady-gaga comparisons (as they were usual two years ago), Natalia's music sounds significantly different. What is it now, the \ "Trouble \" makes a true, independent Natalia Kills album? First, her singing has become so much better. During the listener at \ "Perfectionist \" first of all, the synthics beats start, this time becoming a significant natalias characteristic, expressive voice to validity, with which they can clearly refine several songs. Already the single \ "Saturday Night \" has lived by Natalias authentic vocals, and this shows, for example, at \ "Devils Don't Fly \", \ "Outta Time \", \ "Marlboro Lights \", \ " "Trouble \" and others. Noteworthy is the musical bandwidth, which Natalia can show \ "Trouble \": There are approximately catchy pop numbers such as \ "Television \", \ "Stop Me \", \ "Boys Do not Cry \" and \ "Daddy's Girl \ "who are anything but everyday mass-produced. Then are dark beat monsters, of which I always especially swarm at Natalia, fortunately, like \ "Problem \", \ "Rabbit Hole \" and \ "ControSy \". That the ballad direction is also a strength of Natalia, we have already known since IF I What God \ ", now come with \" Devils Don't Fly \ ", \" Watching You \ "and \" Marlboro Lights \ "more highlights For this. Furthermore, Natalia shakes a very convincing retro song from the sleeve with \ "Outta Time \", as if she were constantly doing so, and with Trouble \ "Lets a stadium-compatible hymn on the inclined handset. "Saturday Night \" is finally and remains the best Natalia song so far and maybe even the best pop song of the year. The instrumentalization of the songs are incident and make a song often atmospheric (the drums of \ "Devils Don't Fly \"!), The beats prove to be innovative and unused. So Natalia Kills did not even take the attempt to exceed her \ "Perfectionist \", but has created a completely different album. The songs all tell of Natalia's pretty turbulent past, in which it was sometimes left and over. This resulted in lyrics, which are at the same time honest, authentic, mostly gloomy and desperate and were beautifully formulated. Some text lines do not go out of your head anymore when you have heard them. It really rarely happens to me that I attend the lyrics on an album so much attention, but here you think inevitably. Hopefully Natalia remains forever and eternal \ "Trouble \", if there are then such songs. The album booklet is beautifully designed and will also contain the lyrics, which is still not a matter of course. Conclusion: My Flash Album of the Year. Excluded that this year will make something still happen that I like it even better. My highlights: 1. Saturday Night 2. Television 3. Devils Do not Fly 4. Problem 5. Rabbit Hole

product_title: Fall of Giants (The Century Trilogy Book 1)
review_body: Ken Follett has a knack of being able to portray past times as if he has lived through them. This is a Trilogy not to be missed.
translated_review: Ken Follett has a knack of being able to portray past times as if he has lived through them. This is a Trilogy not to be missed.

review_body: Dernier film, dernier chef-d'oeuvre de son auteur. Lola Montès, monté en série de flashbacks plus ou moins subjectifs, se déroule au présent dans un. cirque, où la célèbre danseuse et courtisane, qui offrit jadis ses faveurs auprès de quelques Franz Liszt ou Louis Ier de Bavière, n'est plus, désormais, qu'une femme en déclin transformée en fauve de cirque. On la fait monter en haut du chapiteau, pour que tout le monde la voit, pour mieux sauter, avec ou sans filet ; de toute façon, elle finira par s'écraser. C'est le sujet du film : toute la vulgarité et l'avidité des divertissements populaciers qui se nourrissent de la célébrité et du malheur d'autrui, une vie et une dignité monnayées 1 euro pour satisfaire les foules. Oeuvre virtuose et prophétique qui annonce à sa façon l'ère des magazines people et de la télé-poubelle.    Pour son dernier tour de pellicule, Ophuls a sorti le grand jeu en matière de réalisation et il dépense son génie sans compter : flashbacks narratifs à la Citizen Kane, travellings exceptionnels, couleurs étincelantes, Cinémascope, réalisation \"à l'italienne\", entre baroque et majestuosité (Fellini et Visconti dans un même film), un concentré de savoir-faire qui est comme une encyclopédie cinématographique en moins de deux heures. Martine Carol y est Lola \"Montez\" pour l'éternité. Totalement incompris à sa sortie, mutilé par les producteurs à cause de sa structure par trop audacieuse, ce classique immortel sortit dans sa version définitive en France le 5 décembre 2008, plus d'un demi-siècle après sa sortie. no comment.
translated_review: Last movie, last masterpiece of its author. Lola Montès, set in series of flashbacks more or less subjective, takes place in the present in one. Circus, where the famous dancer and courtesan, who once offered his favors to some Franz Liszt or Louis I of Bavaria, no longer, now, a woman in decline transformed into circus tawny. It is up at the top of the capitaus, so that everyone sees it, to better jump, with or without net; Anyway, she will end up crashing. This is the subject of the film: all the vulgarity and the greed of the populant entertainment that feed on the celebrity and misfortune of others, a life and dignity coined 1 euro to satisfy the crowds. Virtuose and prophetic work that announces the era of people's magazines and trash can. For his last film, Ophuls has released the big game in terms of realization and he spends his genius without counting: Narrative flashbacks at Citizen Kane, exceptional travellings, glittering colors, cinemascope, realization \ "to the Italian \", Between Baroque and Majestuisosity (Fellini and Visconti in the same film), a concentrate of know-how that is like a cinematographic encyclopedia in less than two hours. Martine Carol is Lola \ "Mount \" for eternity. Totally misunderstood, mutilated by the producers because of its too daring structure, this immortal classic went out in its final version in France on December 5, 2008, more than half a century after its release. No how.

product_title: Batman - The Dark Knight, le Chevalier Noir [Édition Collector] [Édition Collector]
review_body: Film excellent, image excellente surtout pour les passages tourné en IMAX, on en regrette que Nolan n'est pas tourné tout le film avec cette caméra! Certains n'aimeront peut être pas le fait que l'on passe du plein écran au format 2.35 (avec bandes noires en haut et en bas)    Malgré l'absence de DTS en français le son reste d'une très bonne qualité. Les bonus présent sur le deuxième disque sont nombreux est tous très intéressant.    Bref ce blu-ray est à posséder absolument!
translated_review: Excellent movie, excellent image especially for the passages shot in Imax, we regret that Nolan is not turned all the movie with this camera!Some will not like may not be the fact that we go from full screen in 2.35 format (with black bands up and down) despite the absence of DTS in French the sound remains of a very good quality.The bonuses present on the second record are many are all very interesting.In short, this Blu-ray is to own absolutely!

review_body: Fripp's opus; technically faultless, the mechanics are pure but there's a warm heart at the core of it all, and final track "Starless" might rank as the greatest single moment in music history.  Sheer class - and by self avowal, Kurt Cobain's favourite album of all times don't you know.
translated_review: Fripp's opus; technically faultless, the mechanics are pure but there's a warm heart at the core of it all, and final track "Starless" might rank as the greatest single moment in music history.  Sheer class - and by self avowal, Kurt Cobain's favourite album of all times don't you know.

review_body: Ich hab mir den Film im Kino angesehen, die Kinofassung gekauft und nun hab ich mir auch noch den Director's Cut bestellt. Der Film ist schlicht und einfach ein filmisches Meisterwerk, ich kann ihn mir immer wieder ansehen. Die komplexe Geschichte und die glaubhaften Charaktere machen \"Watchmen\" zu einem unvergeslichen Erlebnis.   Wer einen durchdachten und gut gemachten Film sehen will, sollte unbedingt zugreifen!
translated_review: I looked at the movie in the cinema, the theatrical version bought and now I have also ordered the Director's Cut.The movie is simply a cinematic masterpiece, I can view it again and again.The complex history and the credible characters make \ "Watchmen \" an unforgettable experience.Who wants to see a thoughtful and well-made movie, should definitely access!

product_title: Abuse of EU Law and Regulation of the Internal Market
review_body: THE FUNDAMENTAL DEBATE ON EU LAW – A VALUABLE CONTRIBUTION TO THE RESEARCH  An appreciation by Phillip Taylor MBE and Elizabeth Taylor of Richmond Green Chambers  If you are reading this, you are probably a lawyer and therefore less likely to be confused by the initial wording of this title: ‘Abuse of EU Law…’ But if you’re not, then you will, or you might.  ‘Abuse’ of whatever law, namely in the context of European Union law, generally refers to instances where the law, which usually emanates from a directive or treaty, is deemed to be so obstructive, obscurantist, obfuscatory… or just plain daft, that human nature being what it is, some people (especially in the United Kingdom), will go to rather creative lengths to flout it, or get round it in some way, either for fun or profit, or both.  Writing in the Foreword to this thought-provoking book, Sir Konrad Schiemann, who from 2004 to 2012 was a judge at the Court of Justice of the EU, offers an example of such ‘abuses’ of a law -- in this case a prosecution under English law some forty years ago for selling a writing desk on a Sunday.  As it was illegal at that time to sell furniture on the Sabbath but not vegetables, the seller advertised his supply of carrots for £200 each with a writing desk thrown in for free.  (Creative or what?)  At the Magistrates’ Court (we assume) the seller was acquitted, but on appeal, convicted.  Yes, he had abused the then existing law, but was he morally wrong?  You decide.  The resulting controversies generated by thousands of such examples of ‘abuse’ really do provide a fertile source of debate across the European Union for those jurisprudentially inclined.  This book by Alexandre Sayde, will add fuel to the flames of argument on both sides – and good thing too, for the issues raised are serious.  Published recently by Hart Publishing, the book is based on a thesis which in 2013, won the First Edition of the European Law Faculties Association Award for (an) Outstanding Doctoral Thesis.  In it, Sayde has identified three major ‘fault lines’ on which EU law is located and which account, he says, for the well established controversies in the field.  These are explained in detail in this thoughtful and scholarly work, particularly the third and final fault line which points up the tension between the fear of public power and the fear of private power.  Those who fear the former (i.e. state control) will tend to reject efforts to prosecute or persecute those who are inclined to flout it.  Those who fear the power of the private sector will naturally wish to prohibit abuses of any law relating to it.  The subject matter of the book, says Sayde, offers a forum ‘in which… the nature and function of EU law can be confronted and examined in a new light’. As such, the book makes an important and valuable contribution to the study and interpretation of EU law.  Every academic or practitioner involved in this area of enquiry and debate should have a copy.he First Edition of the European Law Faculties Association Award for (an) Outstanding Doctoral Thesis.  In it, Sayde has identified three major ‘fault lines’ on which EU law is located and which account, he says, for the well established controversies in the field.  These are explained in detail in this thoughtful and scholarly work, particularly the third and final fault line which points up the tension between the fear of public power and the fear of private power.  Those who fear the former (i.e. state control) will tend to reject efforts to prosecute or persecute those who are inclined to flout it.  Those who fear the power of the private sector will naturally wish to prohibit abuses of any law relating to it.  The subject matter of the book, says Sayde, offers a forum ‘in which… the nature and function of EU law can be confronted and examined in a new light’. As such, the book makes an important and valuable contribution to the study and interpretation of EU law.  Every academic or practitioner involved in this area of enquiry and debate should have a copy.

review_headline: Plantronics Gamecom 377 Micro casque PC binaural filaire Spécial gaming Antibruit Noir
review_body: J'ai commandé ce casque il y a 11 mois déjà, et j'ai dû jouer de la garantie vers Mars ou Avril.  C'est un bon casque, franchement, un peu rigide donc on a peur de le casser en le mettant ou l'enlevant de la tête, mais avec l'habitude ca va.  Qualité Audio OK. Qualité Micro .  La qualité sonore du micro en elle-même était pas mal, malgré un constant bruit de fond, qui pouvait disparaître grâce aux options de Windows.  Mais bizarrement ce micro, sur les deux casque diffèrents que j'ai eu, a à chaque fois subitement arrêter de fonctionner.  En Mars pour le premier (donc 7 mois après l'achat), et le second le 02/07 (donc 4 mois après l'échange de garantie), ce qui fait une durée de vie plutôt courte.  Je ne l'avais pas acheté très cher à l'époque (27.90) donc je ne vais pas trop m'en plaindre, mais vu comme le prix a grimpé, je préferre vous déconseiller de l'acheter, et d'ajouter quelques sous pour acheter un meilleur casque, et qui dure sur le temps pour éviter les dépenses répétées.
translated_review: I ordered this helmet 11 months ago already, and I had to play the warranty on March or April. It's a good helmet, frankly, a little rigid so we are afraid to break it by putting it or removing it from the head, but with the habit it goes. OK audio quality. Micro quality. The sound quality of the microphone in itself was not bad, despite a constant background noise, which could disappear thanks to the options of Windows. But oddly this microphone, on the two different headphones I had, each time suddenly stop working. In March for the first (so 7 months after the purchase), and the second on 02/07 (so 4 months after the exchange of guarantee), which makes a rather short life. I did not buy it very expensive at the time (27.90) so I'm not going too much to complain, but seen as the price climbed, I prefer you to discourage it, and add some sub To buy a better helmet, and lasts time to avoid repeated expenses.

review_body: Oui, ce film est dans un contexte post-apocalyptique, certes! Mais, il est porteur d'un message fort d'un avenir possible. Bien joué, Denzel est dans son rôle, il assure. Il le dit lui-même, il n'y a pas qu'une facette chez l'homme. De notre coté faut-il en arriver là pour dire"il aurait fallu agir !". Le scénario du bon gars qui, Américain du Nord, qui sauve la planète est resservi! Je ne suis pas sûr que ces Messieurs réalisent que c'est lassant et que cela dessert le message et l’attrait du film.

review_body: Jack comes out of hiding to head off a massive terrorist attack while being hunted down by American forces dispatched by President James Heller. A Number of great new cast members include Stephen fry, yvonne strahovski ( Chuck's Sarah) etc. A brilliant line up & some old faces such as jack's old flame audrey raines, & not a suprise to most tony almeida (carlos bernard) who is back but kept on the hush hush to suprise fans, untill David Fury tweeted about his return which was a give away but has been left for the dvd to find out his fate.  Four years after the events of the eighth season, Jack Bauer remains a federal fugitive, and has evaded capture with the aid of Chloe O'Brian. Meanwhile, amid growing concerns over the use of unmanned aerial vehicles in combat, President James Heller pays a historic visit to London to negotiate a treaty over their use. Having heard rumours of an imminent attack against Heller, Bauer resurfaces in the city, where he is apprehended by the CIA and forcibly recruited into joining their investigation, with the promise of amnesty in return for his co-operation. As forces within the White House conspire against him, Bauer realizes that the complexity of the plot extends beyond a presidential assassination, and that the consequences of a successful attack will alter the course of history. With the help of a disgraced CIA agent and a hacker collective preaching free information, he must confront an unseen enemy whose personal vendetta threatens to push the world to the brink of war.  Day 9 11.00AM - 12.00PM  The CIA's London station captures former CTU agent Jack Bauer. Jack remains silent under Station Chief Steve Navarro's questioning, only wavering when Agent Kate Morgan asks if he's looking for someone. Jack is led to an \"enhanced interrogation\" room where Chloe O'Brian is also being held. He knocks out his escorts when an unidentified assistant creates a distraction, and Jack and Chloe escape with further help from the assistant. President James Heller, his daughter Audrey and her husband, White House Chief of Staff Mark Boudreau, are in London, amidst strident public opposition, to negotiate for renewal of a lease for London military base which deploys drones. Mark has been keeping track of progress on Jack's capture and is concerned he might come for the President and Audrey. Meanwhile, using a drone operated from the base, Lt. Chris Tanner provides air support to a military convoy in Afghanistan. The convoy stops and Tanner scans the area with the drone, but loses control and can only watch as it fires a missile at the convoy.  12.00PM - 1.00PM  Chloe is a member of a hacker group dedicated to exposing government secrets. When Jack tells her to find a safe place, she returns to their secret headquarters. Moments later, Jack arrives and begins asking about a man named Derek Yates, a hacker now gone rogue. Derek is shown to have been involved in hacking the drone that fired on the convoy. Tanner is questioned by his superiors, as his personal computer logs show that every command sent to the drone originated from his console. Four soldiers, including two Britons, were killed. President Heller shows signs of dementia which worries Audrey and Mark, not only for the upcoming Parliament meeting but also for his future. Using Chloe's hacker friends, she and Jack track Derek to a drug dealer's apartment while the CIA is able to track Chloe and Jack. When the CIA shows up and engages Jack, Derek and his girlfriend escape with the device that lets them control up to ten drones. Thinking they are safe for now, Derek's girlfriend kills him, steals the plans, and calls her contact, who is revealed to be her mother and the mastermind of the drone attack.  1.00PM - 2.00PM  A reminder of a personal tragedy puts Chloe off her game, while Kate defies orders to continue her hunt for Jack - roping in a reluctant Erik to help. President Hellertries to heal international relations in his address to the British parliament, and Margot proves she is willing to make any sacrifice if it furthers her mission.  2.00PM - 3.00PM  The CIA are hot on Jack's tail as he searches for information inside the US Embassy, but loose cannon Kate takes matters into her own hands. Mark urges the President to sanction an attack to kill the former CTU agent, while an embittered Margot asserts her authority.  3.00PM - 4.00PM  With Jack out of action, Chloe and Kate join forces to prevent the impending attack on London - will it be a case of too little, too late? Meanwhile Margot makes her demands, urging President Heller to surrender himself to her.  4.00PM - 5.00PM  With the hijacked drones winging their way towards London, Prime Minister Davies has to decide how much he can trust President Heller. Jack tries to find Margot by seeking out her arms dealer, but has to deal with a suspicious Boudreau, while interference from an unexpected quarter also threatens to derail the operation. Simone is forced to make a terrible choice.  5.00PM - 6.00PM  Cut off from contact with Chloe, Jack pursues another lead - the injured and unconscious Simone, while her terrorist mother Margot takes drastic action to protect her secrets. Relations between Prime Minister Davies and President Heller continue to sour, leading the latter to make a fateful decision, and back at the CIA's London HQ, computer whizz Jordan is placed in danger by a traitor.  6.00PM-7.00PM (200TH EPISODE)  President Heller lets Jack in on a secret plan he has been hatching. Kate crosses the line to keep her hostage talking, while Jordan faces a life-or-death struggle.  7.00PM - 8.00PM  Jack concocts a plan with Chloe to eliminate the terrorist threat before any more attacks are launched, then he and Kate pursue crucial leads in an attempt to gain the upper hand over the enemy.  8.00PM - 9.00PM  Jack pursues another lead, more determined than ever to bring down the people responsible for killing the president. Kate finally learns the truth about the scandal that has dogged her for the past year, while Audrey confronts her husband about his duplicity.  9.00PM - 10.00PM  When the override device is used to trigger an international incident, Jack leads Kate and Mark on a mission to locate their target before it's too late. Audrey pursues diplomatic channels to prevent all-out war, while Chloe's fate hangs in the balance.  10.00PM - 11.00AM  what a fantastic season Final  Searching Stolnavich's compound, Jack learns that Cheng is leaving at a port and Audrey is pinned by Cheng's sniper. Kate goes to save Audrey while Jack goes to stop Cheng. Kate is able to rescue Audrey from the sniper, but Audrey is killed in an ambush by Cheng's men. As the United States and China come close to war, Jack infiltrates the port alongside Belchek, with Chloe monitoring. After learning of Audrey's death, a vengeful Jack kills all of Cheng's guards and hunts down Cheng, beating him in a brutal fistfight. As the war is about to commence, Jack contacts President Heller, who uses facial and voice recognition software to confirm Cheng's identity and survival. After that is done, Jack decapitates Cheng with a katana in revenge for Audrey. President Heller is able to use the proof of Cheng's survival to get the Chinese to back down with a promise of reparations for the loss of their aircraft carrier and men.  Highly recommend the shows as good as it left us & still the same old Bauer!tries to heal international relations in his address to the British parliament, and Margot proves she is willing to make any sacrifice if it furthers her mission.  2.00PM - 3.00PM  The CIA are hot on Jack's tail as he searches for information inside the US Embassy, but loose cannon Kate takes matters into her own hands. As the United States and China come close to war, Jack infiltrates the port alongside Belchek, with Chloe monitoring. As the war is about to commence, Jack contacts President Heller, who uses facial and voice recognition software to confirm Cheng's identity and survival. After that is done, Jack decapitates Cheng with a katana in revenge for Audrey. President Heller is able to use the proof of Cheng's survival to get the Chinese to back down with a promise of reparations for the loss of their aircraft carrier and men.  Highly recommend the shows as good as it left us & still the same old Bauer!

review_headline: A MOVE TOWARDS THE MIDDLE OF THE ROAD
review_body: I think John Mayer is probably incapable of producing a dull record, and there is plenty here to keep his reputation alive. However, there is nothing here as luminous and resonant as \"Gravity\" or \"Waiting for the World to Change\". Rather, just as the Amazon editorial suggests, we are presented for the most part with a succession of light, tuneful pop songs which do not give Mayer the chance to open out with his remarkable virtuoso Strat playing.    Some tracks do break the mould. Mayer is a master craftsman. As I write, I am listening to the superbly dark, moody and soulful \"Assassin\", which provides a delicious exception to what I have written above. And the plaintive \"Edge of Desire\" has all the makings of a long-term favourite. However, even allowing for the internal wrestling that Mayer talks about in his blog, he has the talent and has had the time to have produced a more daring album than this.    The one consistent element in Mayer's musical mix that is under-used on this album is the Blues. In fact the one time he does make a conscious reference to the blues, namely the Robert-Johnson-via-Eric-Clapton classic \"Crossroads\", it is for me personally the closest Mayer has ever done to an unlistenable recording.    I will be glad to listen to this album in the future, and perhaps my expectations after the landmark \"Continuum\" album and the brilliant \"Live in Los Angeles\" were unreasonable, but this is not all I was hoping for.
translated_review: I think John Mayer is probably incapable of producing a dull record, and there is plenty here to keep his reputation alive. However, there is nothing here as luminous and resonant as \"Gravity\" or \"Waiting for the World to Change\". Rather, just as the Amazon editorial suggests, we are presented for the most part with a succession of light, tuneful pop songs which do not give Mayer the chance to open out with his remarkable virtuoso Strat playing.    Some tracks do break the mould. Mayer is a master craftsman. As I write, I am listening to the superbly dark, moody and soulful \"Assassin\", which provides a delicious exception to what I have written above. And the plaintive \"Edge of Desire\" has all the makings of a long-term favourite. However, even allowing for the internal wrestling that Mayer talks about in his blog, he has the talent and has had the time to have produced a more daring album than this.    The one consistent element in Mayer's musical mix that is under-used on this album is the Blues. In fact the one time he does make a conscious reference to the blues, namely the Robert-Johnson-via-Eric-Clapton classic \"Crossroads\", it is for me personally the closest Mayer has ever done to an unlistenable recording.    I will be glad to listen to this album in the future, and perhaps my expectations after the landmark \"Continuum\" album and the brilliant \"Live in Los Angeles\" were unreasonable, but this is not all I was hoping for.

review_body: Eine CD, die sich für jeden eignet.  Ein Fan vergrößert mit ihr einfach seine Sammlung, aber ein neuer Anhänger oder Interessent bekommt mit \"American Idiot\" ein Making of the greatest hits of Green Day.  Neben absoluten Top-Hits, wie \"Boulevard of Broken Dreams\", \"Wake me up when September ends\" und eben \"American Idiot\" finden sich auch eher unbekannte Songs (z.B. \"St. Jimmy\") darauf und geben einen ersten Überblick über den unvergleichlichen Sound von Green Day.  Einfach spitze:)

review_body: Given that Alfred Hitchcock is probably one of the most discussed and analysed directors of modern cinema, its difficult to find a new slant on his work. Suffice to say The Birds in my opinion is up there with Psycho and North By North West as the very best examples of his work. The casting of Tippi Hedren is inspired and on the Region 2 DVD we see her actual screen tests. The film looks marvellous with crisp colours and crystal clear sound. I am sometimes wary of buying older titles as I have seen some poor transfers onto DVD.  The Birds has the usual mix of small continuity errors often associated with Hitchcock but these are minor grumbles. Its an excellent film with great performances, so four stars .

The Birds has the usual mix of small continuity errors often associated with Hitchcock but these are minor grumbles. Its an excellent film with great performances, so four stars .

review_body: This book had me nodding and going, "yeah!" one minute and ranting and wanting to throw it across the room the next! One moment it is the modern-day feminist track it purports (or people purport it) to be and the next it says we should all have really great hair. I would love to have a massive discussion/argument with Caitlin Moran about this book and find out exactly what she was trying to say, 'cos I'm not entirely sure.
translated_review: This book had me nodding and going, "yeah!" one minute and ranting and wanting to throw it across the room the next! One moment it is the modern-day feminist track it purports (or people purport it) to be and the next it says we should all have really great hair. I would love to have a massive discussion/argument with Caitlin Moran about this book and find out exactly what she was trying to say, 'cos I'm not entirely sure.

review_body: If I'm reading this right, this release is the European cut of the film that has never been released in the States - so, one: does Fox region code their UK releases as 'B' or are they region free?  I've seen the European version before and while it's not as complete as the Director's cut, it still has a lot different edits and overall flow that it's a great way to see a third cut of the film that completists like myself would like to add to our video libraries.

review_headline: Je suis le film préfèré de Jack
review_body: Une vision de la société de consommation et du monde en général d'un type comme vous et moi, d'un monsieur tout le monde (Edward Norton) qui n'en peut plus de la lassitude et de son quotidien de m*, jusqu'au jour où sa vie bascule lorsqu'il rencontre un étrange vendeur de savon nommé Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt).  Fight Club est un de ces films qui vous laisse scotché à votre fauteuil quand il se termine. Le duo Brad Pitt/Edward Norton est incroyable et Helena Bonham Carter interprète magistralement le rôle de Marla Singer. Le scénario et surtout le montage avec l'insertion d'images subliminales sont à proprement parler hallucinants. Vu le travail effectué pour la mise en scène, David Fincher, à qui l'on doit également Seven, est selon moi un des plus grands réalisateurs de notre époque. Les répliques cultes fusent à tout va (\"il s'appelle Robert Paulson\", \"on a frôlé la vie\".), le comportement totalement insouciant de Tyler contraste complètement avec le mal-être et l'angoisse permanente du narrateur. La BO des Dust Brothers est énorme avec la chanson \"where is my mind\". Délire, interrogation, insomnie sont les thèmes récurents d'un film qui ne peut vous laisser insensible.  Pour le Blu-Ray, son incroyable en VO (DTS-HD), surtout si vous disposez d'un home cinéma. Par exemple, le passage du crash dans l'avion donne des frissons. La piste française est quand à elle pas mal non plus (DTS) mais la VO reste tout de même à privilégier. On peut quand même regretter l'absence de son HD en français, surtout que le doublage des voix est excellent. L'image est splendide (restauration 4k) et le disque comporte de nombreux bonus.  Au final, à posséder d'urgence !er l'absence de son HD en français, surtout que le doublage des voix est excellent. L'image est splendide (restauration 4k) et le disque comporte de nombreux bonus.  Au final, à posséder d'urgence !
translated_review: A vision of the consumer society and the world in general of a guy like you and me, of a gentleman (Edward Norton) who can no longer the weariness and his daily life of M *, until 'To the day his life switches when he meets a strange soap vendor named Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt). Fight Club is one of those movies that leaves you tailored to your chair when it ends. The Duo Brad Pitt / Edward Norton is amazing and Helena Bonham Carter interprets the role of Marla Singer. The scenario and especially the assembly with the insertion of subliminal images are strictly speaking hallucinating. Given the work done for the staging, David Fincher, to whom we must also Seven, is one of the greatest directors of our time. review_body: Putting aside the common \"flying away when it's windy\" issue, which everyone else seems to also experience. I found the cover torn where the handle is yesterday. I bought the Weber in December 2014 and it's June 2015 now so it didn't even survive one year. Luckily this came as a promotion with the Weber so I'm not fuming over the poor quality, however if you are looking to buy a cover for your Weber I say go with the heavy duty one. This cover may work for dryer countries but it certainly couldn't handle one UK winter.

product_title: The Magic of Reality: How we know what's really true
review_body: It really is a book for children. There is only  a hint to this effect in the description. And it really is not for fundamentalist believers. That said, Dawkins is a dependably good educator - clear; well-organised; master of his material. For an adult, used to Dawkins's books, it might be a little disappointing as there will not be much here that such a reader did not already know. Great for the children and grandchildren, as long as you don't believe that evolution is the Devil's doctrine and don't mind Dawkins's repeated implication that God is a bit of a fairy story.

review_body: Thirty years ago a high school English teacher wouldn't let me make a book  report on REBECCA because she said it was "junk."  Now I am  amused to see that high school students have it on their  honors reading  lists.  It is nice to know that  REBECCA is finally acceptable because I  always  thought it was a great addition to "literature" as well  as being brilliantly entertaining.

review_body: Dynamite avait laissé une impression en demi teinte, laissant émerger quelques titres excellents, comme le flamboyant «Starchild», parmi dautres bien plus anecdotiques. Le groupe avait montré une tendance à s'égarer dans des sentiers commerciaux ne lui réussissant pas. Le prochain album allait-il confirmer le déclin dune formation incapable de retrouver lexcellence de ses débuts, datant déjà de presque vingt ans? Après 5 années dattente, un record, on était en droit daller dans ce sens. Cependant, la tournée 2010 sétait montrée plutôt encourageante: Jay Kay apparaissait ragaillardi et enthousiaste, semblant avoir enfin laissé derrière lui ses soucis de drogue et se montrant à laise avec son groupe et son public.     A lécoute de lalbum, il est plaisant de constater que Jay est revenu à ses premiers amours. Cuivres, chœurs, guitare, cordes, et surtout ce groove qui rendait si délicieux les deux premiers efforts du groupe sont de retour sur la majorité des titres. Les sonorités électroniques sont délaissées, et le son y gagne en chaleur et en humanité. De ce point de vue, le pari du leader, qui était de revenir à une musique plus charnelle, est réussi. Le bassiste Paul Turner, bien que restant inférieur à lincroyable Stuart Zender apporte une profondeur plus quappréciable aux morceaux, notamment sur «All Good in the Hood» où il fait des merveilles.     Malheureusement, cet album reste terriblement frustrant de par son manque dambition. En effet, si les titres demeurent impeccablement produits, et enrichis par une multitude dinstruments aux interventions parfois plus que convaincantes (le solo de saxophone à la fin de «Smoke and Mirrors») ils ne décollent jamais véritablement et restent à létat de compositions inachevées. Il faut croire que le format court des morceaux ne convient pas au groupe qui semble sinterdire daller plus loin, de voir plus grand, comme il a su si bien le faire auparavant. Cela est dautant plus flagrant que le son organique nous rappelle les compositions ambitieuses des premiers efforts, en particulier les claviers, ou les élans guitaristiques plus rock sur «Rock Dust Light Star» et «Goodbye to my dancer». Le chant de Jay Kay, trahissant parfois une perte de fraicheur, notamment dans les deux ballades, est une preuve supplémentaire de son incapacité à remettre au goût du jour sa magnificence passée.     Au final, plus poussiéreux que lumineux, Rock Dust Light Star laisse un goût plutôt amer, montrant un groupe ayant conservé une partie de son sens mélodique et de son intelligence instrumentale, mais narrivant pas à sémanciper dun format étriqué quil sest lui même imposé.
translated_review: Dynamite had left an impression in half hue, letting emerge some excellent titles, such as the flamboyant "Starchild", among others more anecdotal. The group had shown a tendency to wander in commercial trails that do not succeed. Would the next album confirm the decline of training unable to find the excellence of its debut, dating from almost twenty years? After 5 years of waiting, a record, we were entitled to go in this direction. However, the 2010 tour was rather encouraging: Jay Kay appeared ragailled and enthusiastic, looking for finally left behind her drug concerns and showing up with her group and her audience. At listen to the album, it is pleasant to see that Jay returned to his first loves. Brass, choirs, guitar, strings, and especially this groove that made so delicious the first two efforts of the group are back on the majority of the titles. The electronic sounds are neglected, and the sound wins in heat and in humanity. From this point of view, the bet of the leader, who was to return to more carnal music, is successful. Bassist Paul Turner, although remaining lower than the incredible Stuart Zender brings a depth more than appreciable to the pieces, especially on "All Good in the Hood" where he does wonders. Unfortunately, this album remains terribly frustrating by its lack of ambition. Indeed, if the titles remain immaculately produced, and enriched by a multitude of instruments to the interventions sometimes more than convincing (the solo of saxophone at the end of "Smoke and Mirrors") they never take a truly and remain to the State of unfinished compositions. It must be believed that the short format of the pieces is not suitable for the group that seems to be forbidding to go further, to see bigger, as it has done so well before. This is all the more blatant as the organic sound reminds us of the ambitious compositions of the first efforts, especially keyboards, or more rock guitaristic impulses on "Rock Dust Light Star" and "Goodbye to My Dancer". The song of Jay Kay, sometimes betraying a loss of freshness, especially in the two ballads, is an additional proof of his inability to put on the basis of his past magnificence. In the end, more dusty than bright, Rock Dust Light Star leaves a rather bitter taste, showing a group that has kept some of its melodic sense and its instrumental intelligence, but n does not come to emancipate a narrow format. He even imposed himself.

review_body: J'adore Supertramp depuis mon adolescence. J'avais plusieurs de leurs disques, mais vinyl! J'apprenais les paroles par coeur, j'essayais de les comprendre, ça m'a même aidée pour apprendre l'anglais! Je redécouvre celui-ci en CD, qui est moins connu que Breakfast in America, mais quel chef-d'oeuvre musical, une grande richesse instrumentale, et toujours des textes très riches. Je vais me racheter tous leurs albums en CD petit à petit !
translated_review: I love Supertramp since my adolescence.I had several of their records, but vinyl!I learned the lyrics by heart, I tried to understand them, it even helped me to learn English!I rediscovered this one in CD, which is less known than Breakfast in America, but which musical masterpiece, a great instrumental richness, and always very rich texts.I will redeem my albums in CD little by little!

review_headline: You will have the time of your life!
review_body: Don't buy Dirty Dancing if you want to be swept away by an incredible plot and fabulous sweeping cinematography.  This is NOT what this is about.  It's a simple love story about Baby and Johnny.  Baby is a rich girl who is away with her parents at an old-fashioned hotel which offers dancing lessons, canoeing etc.  While staying at the hotel she comes into contact with Johnny, a cocky, sexy (very sexy) dancer who is forbidden from using his 'dirty' dancing moves!  Romance ensues when Baby offers to cover Johnny's usual dancing partner at a performance.  While Johnny teaches Baby how to dance we get the 'Hungry Eyes sequence' amongst other great tracks.  But will their love survive?  You will enjoy this film if you're a lady and you love a bit of harmless fun which is all this really is.  The dancing is great, Swayze oozes sex appeal and the lines are corny but memorable!  Watch out for 'She's Like The Wind' which Swayze sings himself.  For me it's the best song of the film.

Romance ensues when Baby offers to cover Johnny's usual dancing partner at a performance.  While Johnny teaches Baby how to dance we get the 'Hungry Eyes sequence' amongst other great tracks.  But will their love survive?  You will enjoy this film if you're a lady and you love a bit of harmless fun which is all this really is.  The dancing is great, Swayze oozes sex appeal and the lines are corny but memorable!  Watch out for 'She's Like The Wind' which Swayze sings himself.  For me it's the best song of the film.

product_title: Es scheiden sich die Götter hier....
review_body: Nun möchte ich hier auch einmal meinen Senf dazu geben.     Ersteinaml zu den Rezensionen hier. Ich finde es schon sehr schwach von so manchen Möchtegernmusikexperten und Rammsteinfans. Da wird dieses Album als misserabel, als grausam und so weiter beschimpft und keiner weiß wirklich warum. man ließt dann Begründungen wie \"nix neues\" oder \"die wollen doch nur noch Geld verdienen\"   Hallo? Warum eine Richtung ändern, wenn diese von Erfolg gekrönt ist? Außerdem ist dies ihr Job! Sie verdienen damit nunmal ihr Geld. In meinen Augen sind die meisten \"Fans\" einfach zu sehr verwöhnt. Jede Band hat mal ne Zeit in der die Alben schwächer werden, aber dann gleich zu fordern, dass die Band ihren Hut nimmt, ist eine bodenlose Frechheit.    Ich selbst werde mir dieses Album kaufen, denn was ich bisher von den Neuen Liedern gehört habe, hat durchaus gefallen - und da ist es egal ob die Gitarrenriffs etwas eintönig sind - denn das waren sie von Rammstein schon immer.     Was mich irgendwie verwundert ist, dass hier so mancher Rammstein besser zu kennen scheint, als sich die Band selbst kennt. Also mal ehrlich! Das ist doch hirnrissig. lasst diese Band so arbeiten wie sie es tut - und wenn euch ihre Musik nimmer gefällt, dann lasst es eben - aber schreibt das dann auch so und nicht aus euerer Enttäuschung heraus solchen einen Mist!     Es gab viele Bands die ihren Stil im Laufe der Jahre verändert haben (Metallica) oder eben auch Bands die ihrer Line Treu geblieben sind. Rammstein gehört eben zu zweiteren. Sie machen ihre Musik und damit ist es auch gut!    Klar die Texte haben etwas nachgelassen, stimmt - aber zu behaupten \"Dass das nicht mehr Rammstein ist\" das ist einfach nicht Fair!    Mein bisheriges Fazit:    Das album ist klar durchschnittlich, keine Frage - aber jeder soll das für sich selbst herausfinden!     Grüße  Stefan
translated_review: Now I would like to give my mustard here. First aim to the reviews here. I think it's very weak of some wannabe music experts and rammstein fans. There is this album as Fiertabel, as cruel and so on, and no one really knows why. Let's just do just as "nothing new" or \ "they want to make money only" Hello? Why change a direction if it is crowned by success? Besides, this is your job! They deserve their money with it. In my eyes, most of the \ "fans \" are simply too spoiled too much. Every band has a time in which the albums become weaker, but then to demand that the band takes their hat, is a bottomless impudence. I will buy this album, because what I have heard of the new songs so far, it has certainly liked - and there is no matter if the guitar riffs are a bit monotonous - because they were always that of Rammstein. What somehow surprised me is that many Rammstein seems to know better than the band knows himself. So honestly! That's crisons. Let this band work like them as they do - and if you like your music never, it's just - but writes that, and not from your disappointment out such a crap! There were many bands that have changed their style over the years (Metallica) or even bands that they have remained true to their line. Rammstein is just a second. They make their music and that's good! Sure the texts have a little decreased, right - but claiming \ "that that is no longer Rammstein \" That's just not fair! My current conclusion: The album is clear, no question - but everyone should find out for themselves! Greetings Stefan

product_title: Harry Potter und die Heiligtümer des Todes - Teil 1
review_headline: Harry Potter und die Heiligtümer des Todes Teil 1
review_body: Insgesamt ist dieser Film ganz gut gelungen.   Es wird viel Spannung aufgebaut und was ich am besten finde ist, dass die Verfilmung dieses Mal ausnahmsweise sehr buchnah ist.   Vor allem die Geschichte von den drei Brüdern wurde hier toll dargestellt.   Die einzigen zwei dinge, die mich auch dazu verleitet haben nur 4 Sterne zu vergeben, sind meiner Meinung nach das Ende und, dass zwischendurch kurz etwas langeweile aufkommt, da sich Harry, Ron & Hermine die meiste Zeit mit der Horkrux Suche beschäftigen.   Das Ende, welches ich eben erwähnte, finde ich etwas \"stumpf\" sag ich mal. Der Film endet sehr abrupt, indem Voldemort einfach einen Blitz in die Luft jagt, was eigentlich nicht mal richtig Sinn macht.   Trotzdem ist diese Harry Potter Verfilmung meines Erachtens super geworden, und der Film ist sehr sehenswert.    Kaufempfehlung: Ja.
translated_review: Overall, this film has succeeded quite well.There is a lot of tension built up and what I find best is that the filming is exceptionally very close to this time.Above all, the story of the three brothers was great here.The only two things that have also led me to awarded only 4 stars, in my opinion, are the end and that in between shortly boredom will come up, as Harry, Ron & Hermione deal with the Horkrux search most of the time.The end, which I mentioned, I find something "stump \" I say.The film ends very abruptly by simply chasing Voldemort a flash into the air, which does not really make sense.Nevertheless, this Harry Potter's filming of my belief has become great, and the film is very worth seeing.Buy recommendation: Yes.

review_body: Da ist es also, das neue Afi Album auf das ich vier lange Jahre gewartet habe. Ganz in schwarz kommt es daher, und gleich vorweg: ich bin froh drüber!  Als Afi Fan seit \"The Art of Drowning\" bin ich quasi mit dieser Band aufgewachsen und kenne sie noch von ihrer punkigen/hardcore Seite. Zu meiner absoluten Lieblingsband entwickelten sich die Kalifornier mit ihrem Album \"Sing the Sorrow\" - das Artwork ähnlich düster anmutend - ein Album, dass bis zu meinen absoluten Favoriten zählt. Nach dem ebenfalls großartigen Decemberunderground kam für mich Crash Love doch etwas zu poppig, kitschig und . fröhlich. daher - eine Seite die ich von Afi bisher nicht gewohnt war und die meiner Meinung nach auch nicht wirklich zu der Band passt. Klar gab es auch auf dieser Platte ein paar gute Nummern (Medicate, Torch Song) aber so richtig mitreissen konnte mich \"Crash Love\" nicht wirklich.  Als ich Burials zum ersten Mal durchgehört habe, viel das Fazit gemischt aus: Von der Stimmung her sehr interessant, teilweise aber auch wieder so ungewohnt, dass, vor allem in der zweiten Hälfte, nicht viel hängen geblieben ist. Nach einigen weiteren Durchläufen muss ich aber feststellen: Das Album braucht einfach Zeit!  Die ersten vier Nummern, inklusive stimmigen Intro, finde ich allsamt sehr gelungen - besonderes das rockige \"I hope you suffer\" sticht hervor und erinnert mich stellenweise fast wieder ein bisschen ans gute alte \"Sing the Sorrow\". \"No Resurrection\" geht für mich eindeutig in Richtung Depeche Mode/The Cure - aber doch irgendwie einzigartig und typisch Afi. Von der Single \"17 Crimes\" war ich am Anfang wenig begeistert - aber auch hier lohnt es sich geduldig zu bleiben - nach ein paar Durchläufen rockt die Nummer einfach! \"The Conductor\" bietet Afi typisch einige prägnante Gitarrenriffs und einen etwas eingängigeren Refrain. Bei den nächsten drei Nummern flacht das Niveu dann leider doch ein wenig ab. Nach wie vor am wenigsten anfangen kann ich mit \"Heart Stops\". Ich finde Text und Musik stehen hier einfach ein bisschen im Widerspruch. Dafür entschädigt das mit einer coolen Synth-Line und Effekten unterlegte \"Wild\" und der sehr stimmungsvolle Abschluss \"The Face Beneath The Waves\".  Somit bleibt das Fazit: Ein von der Stimmung her düsteres, mitunter von elktroischen Klängen und Effekten geprägtes Album, welches in sich aber sehr stimmig gestaltet ist und sich gut durchhören lässt. Endlich wieder dieser Schwermut und diese Dunkelheit, die nur diese Band so richtig gut kann! Man muss sich auf jeden Fall auf die Songs einlassen - auch ein genaueres Betrachten der wie immer grandiosen Lyrics lohnt sich!  Einen Stern Abzug gibt es für die 3-4 schwächeren Songs - und weil ich einfach aus der Vergangenheit weiß, dass Afi es noch einen Tick besser können. ;-)
translated_review: So it's the new AFI album I waited for four long years. All in black it comes, and right away: I'm glad over it! As AFI fan since \ "The Art of Drowning \" I grew up almost with this band and knew them from their punks / hardcore page. For my absolute favorite band, the Californians developed with their album "Sing the Sorrow \" - the artwork similarly gloomy - an album that counts up to my absolute favorites. After the also great DecemberUnderground, Crash Love came to my puppy, cheesy and. cheerful. Therefore - one side I have not used to be used by AFI and that in my opinion does not really fit the band. Of course, there was also a few good numbers (Medicate, Torch Song) on ​​this plate but so really Motissisen could not really. When I have heard Burials for the first time, much of the conclusion mixed out: very interesting from the mood, but sometimes so unfamiliar that, especially in the second half, not much hanging. After some other passes I have to determine: the album simply needs time! The first four numbers, including coherent intro, I find all a great manally successful - special the rocky \ "I Hope You Suffer \" stands out and reminds me almost again a bit of the good old "Sing the Sorrow \". "No Resurrection \" is clear to me in the direction of Depeche Mode / The Cure - but somehow unique and typical AFI. From the single \ "17 Crimes \" I was very excited in the beginning - but also worth it patient - after a few runs, the number simply rocks! "The Conductor \" offers AFI typically some concise guitar riffs and a somewhat catchy refrain. At the next three numbers, the Niveu unfortunately flattens a bit. Like the least, I can start with \ "Heart Stops \". I find text and music are just a bit in contradiction. This compensates with a cool synth-line and effects \ "wild \" and the very atmospheric degree "The Face Beneath the Waves \". Thus, the conclusion remains: one of the mood gloomy, sometimes elktotal sounds and effects embossed album, which is designed in itself very coherent and can be heard well. Finally this melancholy and darkness, which only this band can be really good! You definitely have to get involved in the songs - also a closer look at the as always grandiose lyrics is worthwhile! A star deduction is available for the 3-4 weaker songs - and because I just know from the past, that AFI can do it a bit better. ;-)

review_body: The spectre of Mr Luhrmann is present in every scene of this stylised melodrama. Mrs Karenin's shocking intrigue with an army officer is played out in the `theatre' of the fashionable world - so the director starts the action in an actual little tacky theatre, cardboard scenery and all. As the story unfolds we keep drifting into `real world' for a while, then we are back in the theatre again. Eventually Anna will be rejected by Society when she makes an ill-advised appearance at the opera - at a theatre within a theatre within a cinema. It's a metaphor that certainly knows how to outstay its welcome.  And it's not even always well done. In a ballroom scene dancers freeze in attitudes, like a corps du ballet, while Anna and Vronsky make an impassioned exhibition of themselves around the floor. Ginger and Fred could have carried it off with feeling and grace but all the device does here is bring it forcibly to our attention that Keira Knightly & Aaron Taylor-Johnson are both, as we Lancastrians say, about as lish as a stone trough.  There's not much passion in the acting either. Knightly is the arty director's favourite dolly: put her in a hat and let her gaze at the lens through a black lace veil and, with suitable music, the audience will helpfully project appropriate emotions onto that porcelain face. But beyond her own three or four stock expressions she has no reserves to surprise us - and tragedy does need an actress who can tear herself and her audience to pieces.  Vronsky is certainly handsome. With his floppy curls (I'm not sure about those strange blond highlights, though) he has a look of the young David Hemmings. `Cor! Llanfairpyllgwingeth .er.gogogoch!' I thought to myself when he first appeared, but he turns out to be not as much fun as the eyeliner and cute little tash would lead you to expect. Yes, he might turn your head for a fortnight, but fling yourself under a steam engine, no.  The surprise of the film is Jude Law's Karenin, a quiet but eventually moving performance. The secondary love-story, of Levin and Kitty, is touching too. The frocks are very nice. But minor felicities are not enough to save a long tricksy film with a great big void at its heart.ut eventually moving performance. The secondary love-story, of Levin and Kitty, is touching too. The frocks are very nice. But minor felicities are not enough to save a long tricksy film with a great big void at its heart.

review_body: Tim Burton nous signe une comédie musicale sombre et cynique, avec des chansons poignantes, tristes, coléreuses. Les personnages sont bons; Johnny Depp en tueur sanguinaire est persuasif voir fascinant. Un film où se mèlent l'injustice, la vengeance, la pauvreté dans un bain de sang et de tartelettes à la viande. Les voix magnifiques et plaintives contribuent à rendre une atmosphère inquiétante et touchante à la fois. Un bon Tim Burton.
translated_review: Tim Burton signs a dark and cynical musical, with poignant, sad, foray songs.The characters are good;Johnny Depp in bloody killer is persuasive see fascinating.A film where injustice are underworking, revenge, poverty in a blood bath and meat tartlets.The magnificent and plaintive voices help to make a disturbing and touching atmosphere at the same time.A good Tim Burton.

review_body: Premier disque qui réunit les complices Graham Nash et David Crosby, il fait suite à un split au sein du quatuor CSNY, split que les quatre membres mettent à profit en se plongeant dans des projets personnels. Du côté des deux artistes qui nous intéressent, Crosby sort un magnifique If I Could Only Remember My Name, tandis que Nash donne le jour au non moins magnifique Songs For Beginners, avant que le duo ne s'envole pour l'Europe et une tournée ensemble (1971). Au sortir de celle-ci, le duo y va d'un LP, sobrement intitulé Graham Nash David Crosby. Nous sommes en 1972 et leur collaboration n'est pas prête de s'achever puisqu'ils sont toujours dans le coup et ensemble. Leur investissement sur ce projet à deux aboutit à un album qui alterne d'excellents morceaux apportés par l'un et par l'autre. Graham et David bénéficient de l'apport d'un line-up constitué de musiciens de studio chevronnés comme Craig Doerge (claviers), Danny Kortchmar (guitare), Leland Sklar (basse) et de Russell Kunkel (batterie). Sur un plan musical, il s'inscrit donc dans la continuité de leurs opus personnels. Les deux artistes sont alors à leur point culminant artistique. Nash contribue en apportant comme dot l'efficace Southbound Train (le duo est accompagné par des membres du Dead), l'agréable Stranger's Room, Girl To Be On My Mind, le sympathique Frozen Smiles et le single qui a auréolé l'album par sa présence dans les charts (Immigration Man). Le registre est pop et chargé d'émotion. Crosby, plus introspectif, plus cérébral, fournit 5 des onze titres de ce disque. Parmi ceux-ci, The Wall Song et Page 43, les plus représentatifs, ainsi que l'intriguant Where Will I Be, Whole Cloth et Games. Par ailleurs, les harmonies vocales qui constituent leur marque de fabrique, atteignent ici des sommets. Chaque piste est forte et contribue à faire de ce premier album la plus accomplie de leurs différentes coopérations. Gros succès commercial, c'est un grand moment de très bonne musique des années 70.rès bonne musique des années 70.
translated_review: First disc that brings together the Graham Nash and David Crosby accomplices, it follows a split within the CSNY Quartet, Split that the four members use by plunging into personal projects. On the side of the two artists who interest us, Crosby comes out a beautiful IF I Could Only Reember My Name, while Nash gives birth to no less magnificent Songs for Beginners, before the duo flies over Europe and a tour Together (1971). At the end of it, the duo goes from an LP, soberly titled Graham Nash David Crosby. We are in 1972 and their collaboration is not ready to end because they are always in the shot and together. Their investment on this two project completes an album that alternates excellent pieces brought by one and the other. Graham and David enjoy the contribution of a line-up consisting of experienced studio musicians like Craig Doerge (keyboards), Danny Kortchmar (guitar), Leland Sklar (bass) and Russell Kunkel (battery). On a musical plane, it is therefore part of the continuity of their personal opus. The two artists are then at their extreme artistic point. Nash contributes by bringing as dot the effective Southbound Train (the duo is accompanied by members of the DEAD), the pleasant Stranger's Room, Girl to Be on My Mind, the friendly Frozen Smiles and the single that has haired the album by His presence in the charts (MAN immigration). The registry is pop and emotionally charged. Crosby, more introspective, more cerebral, provides 5 of the eleven titles of this disc. Among these, The Wall Song and the most representative, as well as the intriguing where Will I Be, Whole Cloth and Games. Moreover, vocal harmonies that constitute their trademark, reach here vertices. Each track is strong and helps to make this most accomplished album of their different cooperation. Big commercial success, it's a great moment of very good music from the 70s. Show good music from the 70s.

review_headline: Forgot how good this film was!
review_body: I'd remembered liking the plot behind this film after first seeing it in the 80's.  The recent film 'Hunger Games' reminded me to take another look at running man, with me half expecting to be dissatisfied by Arnie's cheesiness on top of grainy 80's film.  However, it was good quality film reproduction, with Arnie being reasonably well behaved, and great to see again rekindling my appreciation of 80's classics.
translated_review: I'd remembered liking the plot behind this film after first seeing it in the 80's.  The recent film 'Hunger Games' reminded me to take another look at running man, with me half expecting to be dissatisfied by Arnie's cheesiness on top of grainy 80's film.  However, it was good quality film reproduction, with Arnie being reasonably well behaved, and great to see again rekindling my appreciation of 80's classics.

review_body: J'aime Clapton. enfin, je l'ai surtout aimé lorsqu'il jouait sur Gibson avec John Mayall et ses Bluesbreakers ou Cream. Depuis, son jeu s'est amélioré et devenu plus subtil mais le son qui avait fait ses lettres de noblesse a un peu disparu avec l'arrivée de Brownie puis Blackie comme instruments fétiches. Autant dire que ça fait quelques années que son son ne me convainc pas franchement. Exception faite de son album hommage à Robert Johnson qui est magnifique, ça fait quelques années que j'ai décroché. Mais passons.  Réduction de personnel. Depuis des lustres, Clapton est accompagné par un guitariste rythmique (Andy Fairweather Low ou Doyle Bramhall II pour les principaux). Là, il est tout seul ! A ce détail près (conséquent quand même), on retrouve les musiciens habituels Nathan East (basse), Steve Gadd (batterie).  Les chansons sont issues de différents concerts donnés au Japon. Les lieux changent mais la set list est quasiment identique à celle du concert de Hyde Park donné en . 1997 ! Les interprétations ne sont pas mauvaises évidemment et slowhand est plutôt du genre tatillon à ne rien laisser au hasard mais je le trouve simplement ennuyeux sur ce live.  Ce DVD n'apporte rien à la carrière de Clapton si ce n'est un peu de cash pour commander une deuxième Ferrari sur mesure !
translated_review: I like Clapton. Finally, I really liked him when he played Gibson with John Mayall and his Bluesbreakers or Cream. Since then, his game has improved and become more subtle but the sound that had made his letters of nobility a little disappeared with the arrival of Brownie then Blackie as fetish instruments. In other words, it's been a few years since his sound does not convince me frankly. Except for his album Tribute to Robert Johnson who is beautiful, it's been a few years since I won. But let's go. Staff reduction. Since chandeliers, Clapton has been accompanied by a rhythmic guitarist (Andy Fairweather Low or Doyle Bramhall II for the main). There he is alone! At this detail (consistent), we find the usual Nathan East (bass) musicians, Steve Gadd (battery). The songs come from different concerts given in Japan. The places change but the set list is almost identical to that of the concert of Hyde Park given in. 1997 ! The interpretations are not bad obviously and Slowhand is rather the fussy genre to leave nothing at random but I simply find it boring on this live. This DVD does not bring anything to the quarry of Clapton if it is a little cash to order a second custom ferrari!

review_body: What an amazing story! I watched the film first and thought it was so touching and magical that I wanted to read more, I did and this book didn't let me down. I rate this 5 star because its gripping and magical and comes to life in your head. Yann Martel writes this story like you could actually believe that It could happen and makes you feel such empathy for pi that you actually feel like your sat in the boat with him. I recommend this book to anyone that has a colourful imagination and open mind.

Yann Martel writes this story like you could actually believe that It could happen and makes you feel such empathy for pi that you actually feel like your sat in the boat with him. I recommend this book to anyone that has a colourful imagination and open mind.

review_body: Nicholas Sparks' book, A Walk to Remember, was one of the best books I have ever read.  From the very beginning the book pulls you in and you can't escape until the last sentence is read.  Nicholas Sparks wrote this  book so well that while you are reading, you feel like you know these  characters.  You are able to relate with every emotion the two characters  have.  When they laugh, you laugh, when they cry, you cry.   I highly  recommend "A Walk to Remember" to anyone who is looking for a  touching romance that moves you so much that within the short duration of  finishing it, you've emptied a box of tissues.
translated_review: Nicholas Sparks' book, A Walk to Remember, was one of the best books I have ever read.  From the very beginning the book pulls you in and you can't escape until the last sentence is read.  Nicholas Sparks wrote this  book so well that while you are reading, you feel like you know these  characters.  You are able to relate with every emotion the two characters  have.  When they laugh, you laugh, when they cry, you cry.   I highly  recommend "A Walk to Remember" to anyone who is looking for a  touching romance that moves you so much that within the short duration of  finishing it, you've emptied a box of tissues.

review_body: Que dire sur ce film?  Certainement le plus beau film, ou l'un des plus beaux encodé pour le format Blu ray. Donc à mon avis déjà à la base une très belle histoire époustouflante  de lyrisme et belle à souhait.  Des images magnifiques, à couper le souffle, vraiment!  Pas du tout gâcher par un mauvais encodage, ou un mauvais master. Oui, oui on a compris!  Et puis j'ai pas investi dans du matériel HD pour voir de la soupe visuel. (J'hésite encore à acheter le Seigneur des Anneaux en Blu ray)  En conclusion, courrez acheter ce magnifique Blu ray, surtout si c'est votre premier, vous ne serez pas déçu.   Mon précieux.    Ma note est de 5/5

review_body: Voici sans aucun doute l'album de Kate Bush le plus riche et le plus original de sa carrière: arrangements, textes, voix et ambiances sont surprenants. review_headline: Mit Vollgas auf der Flucht vor Nixons Amerika
review_body: \"Vanishing Point - Fluchtpunkt San Francisco\" ist fraglos einer der besten Roadmovies der Filmgeschichte. Zudem auch ein zeit- und kulturgeschichtliches Dokument, da der Plot und die Hauptfiguren stellvertretend für wichtige gesellschaftliche Strömungen die USA der frühen 1970er Jahre stehen.     Die Rahmenhandlung ist sehr einfach: Der ehemalige GI, Polizist und Rennfahrer Kowalksi bekommt den Auftrag, ein \"Musclecar\" (\"Gattungsbezeichnung\" für US-Sportwagen verschiedener Marken mit besonders starkem V8-Motor ca.1965 bis Ölkrise 1973), einen weißen Dodge Challanger, von Denver nach San Francisco zu überführen, und dies innerhalb von fünfzehn Stunden. Kowalski, dargestellt von Barry Newman (manchen vielleicht noch bekannt aus der Rechtsanwalts-Serie \"Petrocelli\")zieht jedoch bald die Aufmerksamkeit der Polizei auf sich. Ebenso bekommt der schwarze Radio DJ \"Super Soul\" Wind von Kowalskis privatem roadrace und begleitet ihn von nun an mittels an ihn gerichtete Radiobotschaften, unterstützt ihn sogar durch das Verraten von geplanten Polizeimaßnahmen über den Sender. Supersoul hört nämlich den Polizeifunk ab. Auf seiner Fahrt putscht sich Kowaski mit Amphetaminen auf, trifft  auf allerlei Außenseiter der US-Gesellschaft - Beispielsweise einem Biker mit Hippie-Attitüde und seine Freundin. Die Vertreter der \"Gegenkultur\" unterstützen Kowalski, der sich der \"schweigenden Mehrheit\" gegenübersieht. Wird es Kowalski gelingen, seinen Auftrag auszuführen - oder schnappen ihn die Bullen?     Die Inszenierung legt naturgemäß Hauptaugenmerk auf Action mit schneller Schnittfolge. Ebenfalls bedeutsam die Filmmusik, bestehend aus zeitgenössischem Soul und Rock.     Kulturgeschichtlich betrachtet, steht Kowalski für die (relative) Jugend, die sich enttäuscht durch die Lügen und Brutalität des Vietnamkriegs vom Establishment abgewandt hat. Ebenso vom Mainstream der US-Gesellschaft ausgeschlossen sind die Schwarzen, verkörpert durch DJ SuperSoul. Bedrohlich für die \"Schweigende Mehrheit\" des Nixon-Amerika standen die Hippies und Drogenfreaks, die ja im Film ebeso vorkommen, ja Kowalski selbst nimmt Amphetamine, um fit zu bleiben. Diese Allianz der Außenseiter sieht sich der selbstgerechten Mehrheit gegenüber, verkörpert durch Polizei und einem zur Selbstjustiz entschlossenen Mob, die gegen den \"letzten amerikanischen Helden\" Kowalski und seinen Unterstützer DJ Super Soul vorgehen wollen.     DVD-Umsetzung: Ton im Englischen Original in Ordnung, kein Rauschen, Stimmen und Musik klar. Bildqualität (auf Sony Full HD Screen) recht gut, Schärfe guter DVD Standard, Farben sehr kräftig und satt.     Eine Anmerkung zu den Ein-Punkt Bewertungen. Jeder hat das Recht, Filme mit niedriger Punkteanzahl zu bewerten. Doch denke ich, dies ist in diesem Fall ungerecht, da \"Vanishing Point\" nun einmal deutlich ein Film des Genres \"Roadmovie\" ist, und innerhalb dieses einer der besten. Ich kann, nur als Beispiel, mir keine Rosamunde Pilcher Romanze anschauen und dann schlecht bewerten, weil ich nun mal keine Romanzen mag. Kritik ist in Ordnung, sie sollte aber nach klaren Grundsätzen abgegeben werden.     Da es sich hier um einen absoluten Klassiker handelt, dessen DVD Umsetzung ebenfalls passabel hinbekommen wurde, ein satter 5-Punkter.
translated_review: \ "Vanishing Point - San Francisco's vanishing point" is unquestionably one of the best roadmovies of film history. In addition, a time and cultural history document, as the plot and the main characters are representative of important social currents the USA of the early 1970s. The framework is very simple: the former GI, police officer and racer Kowalksi gets the order, a \ "musclecar \" (\ "generic designation" for US sports cars of various brands with a particularly strong V8 engine about 1965 to oil crisis 1973), A white Dodge Challanger to transfer from Denver to San Francisco, and this within fifteen hours. Kowalski, represented by Barry Newman (some maybe even known from the lawyer series \ "Petracelli \"), but soon attracts the police attention. Likewise, the black Radio DJ \ "Super Soul \" wind from Kowalski's private Roadrace gets and accompanies him from now on the radiographies directed to him, even supports him by betraying planned police measures over the station. Supersound destroys the police foot. On his journey, Kowaski takes up with amphetamines, applies to all sorts of outsiders of the US society - such as a biker with Hippie Attituation and his girlfriend. The representatives of the "counterculture \" support Kowalski, who opposes the "silent majority". Will Kowalski succeed in carrying out his order - or grab the bulls? Naturally, the production focuses on action with quick cut sequence. Also significant the film music, consisting of contemporary soul and rock. Cultural historical, Kowalski has faced for the (relative) youth disappointed by the lies and brutality of the Vietnam War from the Establishment. Likewise excluded from the mainstream of the US society are the black, embodied by DJ Supersound. Threatening for the "silent majority \" of Nixon America were the hippies and drug freaks, which are in the movie Ebeso, yes Kowalski himself assumes amphetamins to stay fit. This alliance of the outsider faces the self-righteous majority, embodied by police and a MOB determined for self-jerms, which want to proceed against the "last American hero" Kowalski and his supporter DJ Super Soul. DVD implementation: sound in the English original okay, no noise, voices and music clear. Image quality (on Sony Full HD Screen) pretty good, sharpness good DVD standard, colors very strong and full. A note to the one-point ratings. Everyone has the right to evaluate films with a low number of points. But I think this is unfair in this case, because \ "Vanishing Point \" is now clearly a movie of the Genres \ "Roadmovie \", and within this one of the best. I can, only as an example, do not look at any of me posamunde pilcher romance and then race badly because I like no romances. Criticism is okay, but it should be handed over according to clear principles. Since this is an absolute classic, whose DVD implementation was also passable, a score 5-point.
